episodes.summary: After undergoing a PET-CAT scan and fearing the worst, Walt takes lawyer Saul's advice and hunkers down for a marathon session of cooking product; Jesse's romance with his landlady is heating up, but must cool off quickly when he and Walt head for the desert to take care of business.

episodes.name: Over
episodes.summary: The Whites throw a party to thank family and friends for their support through Walt's trying time, but it turns ugly when he and Hank get into a bitter argument; later, a pent-up and fed-up Walt tries to occupy his time with home-improvement projects. Worried about Walt's physical and emotional states, Skyler confides in her boss; Jane keeps her relationship with Jesse a secret from her father.

episodes.name: Mandala
episodes.summary: Saul suggests a new business partner for Walt and Jesse after they begin to lose their dealers to some unforeseen circumstances. At work, Skyler confronts Ted after she uncovers some unnerving information; and Jesse opens up to Jane about what he does for a living, with disastrous results.

episodes.name: Phoenix
episodes.summary: A new addition joins the White family as Walter Jr. attempts to help out his struggling family by launching a new Web site. Elsewhere, Jesse's addiction worsens and his relationship with Jane begins to negatively impact Walt and her father.

episodes.name: ABQ
episodes.summary: In the Season 2 finale, Skyler's frustration with Walt's secrecy boils over; Jesse is dealt a devastating blow that leads him down a path of self-destruction, and only Walt is willing to help him; and a grief-stricken Donald experiences more tragedy.

episodes.name: No Más
episodes.summary: In the third-season premiere, Walt faces a new threat on a new front and deals with an increasingly angry Skyler, who must consider what to do next with her life and the kids'. Meanwhile, Jesse comes face-to-face with some startling self-revelations.

episodes.name: Caballo sin Nombre
episodes.summary: Despite ever-increasing tension between Walt and Skyler, he pulls out all the stops in an effort to reconcile with the family. Elsewhere, Saul is instrumental in getting Jesse involved in a most-unusual investment opportunity.

episodes.name: I.F.T.
episodes.summary: Walt disregards Skyler's demands and the rift between them widens dramatically, pushing her to take even more drastic steps. Meanwhile, continuing anxiety and panic attacks plague Hank, which leads to a serious situation at the Drug Enforcement Agency.

episodes.name: Green Light
episodes.summary: Skyler's latest bit of bad news proves to be a blow to Walt, and his loss of control endangers his job and his business relationships with Saul and Jesse. Hank goes full-speed ahead into the agency's investigation of the blue-meth case, while Jesse cooks up a new plan.

episodes.name: Más
episodes.summary: When Gus intensifies efforts to persuade Walt to get back in the meth business, Jesse takes exception and a rift appears in his and Walt's personal relationship. Meanwhile, Skyler's new relationship isn't turning out as she'd like; and Marie tells Skyler about her concerns for the increasingly troubled Hank and his well-being.

episodes.name: Sunset
episodes.summary: Walt moves into new digs and a distraught Walter Jr. demands to know just where his parents' relationship stands. Meanwhile, Hank's investigation is beginning to hit too close to home for Walt, causing serious concerns for him and Jesse.

episodes.name: One Minute
episodes.summary: Hank's behavior becomes increasingly more unpredictable and volatile, which leads to a confrontation with Jesse and problems at the DEA; Skyler wants Walt to make a deal; and Gus' decisions result in some serious consequences.

episodes.name: I See You
episodes.summary: The White and Schrader families anxiously await word on Hank's condition. Meanwhile, Jesse takes care of business at the lab while Walt tries to make peace with Gus, but after witnessing a terrifying flash of anger, Walt starts to fear for his and his family's lives.

episodes.name: Kafkaesque
episodes.summary: Hank's stay in the hospital is accompanied by some daunting bills, but Skyler thinks she has a way of dealing with them. Meanwhile, some of the problems between Walt and Gus are ameliorated; and Jesse seeks more independence and grabs a profitable opportunity that presents itself.

episodes.name: Fly
episodes.summary: When Walt becomes driven to distraction by a contaminant in the lab, he refuses to cook meth until they are able to get rid of it.

episodes.name: Abiquiu
episodes.summary: Skyler's increased involvement in Walt's business causes him concern; Hank's recovery is plagued by setbacks; and Jesse makes a surprising discovery as he gets more involved in his new enterprise.

episodes.name: Half Measures
episodes.summary: Jesse ignores Walt's advice and finds himself in a dangerous situation. Fearing for Jesse's safety, Walt takes drastic measures to try to put things right. And tragedy strikes following an unexpected confrontation.

episodes.name: Full Measure
episodes.summary: Jesse goes on the lam in the third-season finale. But Mike is right on his heels, so Walt works a deal with Gus and comes up with an unsettling plan that might help guarantee both his and Jesse's safety.

episodes.name: Box Cutter
episodes.summary: In the Season 4 opener, Walt and Jesse are confronted by the life-threatening consequences of their actions. Meanwhile, Skyler contends with a puzzling disappearance, and Marie finds it difficult to help a recovering Hank.

episodes.name: Thirty-Eight Snub
episodes.summary: Walt tries to establish a new alliance as he plots his next move. Meanwhile, Skyler urges Walt to consider a business opportunity that could keep the family safe.

episodes.name: Open House
episodes.summary: Goings-on at Jesse's place start to get out of control; Skyler reluctantly turns to Saul for help; Marie settles back into an old habit; and Hank hears from an old friend who needs assistance.

episodes.name: Bullet Points
episodes.summary: The Cartel makes a power move; Skyler and Walt reveal something embarrassing to the family; and Jesse's misdeeds bring some unwanted attention.

episodes.name: Shotgun
episodes.summary: Jesse's disappearance leaves Walt fearing the worst; Skyler has a surprising reunion; and Hank gives Det. Roberts bad news.

episodes.name: Cornered
episodes.summary: A shocking discovery unsettles Skyler; Walter Jr. leans on his father to make a special purchase; Mike gets surprise help from Jesse.

episodes.name: Problem Dog
episodes.summary: A frustrated Walt takes on a risky gamble; Skyler encounters problems with her latest business venture; Hank requires Walter Jr.'s services for an unusual reason.

episodes.name: Hermanos
episodes.summary: Skyler devises a plan to cure her money woes; Hank recruits Walt to help him work out a theory, while Walt grows impatient with Jesse.

episodes.name: Bug
episodes.summary: Mistakes from Skyler's past prove to be impactful to the present; Gus is spurred to action against rivals; Jesse seeks help from Walt but the results are mixed.

episodes.name: Salud
episodes.summary: The family becomes gravely concerned when Walt doesn't show up for his son's 16th birthday celebration. And Jesse's lab skills are tested in Walt's absence.

episodes.name: Crawl Space
episodes.summary: Walt moves to protect his secret and Gus; Skyler is stymied in her attempt to help Ted with his financial problem.

episodes.name: End Times
episodes.summary: Hank leans on Gomez to explore one final lead, as Walt scrambles to protect his family. Meanwhile, Jesse learns some unsettling news and races to share it with Walt.

episodes.name: Face Off
episodes.summary: The fourth season ends with Walt and Jesse squaring off against Gus. Elsewhere, Walt acquires a surprise confederate with help from Saul.

episodes.name: Live Free or Die
episodes.summary: In the series 5 premiere, Walt deals with the aftermath of the explosion, while Hank wraps up his investigation of Gus and his criminal empire.

episodes.name: Madrigal
episodes.summary: Walt and Jesse seek out an unlikely partner for a new business venture. The DEA follows up new leads in its investigation.

episodes.name: Hazard Pay
episodes.summary: Walt and Jesse put a business plan into action. Walt confesses a secret to Marie.

episodes.name: Fifty-One
episodes.summary: Walt celebrates another birthday. Skyler considers her options. An associate complicates Walt and Jesse's plan.

episodes.name: Dead Freight
episodes.summary: Walt's team must get creative to obtain the materials they need to continue their operation.

episodes.name: Buyout
episodes.summary: Walt, Jesse, and Mike struggle over the future of their business, as occupational hazards weigh on Jesse.

episodes.name: Say My Name
episodes.summary: Walt takes control of business matters as Mike grapples with the consequences of his actions.

episodes.name: Gliding Over All
episodes.summary: Walt ties up loose ends. Seeing the evidence of his success, he makes a startling and dangerous decision.

episodes.name: Blood Money
episodes.summary: As Walt and Jesse adjust to life out of the business, Hank grapples with a troubling lead.

episodes.name: Buried
episodes.summary: While Skyler's past catches up with her, Walt covers his tracks. Jesse continues to struggle with his guilt.

episodes.name: Confessions
episodes.summary: Jesse decides to make a change, while Walt and Skyler try to deal with an unexpected demand.

episodes.name: Rabid Dog
episodes.summary: An unusual strategy starts to bear fruit, while plans are set in motion that could change everything.

episodes.name: To'hajiilee
episodes.summary: Things heat up for Walt in unexpected ways.

episodes.name: Ozymandias
episodes.summary: Everyone copes with radically changed circumstances.

episodes.name: Granite State
episodes.summary: Events set in motion long ago move toward a conclusion.

episodes.name: Felina
episodes.summary: The acclaimed crime drama comes to a close in the series finale.

name: The Office
summary: Steve Carell stars in The Office, a fresh and funny mockumentary-style glimpse into the daily interactions of the eccentric workers at the Dunder Mifflin paper supply company. Based on the smash-hit British series of the same name and adapted for American Television by Greg Daniels, this fast-paced comedy parodies contemporary American water-cooler culture. Earnest but clueless regional manager Michael Scott believes himself to be an exceptional boss and mentor, but actually receives more eye-rolls than respect from his oddball staff.

episodes.name: Pilot
episodes.summary: A documentary crew arrives at Dundler Mifflin to observe the workplace. Michael Scott tries to paint a happy picture while facing potential downsizing.

episodes.name: Diversity Day
episodes.summary: Corporate sends in a consultant after Michael attempts to imitate a Chris Rock routine. Michael ends up staging his own Diversity Day event.

episodes.name: Health Care
episodes.summary: Dwight ends up in charge of picking a new health care plan.

episodes.name: The Alliance
episodes.summary: With Dwight worried about downsizing, Jim agrees to an alliance; Michael tries to increase moral be throwing a birthday party for Meredith.

episodes.name: Basketball
episodes.summary: Michael challenges the warehouse staff to a basketball game versus the office staff.

episodes.name: Hot Girl
episodes.summary: Several male staff members vie for the attention of an attractive purse sales woman.

episodes.name: The Dundies
episodes.summary: Michael hosts the annual Dundies awards.

episodes.name: Sexual Harassment
episodes.summary: Michael's continual sending of explicit e-mail forwards forces Dunder Mifflin to review it's sexual harassment policy; Pam's mom makes a visit to the office.

episodes.name: Office Olympics
episodes.summary: With Michael and Dwight out of the house, Jim organizes an office Olympics.

episodes.name: The Fire
episodes.summary: A fire starts in the office kitchen.

episodes.name: Halloween
episodes.summary: Michael has to fire someone on Halloween.

episodes.name: The Fight
episodes.summary: Michael challenges Dwight to a fight at his martial arts studio.

episodes.name: The Client
episodes.summary: Jan helps Michael with an important pitch for a client; The staff discovers a screenplay in Michael's office.

episodes.name: Performance Review
episodes.summary: Michael uses each employee's performance review to discuss his relationship with Jan.

episodes.name: E-Mail Surveillance
episodes.summary: The office staff finds out that Michael has set up e-mail surveillance.

episodes.name: Christmas Party
episodes.summary: At the office Christmas party, Michael changes secret santa into a gift exchange.

episodes.name: Booze Cruise
episodes.summary: Michael takes the staff on a booze cruise.

episodes.name: The Injury
episodes.summary: Michael accidentally burns his foot on his George Foreman Grill, but insists on coming to work anyway. When none of his employees, except for Dwight , help him, Michael feels under-appreciated. Meanwhile, Dwight starts acting strangely nice to everyone, especially Pam.

episodes.name: The Secret
episodes.summary: Jim is forced into spending time with Michael so that he will not reveal Jim's feelings for Pam. Meanwhile, Oscar takes a "sick day" and Dwight investigates whether he is actually sick.

episodes.name: The Carpet
episodes.summary: A disgusting "thing" – implied to be human feces – is left in Michael's office, and he tries to discover who did it. While his carpet is being replaced, he uses Jim's desk, forcing him to move away from Pam into the annex.

episodes.name: Boys and Girls
episodes.summary: When Jan comes to the office for a women in the office session, Michael stages a men's only session.

episodes.name: Valentine's Day
episodes.summary: Michael has a big meeting in New York with Jan and the companies new CEO; Pam deals with all the Valentine's Day deliveries hoping Roy will remember to send her something.

episodes.name: Dwight's Speech
episodes.summary: Dwight has to make a big speech when he is named Salesmen of the Year.

episodes.name: Take Your Daughter to Work Day
episodes.summary: Staff members bring their children to work.

episodes.name: Michael's Birthday
episodes.summary: Michael's birthday coincides with Kevin awaiting the news to see if he has skin cancer.

episodes.name: Drug Testing
episodes.summary: After Dwight finds a joint in the office park, he goes overboard with an investigation.

episodes.name: Conflict Resolution
episodes.summary: Michael's attempt to resolve conflict resolution in the office just leads to more conflict.

episodes.name: Casino Night
episodes.summary: The office holds a casino night for charity in the warehouse.

episodes.name: Gay Witch Hunt
episodes.summary: Michael finds out that Oscar is gay after Oscar files a complaint when Michael uses a homosexual slur.

episodes.name: The Convention
episodes.summary: Michael and Dwight go to a convention that Jim is also attending; Pam goes on her first date after her engagement.

episodes.name: The Coup
episodes.summary: After Jan discovers Michael has been having "movie Monday's", Angela encourages Dwight to make a move for Michael's job.

episodes.name: Grief Counseling
episodes.summary: Michael organizes grief counseling sessions following the death of his old boss, Ed Truck.

episodes.name: Initiation
episodes.summary: Dwight initiates Ryan into his new job as a salesmen at Dunder Mifflin; Pam is tasked with keeping track of everything Michael does during the day by Jan.

episodes.name: Diwali
episodes.summary: Kelly invites the office staff to a Diwali celebration.

episodes.name: Branch Closing
episodes.summary: Jan gives Michael the news that the Scranton branch is closing.

episodes.name: The Merger
episodes.summary: Jim and other members of the Stamford branch have their first day at Scranton.

episodes.name: The Convict
episodes.summary: The office discovers than one of the new Stamford people is a former convict.

episodes.name: A Benihana Christmas (1)
episodes.summary: Michael gets dumped by Carol; Pam and Karen start a rival party planning committee.

episodes.name: A Benihana Christmas (2)
episodes.summary: Michael gets dumped by Carol; Karen and Pam start a rival party planning committee.

episodes.name: Back from Vacation
episodes.summary: Michael returns from his vacation and accidentally sends a picture of Jan sunbathing to everyone in the office.

episodes.name: Traveling Salesmen

name: Game of Thrones
summary: Based on the bestselling book series A Song of Ice and Fire by George R.R. Martin, this sprawling new HBO drama is set in a world where summers span decades and winters can last a lifetime. From the scheming south and the savage eastern lands, to the frozen north and ancient Wall that protects the realm from the mysterious darkness beyond, the powerful families of the Seven Kingdoms are locked in a battle for the Iron Throne. This is a story of duplicity and treachery, nobility and honor, conquest and triumph. In the Game of Thrones, you either win or you die.

episodes.name: Winter is Coming
episodes.summary: Lord Eddard Stark, ruler of the North, is summoned to court by his old friend, King Robert Baratheon, to serve as the King's Hand. Eddard reluctantly agrees after learning of a possible threat to the King's life. Eddard's bastard son Jon Snow must make a painful decision about his own future, while in the distant east Viserys Targaryen plots to reclaim his father's throne, usurped by Robert, by selling his sister in marriage.

episodes.name: The Kingsroad
episodes.summary: An incident on the Kingsroad threatens Eddard and Robert's friendship. Jon and Tyrion travel to the Wall, where they discover that the reality of the Night's Watch may not match the heroic image of it.

episodes.name: Lord Snow
episodes.summary: Jon Snow attempts to find his place amongst the Night's Watch. Eddard and his daughters arrive at King's Landing.

episodes.name: Cripples, Bastards, and Broken Things
episodes.summary: Tyrion stops at Winterfell on his way home and gets a frosty reception from Robb Stark. Eddard's investigation into the death of his predecessor gets underway.

episodes.name: The Wolf and the Lion
episodes.summary: Catelyn's actions on the road have repercussions for Eddard. Tyrion enjoys the dubious hospitality of the Eyrie.

episodes.name: A Golden Crown
episodes.summary: Viserys is increasingly frustrated by the lack of progress towards gaining his crown.

episodes.name: You Win or You Die
episodes.summary: Eddard's investigations in King's Landing reach a climax and a dark secret is revealed.

episodes.name: The Pointy End
episodes.summary: Tyrion joins his father's army with unexpected allies. Events in King's Landing take a turn for the worse as Arya's lessons are put to the test.

episodes.name: Baelor
episodes.summary: Catelyn must negotiate with the irascible Lord Walder Frey.

episodes.name: Fire and Blood
episodes.summary: Daenerys must realize her destiny. Jaime finds himself in an unfamiliar predicament.

episodes.name: The North Remembers
episodes.summary: War grips the continent of Westeros. As Tyrion Lannister tries to take his strong-willed nephew in hand in King's Landing, Stannis Baratheon launches his own campaign to take the Iron Throne with the help of a mysterious priestess. In the east, Daenerys must lead her retinue through a desolate wasteland whilst beyond the Wall the Night's Watch seeks the aid of a wildling.

episodes.name: The Night Lands
episodes.summary: Stannis uses Ser Davos to seek out new allies for his war with the Lannisters. On the road north, Arya confides in Gendry. Robb Stark sends Theon Greyjoy to win an alliance with his father and the fierce warriors of the Iron Islands. Cersei and Tyrion clash on how to rule in King's Landing.

episodes.name: What is Dead May Never Die
episodes.summary: Catelyn Stark treats with King Renly in the hope of winning an alliance. Tyrion undertakes a complex plan in King's Landing to expose an enemy. At Winterfell, Bran's dreams continue to trouble him.

episodes.name: Garden of Bones
episodes.summary: Tyrion attempts to restrain Joffrey's cruelty. Catelyn attempts to broker a peace between Stannis and Renly. Daenerys and her followers arrive at the great city of Qarth and hope to find refuge there. Arya and Gendry arrive at Harrenhal, a great castle now under Lannister occupation.

episodes.name: The Ghost of Harrenhal
episodes.summary: Confusion rages in the Stormlands in the wake of a devastating reversal. Catelyn must flee with a new ally, whilst Littlefinger sees an opportunity in the chaos. Theon seeks to prove himself to his father in battle. Arya receives a promise from the enigmatic Jaqen H'ghar. The Night's Watch arrives at the Fist of the First Men. Daenerys Targaryen receives a marriage proposal.

episodes.name: The Old Gods and the New
episodes.summary: Arya has a surprise visitor; Dany vows to take what is hers; Joffrey meets his subjects; Qhorin gives Jon a chance to prove himself.

episodes.name: A Man Without Honor
episodes.summary: Jaime meets a relative; Theon hunts; Dany receives an invitation.

episodes.name: The Prince of Winterfell
episodes.summary: Theon holds the fort; Arya calls in her debt with Jaqen; Robb is betrayed; Stannis and Davos approach their destination.

episodes.name: Blackwater
episodes.summary: A massive battle rages for control of King's Landing and the Iron Throne.

episodes.name: Valar Morghulis
episodes.summary: Tyrion awakens to a changed situation. King Joffrey doles out rewards to his subjects. As Theon stirs his men to action, Luwin offers some final advice. Brienne silences Jaime; Arya receives a gift from Jaqen; Dany goes to a strange place; Jon proves himself to Qhorin.

episodes.name: Valar Dohaeris
episodes.summary: Jon is brought before Mance Rayder, the King Beyond the Wall, while the Night's Watch survivors retreat south. In King's Landing, Tyrion asks for his reward. Littlefinger offers Sansa a way out. Cersei hosts a dinner for the royal family. Daenerys sails into Slaver's Bay.

episodes.name: Dark Wings, Dark Words
episodes.summary: Sansa says too much. Shae asks Tyrion for a favor. Jaime finds a way to pass the time. Arya runs into the Brotherhood Without Banners.

episodes.name: Walk of Punishment
episodes.summary: Tyrion shoulders new responsibilities. Jon is taken to the Fist of the First Men. Daenerys meets with the slavers. Jaime strikes a deal with his captors.

episodes.name: And Now His Watch is Ended
episodes.summary: The Night's Watch takes stock. Varys meets his better. Arya is taken to the commander of the Brotherhood. Daenerys exchanges a chain for a Whip.

episodes.name: Kissed by Fire
episodes.summary: The Hound is judged by the gods; Jaime is judged by men. Jon proves himself; Robb is betrayed. Tyrion learns the cost of weddings.

episodes.name: The Climb
episodes.summary: Tywin plans strategic unions for the Lannisters. Melisandre visits the Riverlands. Robb weighs a compromise to repair his alliance with House Frey. Roose Bolton decides what to do with Jaime Lannister. Jon, Ygritte and the Wildlings face a daunting climb.

episodes.name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair
episodes.summary: Daenerys exchanges gifts with a slave lord outside Yunkai. As Sansa frets about her prospects, Shae chafes at Tyrion's new situation. Tywin counsels the king, and Melisandre reveals a secret to Gendry. Brienne faces a formidable foe in Harrenhal.

episodes.name: Second Sons
episodes.summary: King's Landing hosts a wedding, and Tyrion and Sansa spend the night together. Daenerys meets the Titan's Bastard. Davos demands proof from Melisandre. Sam and Gilly meet an older Gentleman.

episodes.name: The Rains of Castamere
episodes.summary: Robb presents himself to Walder Frey, and Edmure meets his bride. Jon faces his harshest test yet. Bran discovers a new gift. Daario and Jorah debate how to take Yunkai. House Frey joins with House Tully.

episodes.name: Mhysa
episodes.summary: Joffrey challenges Tywin. Bran tells a ghost story. In Dragonstone, mercy comes from strange quarters. Daenerys waits to see if she is a conqueror or a liberator.

episodes.name: Two Swords
episodes.summary: Tyrion welcomes a guest to King's Landing. At Castle Black, Jon Snow finds himself unwelcome. Dany is pointed to Meereen, the mother of all slave cities. Arya runs into an old friend.

episodes.name: The Lion and the Rose
episodes.summary: Tyrion lends Jaime a hand. Joffrey and Margaery host a breakfast. At Dragonstone, Stannis loses patience with Davos. Ramsay finds a purpose for his pet. North of the Wall, Bran sees where they must go.

episodes.name: Breaker of Chains
episodes.summary: Tyrion ponders his options. Tywin extends an olive branch. Sam realizes Castle Black isn't safe, and Jon proposes a bold plan. The Hound teaches Arya the way things are. Dany chooses her Champion.

episodes.name: Oathkeeper
episodes.summary: Dany balances justice and mercy. Jaime tasks Brienne with his honor. Jon secures volunteers while Bran, Jojen, Meera and Hodor stumble on shelter.

episodes.name: First of His Name
episodes.summary: Cersei and Tywin plot the Crown's next move. Dany discusses future plans. Jon embarks on a new mission.

episodes.name: The Laws of Gods and Men
episodes.summary: Stannis and Davos set sail with a new strategy. Dany meets with supplicants. Tyrion faces down his father in the throne room.

episodes.name: Mockingbird
episodes.summary: Tyrion enlists an unlikely ally. Daario entreats Dany to allow him to do what he does best. Jon's warnings about the Wall's vulnerability fall on deaf ears. Brienne follows a new lead on the road with Pod.

episodes.name: The Mountain and the Viper
episodes.summary: Mole's Town receives unexpected visitors. Littlefinger's motives are questioned. Ramsay attempts to prove himself to his father. Tyrion's fate is decided.

episodes.name: The Watchers on the Wall
episodes.summary: Jon Snow and the rest of the Night's Watch face the biggest challenge to the Wall yet.

episodes.name: The Children
episodes.summary: An unexpected arrival north of the Wall changes circumstances. Dany is forced to face harsh realities. Bran learns more of his destiny. Tyrion sees the truth of his situation.

episodes.name: The Wars to Come
episodes.summary: Varys discusses a conspiracy with Tyrion; Daenerys' rule faces a new threat; Jon finds himself between two kings; and Cersei and Jaime try to move on from Tywin's demise.

episodes.name: The House of Black and White
episodes.summary: Arya arrives in Braavos; Brienne and Podrick find danger while traveling; Cersei worries about Myrcella in Dorne when Ellaria Sand seeks revenge for Oberyn's death; Jon is tempted by Stannis.

episodes.name: High Sparrow
episodes.summary: Cersei meets the High Sparrow after learning of a clergyman's embarrassing tale. Meanwhile, Davos talks to Jon about the future of Winterfell, where Ramsay Snow has just learned the identity of his future bride; Arya grows impatient doing menial tasks in the House of Black and White; and Tyrion searches for more comfortable surroundings on a long trip with Varys.

episodes.name: Sons of the Harpy
episodes.summary: Margaery seeks prudent counsel. Jaime Struggles in foreign lands. Dany answers the Harpy's call.

episodes.name: Kill the Boy
episodes.summary: Dany makes a difficult decision in Meereen. Jon recruits the help of an unexpected ally. Brienne searches for Sansa. Theon remains under Ramsay's control.

episodes.name: Unbowed, Unbent, Unbroken
episodes.summary: Arya trains. Jorah and Tyrion run into slavers. Trystane and Myrcella make plans. Jaime and Bronn reach their destination. The Sand Snakes attack.

episodes.name: The Gift
episodes.summary: Jon prepares for conflict. Sansa tries to talk to Theon. Brienne waits for a sign. Stannis remains stubborn. Jaime attempts to reconnect with family.

episodes.name: Hardhome
episodes.summary: Arya makes progress in her training. Sansa confronts an old friend. Cersei struggles. Jon travels.

episodes.name: The Dance of Dragons
episodes.summary: Stannis confronts a troubling decision. Jon returns to The Wall. Mace visits the Iron Bank. Arya encounters someone from her past. Dany reluctantly oversees a traditional celebration of athleticism.

episodes.name: Mother's Mercy
episodes.summary: Cersei seeks forgiveness; Jon faces a new challenge; Arya plots to cross a name off her list; Tyrion sees a familiar face; and Daenerys finds herself surrounded by strangers.

episodes.name: The Red Woman
episodes.summary: Jon Snow is dead. Daenerys meets a strong man. Cersei sees her daughter again.

episodes.name: Home
episodes.summary: Bran trains with the Three-Eyed Raven. In King's Landing, Jaime advises Tommen. Tyrion demands good news, but has to make his own. At Castle Black, the Night's Watch stands behind Thorne. Ramsay Bolton proposes a plan, and Balon Greyjoy entertains other proposals.

episodes.name: Oathbreaker
episodes.summary: Daenerys meets her future. Bran meets the past. Tommen confronts the High Sparrow. Arya trains to be No One. Varys finds an answer. Ramsay gets a gift.

episodes.name: Book of the Stranger
episodes.summary: Tyrion strikes a deal. Jorah and Daario undertake a difficult task. Jaime and Cersei try to improve their situation.

episodes.name: The Door
episodes.summary: Tyrion seeks a strange ally. Bran learns a great deal. Brienne goes on a mission. Arya is given a chance to prove herself.

episodes.name: Blood of My Blood
episodes.summary: An old foe comes back into the picture. Gilly meets Sam's family. Arya faces a difficult choice. Jaime faces off against the High Sparrow.

episodes.name: The Broken Man
episodes.summary: The High Sparrow eyes another target. Jaime confronts a hero. Arya makes a plan. The North is reminded.

episodes.name: No One
episodes.summary:
Jaime encounters a hero; the High Sparrow fixates on another prey; Arya hatches a new plan; Yara and Theon plot their next move; Olenna and Cersei discuss their families' futures.

While Jaime weighs his options, Cersei answers a request. Tyrion's plans bear fruit. Arya faces a new test.

episodes.name: Battle of the Bastards
episodes.summary: Ramsay surprises his audience. Jon retaliates. Dany is true to her word.

episodes.name: The Winds of Winter
episodes.summary: Alliances are made, the High Sparrow is holding trials at King's Landing, Daenerys is sailing for the Seven Kingdoms and a new King of the North is crowned.

episodes.name: Dragonstone
episodes.summary: Jon organizes the defense of the North. Cersei tries to even the odds. Daenerys comes home.

episodes.name: Stormborn
episodes.summary: Daenerys receives an unexpected visitor. Jon faces a revolt. Tyrion plans the conquest of Westeros.

episodes.name: The Queen's Justice
episodes.summary: Daenerys holds court. Cersei returns a gift. Jaime learns from his mistakes.

episodes.name: The Spoils of War
episodes.summary: Arya gets to the final destination. Daenerys takes it upon herself to strike back.

episodes.name: Eastwatch
episodes.summary: Daenerys demands loyalty from the surviving Lannister soldiers; Jon heeds Bran's warning about White Walkers on the move; Cersei vows to vanquish anyone or anything that stands in her way.

episodes.name: Beyond the Wall
episodes.summary: Jon's mission continues north of the wall, but the odds against his ragged band of misfits may be greater than he imagined.

episodes.name: The Dragon and the Wolf
episodes.summary: Cersei sits on the Iron Throne; Daenerys sails across the Narrow Sea; Jon Snow is King in the North, and winter is finally here.

episodes.name: Winterfell
episodes.summary: Arriving at Winterfell, Jon and Daenerys struggle to unite a divided North. Jon gets some big news.

episodes.name: A Knight of the Seven Kingdoms
episodes.summary: Jaime faces judgement and Winterfell prepares for the battle to come.

episodes.name: The Long Night
episodes.summary: Winterfell fights the Army of the Dead.

episodes.name: The Last of the Starks
episodes.summary: The survivors plan their next steps; Cersei makes a power move.

episodes.name: The Bells
episodes.summary: Varys betrays his queen, and Daenerys brings her forces to King's Landing.

episodes.name: The Iron Throne
episodes.summary: In the aftermath of the devastating attack on King's Landing, Daenerys must face the survivors.

name: Fleabag
summary: Meet Fleabag. She's not talking to all of us - she's talking to you. So why don't you pop your top off and come right in?

episodes.name: Episode 1
episodes.summary: Angry, pervy, outrageous and hilarious, Fleabag arrives with a bang, as she spins through the city grasping at anyone and anything that might keep her head above water.

episodes.name: Episode 2
episodes.summary: Haunted by memories of her dead best friend, dumped by her emotionally-fragile boyfriend, and now desperately trying to sell her stolen goods, Fleabag attempts to rekindle romantic fires to distract her from the mayhem of her life.

episodes.name: Episode 3
episodes.summary:
Fleabag helps her inappropriate brother-in-law buy a present for Claire, who is organising her own surprise birthday party.

Meanwhile, on the hunt for a date, Fleabag reconnects with a toothy friend.

episodes.name: Episode 4
episodes.summary:
Fleabag and her sister Claire reluctantly visit a female-only, silent retreat, courtesy of their father.

Their enforced silence is interrupted, however, by an unusual neighbouring weekend workshop, explosive secrets coming to light, and a surprising connection with an old acquaintance.

episodes.name: Episode 5
episodes.summary:
On the anniversary of her mother's death, Fleabag and Claire return to their family home for the annual memorial lunch. Although this time there is an interloper…

Things get heated between Fleabag and her Godmother who muscles her way into the occasion and reveals plans for her Sex-hibition.

episodes.name: Episode 6
episodes.summary:
Fleabag takes a date to her Godmother's Sex-hibition only to discover a few shocks are in store for her, including a declaration of love, a familiar piece of work, and an entire wall of surprises.

But where is Claire? The season finale forces Fleabag to face up to her actions, and to finally reveal what happened to her beloved friend, Boo.

episodes.name: Episode 1
episodes.summary:
The eponymous Fleabag returns, joining an uncomfortable family dinner to celebrate Godmother and Dad's engagement.

Alongside familiar faces - uptight sister Claire and her alcoholic husband Martin - Fleabag find herself intrigued by Godmother's new priest. The evening comes to a tempestuous end, however, when an unexpected attack brings old tensions bubbling to the surface.

episodes.name: Episode 2
episodes.summary: A counselling session elicits an uncomfortable truth from Fleabag, and she finds herself somewhere unexpected. Elsewhere, a chat with Claire brings some unwelcome news, Martin and Fleabag face off, and Jake wonders where Claire is.

episodes.name: Episode 3
episodes.summary: Fleabag helps with an event at Claire's work which inevitably ends in disaster, but an introduction to Claire's colleague proves intriguing, and a chance meeting with a stranger opens Fleabag's eyes.

episodes.name: Episode 4
episodes.summary:
The priest takes Fleabag for some quiet reflection, leading to an unexpected revelation.

After a day spent looking back on painful memories, Fleabag searches for solace, only to find more trouble.

episodes.name: Episode 5
episodes.summary: Claire has a crisis and turns to Fleabag for help, whilst a familiar face makes a re-appearance at the cafe.Hilary makes a friend, Martin demands answers, and Godmother and Dad's wedding hangs in the balance.

episodes.name: Episode 6
episodes.summary: As the day of the wedding arrives, Jake wants to know where Claire is, and the priest upstages the bride. As secrets are revealed and decisions are made, will Fleabag find the ending she's looking for?

name: Atlanta
summary: Two cousins work through the Atlanta music scene in order to better their lives and the lives of their families.

episodes.name: The Big Bang

name: Happy Valley
summary: When a kidnap spirals out of control, Yorkshire police sergeant Catherine Cawood comes face to face with the man who destroyed her family.

episodes.name: Episode 1
episodes.summary: Sergeant Cawood's world stops when the man who drove her daughter to suicide is released from prison, and Kevin's split-second decision devastates Nevison.

episodes.name: Episode 2
episodes.summary: Catherine's search for Tommy gains momentum when she receives a tip-off regarding his whereabouts. Helen absorbs the shock of hearing that Ann has been abducted.

episodes.name: Episode 3
episodes.summary: Tommy brutally takes control of a situation when PC Kirsten McAskill pulls him and Lewis over. His actions have devastating consequences.

episodes.name: Episode 4
episodes.summary: Catherine's focus returns to the job in hand as she searches for the owner of the suspicious Milton Avenue property, with dramatic consequences.

episodes.name: Episode 5
episodes.summary: Catherine sinks into a deep depression as she learns that Tommy is still at large. The net finally closes in on Kevin.

episodes.name: Episode 6
episodes.summary: Things get tense at Catherine's birthday party when a drunk Daniel reveals a different version of past events with Becky. Catherine's fears grow when she learns that Tommy has been spending time with Ryan.

episodes.name: Episode 1
episodes.summary:
Whilst out solving a case of sheep rustling, Catherine discovers a decomposed body hidden in a garage on a local estate. Raped and murdered, the victim is someone close to home. All too soon, Catherine finds herself in the middle of a murder investigation.

Meanwhile Clare bumps into her old friend Neil Ackroyd, who has recently moved to Hebden Bridge and works in the local corner shop. Will old flames reignite? Other relationships are thrown into turmoil as Catherine kindly takes in son Daniel after he is thrown out of his house, while Detective Sergeant John Wadsworth faces a tough decision when his girlfriend unexpectedly turns up at the house he shares with his wife and children.

When another dead body is found the police begin to suspect a serial killer is behind the murders, and Detective Superintendent Andy Shepherd and Detective Inspector Jodie Shackleton are called in to head up the case. Locked away behind bars, Tommy Lee Royce is given some very unexpected news and, distraught, seeks comfort in a mysterious female visitor.

episodes.name: Episode 2
episodes.summary:
While she remains a suspect in the Lynn Dewhurst investigation, Catherine focuses on a human trafficking case.

Following a successful police raid, Catherine ensures all the women are taken to safe houses. Ilinka, who has vital information on those behind the trafficking, is given refuge with Catherine's neighbour Winnie and reluctantly agrees to speak to the police. But has Catherine inadvertently put her in danger?

As Vicky's threats continue, John struggles to get a handle on the murder case. Feeling under pressure at work and at home he takes drastic measures to save both his marriage and reputation.

When Tommy is granted special leave to attend his mother's funeral, Catherine has an inexplicable compulsion to attend - bringing her face to face with him once more. Meanwhile Clare, feeling vulnerable at Helen's funeral, turns to an old friend for comfort.

episodes.name: Episode 3
episodes.summary: Tommy wants Frances to go further in her attempts of ruining Catherine's life. John is concerned when a new body is discovered.

episodes.name: Episode 4
episodes.summary: A local sex worker is attacked and it doesn't take long for Catherine to put two and two together and to arrest a well-known local. As the anniversary of Becky's death coming up, Clare and Daniel help Catherine pull together to give Ryan a happy birthday. Ryan receives a gift from an anonymous sender, all celebrations are cut short and a rift between him and Catherine is soon exposed. Clare is troubled when she learns about Neil's past relationships. Darryl confronts the sheep rustlers from the estate.

episodes.name: Episode 5
episodes.summary: Ryan's new found interest in Tommy leads Daniel to suspect somebody at the school might be responsible.

episodes.name: Episode 6
episodes.summary: Catherine is confronts a delusional Frances. Elsewhere John's torment leads him to desperate measures.

name: 30 Rock
summary: Multiple award-winning comedy 30 Rock is told through the comedic voice of Emmy and two-time Golden Globe winner Tina Fey as variety show producer Liz Lemon. The series also features two-time Emmy and three-time Golden Globe winner Alec Baldwin as top network executive Jack Donaghy and Emmy nominee Tracy Morgan as Tracy Jordan, the unpredictable star of Lemon's hit variety show, TGS with Tracy Jordan, Lemon constantly has her hands full, juggling corporate interference from Donaghy and off-the-handle star antics from Jordan, all while attempting to salvage her own personal life.

episodes.name: Pilot
episodes.summary: Liz Lemon is called upstairs to meet the new network exec, Jack Donaghy, who instructs her to hire movie star Tracy Jordan to draw a young male audience to 'The Girlie Show'.

episodes.name: The Aftermath
episodes.summary: The crew of The Girlie Show is skeptical of having Tracy Jordan join the cast, especially when the show is retitled 'TGS Tracy Jordan'. Feeling everybody blames them, Liz and Tracy decide to throw a party on a yacht.

episodes.name: Blind Date
episodes.summary: Cupid has a new rival when Jack insists on sending Liz on a blind date with his out of town friend, Thomas.

episodes.name: Jack the Writer
episodes.summary: Lines are drawn when Jack decides to sit in on the writers' room and Kenneth the page tries to deal with Tracy's difficult demands.

episodes.name: Jack-Tor
episodes.summary: Jack is determined to act in a sketch on the show. Liz suspects Tracy may be illiterate.

episodes.name: Jack Meets Dennis
episodes.summary: Liz reconnects with her ex-boyfriend Dennis, the last remaining pager salesman in New York. Meanwhile, Jenna and Tracy try to "enhance" their appearances for career reasons.

episodes.name: Tracy Does Conan
episodes.summary: It's a star showdown when a dazed and confused Tracy bumps Jenna from her scheduled appearance on Late Night with Conan O'brien.

episodes.name: The Break-Up
episodes.summary: At the urging of everyone, Liz finally breaks up with her beeper salesman boyfriend, but the path back to "single and loving it" proves to be filled with unforeseen obstacles.

episodes.name: The Baby Show
episodes.summary: There are mommy issues on the set when Jenna tells everyone that Liz wants to get pregnant, and Jack gives her some very personal parental advice.

episodes.name: The Rural Juror
episodes.summary: Jenna can't wait for her new movie to open, but Liz won't tell her what she really thinks of her performance.

episodes.name: The Head and the Hair
episodes.summary: There are some new power players around when Jack and Kenneth the page switch roles for the day and Liz finds herself clicking with a gorgeous hunk.

episodes.name: Black Tie
episodes.summary: Liz, Jack and Jenna rub elbows with the upper crust at a prince's (Paul Reubens) birthday party. But the end of the evening finds Liz lying low after Jack's ex-wife (Isabella Rossellini) shows up.

episodes.name: Up All Night
episodes.summary: Valentine's Day is much more than candy and flowers when Jack celebrates the finalization of his divorce and the writers are forced to pull an all-nighter.

episodes.name: The "C" Word
episodes.summary: Being the boss isn't all it's cracked up to be when Liz overhears the writers discussing her management style and Jack tries to impress CEO Don Geiss (Rip Torn) at a charity golf tournament by bringing Tracy along.

episodes.name: Hard Ball
episodes.summary: It's negotiation time, and Jack plans to teach Liz a thing or two about how to handle Josh's new contract. Jenna makes several big publicity mistakes.

episodes.name: The Source Awards
episodes.summary: It's lights, camera, aggravation when Liz finds herself locked in a relationship with Tracy's determined new manager and Jack forces Tracy to host The Source Awards.

episodes.name: The Fighting Irish
episodes.summary: Family matters move front and centre when Jack is reunited with his down-and-out brother (Nathan Lane) and Liz has a tough time making staff cutbacks.

episodes.name: Fireworks
episodes.summary: Sparks are flying when Jack uses Kenneth the page to thwart an aggressive west coast NBC exec (Will Arnett) and Liz follows her crush to an AA meeting.

episodes.name: Corporate Crush
episodes.summary: Love is in the air, but Liz is concerned when Jack takes an overwhelming interest in her new boyfriend (Jason Sudeikis).

episodes.name: Cleveland
episodes.summary: There are certainly no sparks when Jack asks Liz to take his fiancee, Phoebe (Emily Mortimer), out for a ladies' lunch. But Liz finds a lot more to like when her boyfriend takes her to the great city of Cleveland.

episodes.name: Hiatus
episodes.summary: Tracy, on the run from the Black Crusaders, goes into hiding with Kenneth's cousin Jessie (Sean Hayes), and the pressure's on Liz to make the show work after Jack's mother (Elaine Stritch) arrives and Jack ends up in the hospital.

episodes.name: Seinfeld Vision
episodes.summary: As the cast and crew of TGS with Tracy Jordan returns for a new season, Liz is excited to see Jack again. However, her excitement quickly fades as Jack insists that Liz is still not over Floyd. Meanwhile, Jerry Seinfeld shows up at Jack's office in an upset mood after Jack announces his newest plan. Finally, Kenneth becomes Tracy's office wife when Tracy separates from his wife and Jenna returns to set a whole lot heavier now that she has been involved in Mystic Pizza: The Musical!.

episodes.name: Jack Gets in the Game
episodes.summary: When Jack discovers that his boss is retiring, he decides to get in the competition for his position. Meanwhile, Jenna begins to enjoy her fame for being fat and along with Jack encourages Liz to get her act together. Finally, Kenneth makes it his mission to get Tracy and Angie back together.

episodes.name: The Collection
episodes.summary: Jack hires his own private investigator to lead GE in the wrong direction so that they will not be able to find any dirt on him that might put him in a compromising position. However, when he is asked to give up his cookie jar collection, Jack finds the task too much of a challenge. Meanwhile, Angie announces that she will follow Tracy at all times to keep him in line, which Liz believes to be good until she covers for Tracy and gets on Angie's bad side. Finally, Jenna starts to worry once she starts to lose all the weight she gained over the summer and her popularity begins to hang on the line.

episodes.name: Rosemary's Baby
episodes.summary: When Liz meets her idol, Rosemary Howard, she invites her to be a guest writer on the show.

episodes.name: Greenzo
episodes.summary: It's time for Kenneth's annual house party, but he may be the only one excited about it. The soiree has only been attended by Liz in the past, so in order to get a better turnout Tracy spreads rumors that ultimately get out of hand. Meanwhile, Jack deals with NBC's new environmentally-friendly mascot, whose new-found stardom goes to his head.

episodes.name: Somebody to Love
episodes.summary: Jack falls for a congresswoman he meets at a cocktail party and despite the fact that they hold opposite views, the couple agrees to put politics aside and have a secret affair. Meanwhile, Liz believes her Middle Eastern neighbor to be a terrorist and tips off Homeland Security, creating a big mess.

episodes.name: Cougars
episodes.summary: As part of his community service, Tracy must coach a little league team. All goes well until Jack takes interest in the team and turmoil starts from there. Meanwhile, Liz is asked out on a date by Jamie, the new coffee boy, who thinks Liz is actually younger than she truly is.

episodes.name: Secrets and Lies
episodes.summary: C.C. wants to go public with her love for Jack, while Liz works at appeasing both Tracy and Jenna.

episodes.name: Ludachristmas
episodes.summary: The cast and writers of TGS prepare their annual Ludachristmas party in the writer's room.

episodes.name: Episode 210
episodes.summary: Jack and C.C. try to make their long distance romance work, Liz decides to invest in real estate, and Kenneth becomes addicted to caffeine.

episodes.name: MILF Island
episodes.summary: Just as "MILF Island" takes off, Jack suffers a setback when somebody runs a terrible quote in the New York Post calling him a "Grade-A Moron".

episodes.name: Subway Hero
episodes.summary: Dennis becomes a New York City celebrity after jumping in front of a train and saving someone who fell on the tracks. Meanwhile, Jack desperately tries to persuade Tracy to become the celebrity face of the Republican Party.

episodes.name: Succession
episodes.summary: Liz is shocked when Jack is promoted and names her his successor.

episodes.name: Sandwich Day
episodes.summary: Floyd stays at Liz's place overnight when his flight is canceled. Meanwhile, Jack is demoted to the 12th floor, causing him to question his future status at the company. Finally, the staff celebrates Annual Sandwich Day with mysterious sandwiches from a secret location in Brooklyn.

episodes.name: Cooter
episodes.summary: Jack hates his new job in Washington while back in New York, Liz deals with a pregnancy scare.

episodes.name: Do-Over
episodes.summary: Liz tries to keep the TGS staff from ruining her chances at adoption when an evaluator (Megan Mullally) drops by the job. Jack is back at 30 Rock to reclaim his position from Devin Banks (Will Arnett), but quickly learns the task won't be easy when he is given a sizeable demotion.

episodes.name: Believe in the Stars
episodes.summary: On a flight back from Chicago, Liz spills her soul to Oprah Winfrey. Meanwhile, Tracy and Jenna butt heads as they try to determine whose life is harder and Jack's morality is tested by Kenneth after an Olympics snafu.

episodes.name: The One with the Cast of 'Night Court'
episodes.summary: Liz and Jenna's free-spirited friend Claire (Jennifer Aniston) visits New York and falls hard for Jack. Kenneth, distressed over the new page uniforms, turns to Tracy who cheers him up with a surprise involving the cast of Night Court.

episodes.name: Gavin Volure
episodes.summary: Eccentric businessman Gavin Volure (Steve Martin) becomes enamored with Liz. Meanwhile, Tracy fears his kids may have sinister plans and Kenneth entrusts Jack to invest his savings in Gavin's business venture.

episodes.name: Reunion
episodes.summary: Liz is opposed to going to her high school reunion, but Jack manages to convince her otherwise. Meanwhile, Don Geiss (Rip Torn) wake up from his coma only to shock Jack with his declaration of who will be GE's CEO.

episodes.name: Christmas Special
episodes.summary: Liz participates in a charity program to help underprivileged kids celebrate Christmas. Meanwhile, Jack takes his frustration out on the TGS staff when his plans for a dream holiday vacation away from his overbearing mother are crushed.

episodes.name: Senor Macho Solo
episodes.summary: Jenna is concerned that Liz's attraction to a new guy (Peter Dinklage) has to do with her longing to have a child. Jack hits it off with his mother's nurse. Elisa (Salma Hayek) helps Tracy and Angie (Sherry Shepherd) arrange a post-nip, and tries to get Jenna an audition for the title role in a Janis Joplin biopic.

episodes.name: Flu Shot
episodes.summary: Liz fights for the staff's rights to flu shots from Dr. Spaceman (Chris Parnell). Meanwhile, Elisa is working seven days a week, so Jack must be creative about finding ways to spend time with her.

episodes.name: Retreat to Move Forward
episodes.summary: Nervous about the corporate retreat, Jack recruits Liz to accompany him for support. Jenna decides to take up method acting to prepare for her Janis Joplin role. Kenneth must convince Tracy that diabetes is affected by his diet.

episodes.name: Generalissimo
episodes.summary: Liz discovers she has a handsome and single neighbor (Jon Hamm) after receiving his mail by mistake. Due to Jack's striking resemblance to a spanish soap villain, Elisa's grandmother disapproves of their relationship. The new TGS interns invite Tracy out for a night of partying.

episodes.name: St. Valentine's Day
episodes.summary: Liz unintentionally insists her and Drew (Jon Hamm) have their first official date on Valentine's Day. Jack goes to church with girlfriend Elisa and Tracy helps Kenneth win the affection of a new staffer.

episodes.name: Larry King
episodes.summary: Jack considers taking the next step with Elisa while Tracy's interview on Larry King Live sends New York City into a panic. Liz recruits Kenneth to accompany her to chaotic Queens to retrieve her lost cell phone.

episodes.name: Goodbye, My Friend
episodes.summary: Liz befriends a pregnant teen in an attempt to adopt her baby. Jenna vies for more attention but Kenneth's plan to combine her birthday party with one for Tracy derails her efforts. Jack goes out with the guys and bonds with Frank over daddy issues.

episodes.name: The Funcooker
episodes.summary: When Liz can't scheme her way out of jury duty, chaos ensues on the set of TGS. With no one in charge, Tracy and Jenna begin to act irresponsibly, while Jack becomes absorbed in launching a lucrative new product.

episodes.name: The Bubble
episodes.summary: Liz spends more time with her boyfriend Drew (Jon Hamm) and finds that his handsomeness allows him to bypass many of the usual frustrations of daily life. Jack must find a way to convince Tracy to stay on at TGS after his contract expires and Jenna considers a new hairstyle to attract public attention.

episodes.name: Apollo, Apollo
episodes.summary: While Jack plans the perfect 50th birthday party for himself, he watches old home videos that inspire him to recreate one of the happiest moments he had a young boy. Liz's ex-boyfriend Dennis decides to come clean about an addiction, stirring up drama between Liz and Jenna.

episodes.name: Cutbacks
episodes.summary: Excitement for TGS's 50th show is quickly replaced by concern about company budget cuts. When Jack is forced to hand out pink slips, Liz does some personal bartering to save her staff.

episodes.name: Jackie Jormp-Jomp
episodes.summary: Suspended from work, Liz must learn to live without TGS. Meanwhile, when the film studio has second thoughts about releasing Jenna's Janis Joplin biopic, Jack needs Jenna to create some promotional buzz using her celebrity status.

episodes.name: The Ones
episodes.summary: When Jack and Elisa (Salma Hayek) think seriously about their engagement, he seeks advice from Tracy about the reality of married life. Elisa divulges to Liz she is keeping a secret. A prank results in an injury back at TGS and Jenna loses her cool over an attractive EMT.

episodes.name: The Natural Order
episodes.summary: Tracy and Liz stop receiving preferential treatment and experience what it means to be each other's equals. Jack's mother reveals unpleasant memories about Jack's father leaving the family. Jenna adopts a pet gibbon and learns the perils of motherhood.

episodes.name: Mama Mia
episodes.summary: Liz and Tracy convince Jack to begin the search for his real father (Alan Alda) and Tracy discovers an illegitimate son. Meanwhile, Jenna and Liz fight for the spotlight when Jenna gets recognition for one of Liz's ideas.

episodes.name: Kidney Now!
episodes.summary: The TGS staff rallies as Jack's father's (Alan Alda) health hangs in the balance. Liz enjoys newfound fame as a relationship expert. When Tracy's high school invites him to speak at graduation, Kenneth helps him overcome embarrassing memories.

episodes.name: Season 4
episodes.summary: Jack informs Liz that it's time for TGS to start appealing to middle America, and wants her to search for a new cast member.

episodes.name: Into the Crevasse
episodes.summary: Liz's book finally hits the stores, but she faces the wrath of Tracy when he finds out just how much he influenced what Liz wrote.

episodes.name: Stone Mountain
episodes.summary: Liz and Jack travel south to find their next great TGS talent.

episodes.name: Audition Day
episodes.summary: It's audition day at TGS and the cast and crew each have want their favorites chosen.

episodes.name: The Problem Solvers
episodes.summary: While the TGS crew await the arrival of their new cast member, Liz gets an offer of a lifetime.

episodes.name: Sun Tea
episodes.summary: It's green week and Kenneth does his part, with the help of Al Gore.

episodes.name: Dealbreakers Talk Show #0001
episodes.summary: Production begins on Liz's new talk show, Dealbreakers, and she realizes what it's like to walk in Jenna's shoes.

episodes.name: Secret Santa
episodes.summary: Jack takes a trip down memory lane when his high school crush resurfaces in his life.

episodes.name: Klaus and Greta
episodes.summary: Jenna enters in a fake relationship with James Franco while Jack tries to gain access to a drunken voicemail he left Nancy.

episodes.name: Black Light Attack!
episodes.summary: Danny reveals to Jack he's having secret make-out sessions with a TGS writer; Jenna auditions for Gossip Girl.

episodes.name: Winter Madness
episodes.summary: To boost morale at TGS, Liz and Jack take the gang up North for a work field trip.

episodes.name: Verna
episodes.summary: Jenna's estranged mother comes into town and Jenna turns to Jack for advice on how to deal with her.

episodes.name: Anna Howard Shaw Day
episodes.summary: Liz schedules her root canal on Valentine's Day, but has a hard time finding somebody to drive her home.

episodes.name: Future Husband
episodes.summary: Liz sets out to find the identity of a mystery number in her phone labeled "Future Husband."

episodes.name: Don Geiss, America and Hope
episodes.summary: Jack struggles to find his new place in the business after hearing of the Kabletown buy out and Liz continues to wonder if Wesley is the "one."

episodes.name: Floyd
episodes.summary: Revenge is in the air when Liz discovers an engaged Floyd is back in town to compete for a dream wedding on "The Today Show".

episodes.name: Lee Marvin vs. Derek Jeter
episodes.summary: Jack is torn between Nancy and Avery while Jenna offers to be Liz's wingman.

episodes.name: Khonani
episodes.summary: Determined to show her staff she knows how to cut loose, Liz offers to throw a bridal shower for Cerie.

episodes.name: Argus
episodes.summary: Liz steps in when Tracy and Dotcom argue over who will be Grizz's best man.

episodes.name: The Moms
episodes.summary: Liz sets out to reunite her mother with her one true love, Buzz Aldrin.

episodes.name: Emmanuel Goes to Dinosaur Land
episodes.summary: With Avery out of town, Nancy shows up to visit Jack. Liz revisits her old boyfriends and yet again runs into the unshakable Wesley. Tracy eschews a gritty, Oscar-caliber role to do a Garfield movie.

episodes.name: I Do Do
episodes.summary: Liz finally meets her soul mate, just as Jack is forced to finally decide between Avery and Nancy.

episodes.name: The Fabian Strategy
episodes.summary: Liz's boyfriend Carol comes to town, ready to take their relationship to the next level.

episodes.name: When It Rains, It Pours
episodes.summary: Liz turns on the charm to win over a TGS editor; Jack and Avery find out the gender of their baby.

episodes.name: Let's Stay Together
episodes.summary: Jack heads to Washington D.C. to speak on behalf of the NBC and Kabletown merger, and faces obstacles from a Rhode Island Congresswoman.

episodes.name: Live Show
episodes.summary: Liz is upset because nobody remembers her 40th birthday, Jack tries to give up drinking to support his pregnant girlfriend, and Tracy threatens to break character during TGS.

episodes.name: Reaganing
episodes.summary: Jack is on a winning streak and sets his sights on fixing Liz's relationship with Carol.

episodes.name: Gentleman's Intermission
episodes.summary: Avery makes Jack set up some boundaries when it comes to his friendship with Liz.

episodes.name: Brooklyn Without Limits
episodes.summary: Liz frequents a local boutique because she thinks she's helping the environment--and their jeans make her butt look good. Meanwhile, Jack helps an enemy's political rival, and Jenna helps Tracy aim for a Golden Globe nomination.

episodes.name: College
episodes.summary: Liz tries to buy her way to popularity after she wins the TGS crew's lottery.

episodes.name: Chain Reaction of Mental Anguish
episodes.summary: Liz begins to worry about her relationship and Jack advises her that it's time to seek a therapist.

episodes.name: Christmas Attack Zone
episodes.summary: Avery and Liz push Jack to unveil two giant secrets to his mother during her holiday visit.

episodes.name: Mrs. Donaghy
episodes.summary: Liz's New Year's resolutions cause trouble for Jack and Avery's wedding plans.

episodes.name: Operation Righteous Cowboy Lightning
episodes.summary: Jack hopes to make money for the network by pre-recording a disaster benefit that can go on-air.

episodes.name: ¡Qué Sorpresa!
episodes.summary: Jack does his best to impress the KableTown executives.

episodes.name: Double-Edged Sword
episodes.summary: Both Liz's and Jack's romantic getaways with their significant others turn into nightmares.

episodes.name: It's Never Too Late for Now
episodes.summary: The TGS gang tries to stop Liz's descent into spinsterhood while Frank and Pete start a band.

episodes.name: TGS Hates Women
episodes.summary: Liz hires a female writer in order to prove that TGS isn't sexist. Jack hatches a plot to manipulate his way to the top of KableTown.

episodes.name: Queen of Jordan
episodes.summary: Jack and Liz try to manipulate Angie into getting Tracy to return to TGS, while the "Queen of Jordan" cameras bring Jack some embarrassment.

episodes.name: Plan B
episodes.summary: With TGS on hiatus, the crew looks for other jobs. Meanwhile, Jack tries to salvage his cable network by enlisting the help of his arch nemesis.

episodes.name: I Heart Connecticut
episodes.summary: Liz and Ken go on a quest to find Tracy in New York, while Jenna and Jack work to get a horror film made by whatever means necessary.

episodes.name: 100: Part 1
episodes.summary: When Hank Hooper marks "TGS" for cancellation, Jack persuades him to let Liz and the crew try to change his mind by staging the show's 100th episode.

episodes.name: 100: Part 2
episodes.summary: When Hank Hooper marks "TGS" for cancellation, Jack persuades him to let Liz and the crew try to change his mind by staging the show's 100th episode.

episodes.name: Everything Sunny All the Time Always
episodes.summary: While Liz embraces spirituality, Jack has a heated duel with his ex-flame Condoleezza Rice!

episodes.name: Respawn
episodes.summary: Liz's attempt to get some R&R over vacation is spoiled by Tracy, a lonely Jack turns to Kenneth for company.

episodes.name: Dance Like Nobody's Watching
episodes.summary: Liz finds a new happiness; Jenna finds a popular new gig humiliating children on NBC's "America's Kidz Got Singing."

episodes.name: Idiots Are People Two!
episodes.summary: Liz strives to keep her boyfriend under wraps while a rant from Tracy unleashes a publicity nightmare.

episodes.name: Idiots Are People Three!
episodes.summary: Devon Banks returns to torment Jack while Tracy escalates his protest with Liz and Jenna call in a favor to solve a pesky Pete problem.

episodes.name: The Ballad of Kenneth Parcell
episodes.summary: Jenna, Liz, Jack and Tracy all get a new appreciation for the meaning of friendship.

episodes.name: Today You Are a Man
episodes.summary: Jack and Liz battle over her employment contract; Kenneth bolts from TGS for a new page assignment; Jenna and Tracy start moonlighting.

episodes.name: Hey, Baby, What's Wrong: Part 1
episodes.summary: On Valentine's Day, Liz and Criss brave a trip to Ikea; Avery's mother and Jack have a dalliance.

episodes.name: Hey, Baby, What's Wrong: Part 2
episodes.summary: On Valentine's Day, Liz and Criss brave a trip to Ikea; Avery's mother and Jack have a dalliance.

episodes.name: The Tuxedo Begins
episodes.summary: Liz discovers she must break social rules to achieve her goals; a mugging forces Jack to fight for rich people's rights.

episodes.name: Leap Day
episodes.summary: The spirit of Leap Day overtakes TGS, with lessons for everyone.

episodes.name: Alexis Goodlooking and the Case of the Missing Whisky
episodes.summary: Liz and Frank start "dating"; Jenna and Tracy tap into their inner cops; Jack molds Kenneth into a young corporate climber.

episodes.name: Standards and Practises
episodes.summary: Kenneth puts new restrictions on TGS programming, while Jack meets his nemesis.

episodes.name: St. Patrick's Day
episodes.summary: St. Patrick's Day isn't complete without ex-boyfriends, strategic board games and big green Hulk gloves.

episodes.name: Grandmentor
episodes.summary: Liz mentors Hazel in the ways of show business.

episodes.name: Kidnapped by Danger
episodes.summary: Diana, Avery's mother, arrives to oversee the film of her daughter's life.

episodes.name: The Shower Principle
episodes.summary: Liz's life and Jack's inspiration are stagnant.

episodes.name: Nothing Left to Lose
episodes.summary: A regained sense of smell conjures powerful emotions for Tracy.

episodes.name: Meet the Woggels
episodes.summary: Jack's mother ruins his couch factory opening, while Jenna crosses another sexual adventure off her list and Tracy solves a crisis with his son.

episodes.name: Murphy Brown Lied to Us
episodes.summary: Jack sets Liz up on a date while Jenna stages a public meltdown to win back Paul.

episodes.name: Live from Studio 6H
episodes.summary: When Jack tries to shut down live production of TGS, Kenneth teaches them all the lessons of live TV.

episodes.name: Queen of Jordan 2: The Mystery of the Phantom Pooper
episodes.summary: Angie's reality show returns, while Jack and Diana await Avery's arrival.

episodes.name: The Return of Avery Jessup
episodes.summary: Avery returns from North Korea with a stranger in tow; Liz and Criss struggle with their gender roles.

episodes.name: What Will Happen to the Gang Next Year?
episodes.summary: Jack and Avery renew vows, while Criss tries to prove to Liz that he's the one.

episodes.name: The Beginning of the End
episodes.summary: Liz discovers Jack's plan to ruin the network, while Hazel hatches an evil plan of her own and Jenna conscripts Liz into being her maid of honor.

episodes.name: Governor Dunston
episodes.summary: Liz must balance her new professional success with her love life, all while helping Jack bring down NBC.

episodes.name: Stride of Pride
episodes.summary: Jack takes his dating game up a notch, while Liz clashes with Tracy over an offensive tweet.

episodes.name: Unwindulax
episodes.summary: Jack and Liz go head to head as the political race heats up.

episodes.name: There's No I in America
episodes.summary: Realizing that Jenna could decide the Presidential election, Liz and Jack stage a debate to win her support and her followers.

episodes.name: Aunt Phatso vs. Jack Donaghy
episodes.summary: As Hazel schemes to become a TGS star, Jack and Tracy spar over Tracy's latest movie.

episodes.name: Mazel Tov, Dummies!
episodes.summary: Ready to adopt a baby, Liz and Criss try to plan a simple wedding... until things spin out of control.

episodes.name: My Whole Life Is Thunder
episodes.summary: As Jenna exacts revenge on Liz for her surprise wedding, Jack struggles once again to please his mother.

episodes.name: Game Over
episodes.summary: Jack spars with Kaylie Hooper over ultimate control of NBC.

episodes.name: Florida
episodes.summary: As Jack and Liz travel to Florida to wrap up his late mother's affairs, Jenna and Tracy take over TGS.

episodes.name: A Goon's Deed in a Weary World
episodes.summary: As Liz and Criss' new children arrive, Jack seeks a new head of NBC and TGS teeters on the edge.

episodes.name: Hogcock!
episodes.summary: Liz rallies the team to produce one final farewell production.

episodes.name: Last Lunch
episodes.summary: Liz rallies the team to produce one final farewell production.

name: Line of Duty
summary: A drama about the investigations of AC-12, a controversial Police Anti-Corruption Unit.

episodes.name: Episode 1
episodes.summary: When Steve Arnott is transferred to a police anti-corruption unit, he finds his target is the city's top detective, Tony Gates. Can Gates really be as good as he appears? Arnott must engage in a cat-and-mouse struggle to uncover Gates' secret.

episodes.name: Episode 2
episodes.summary: Having been duped into covering up Jackie's crime, Gates is desperate to sever ties with her. But, as Arnott and Fleming close in on his secret, Gates is plunged into an even more dangerous situation than he first thought.

episodes.name: Episode 3
episodes.summary: Arnott is convinced Gates played a part in Jackie's disappearance. With Fleming's help, the anti-corruption team tries to trap Gates into revealing his involvement in covering up Jackie's crimes.

episodes.name: Episode 4
episodes.summary: Desperate for proof of Gates's corruption, Fleming pushes her relationship with him to the limit. But her behaviour causes Morton to question if she might not be such a loyal colleague after all.

episodes.name: Episode 5
episodes.summary: With Gates on the run, the anti-corruption team come under pressure to close the case once and for all. Arnott is forced to make some tough decisions about where his loyalties lie. Fleming and Hastings go all out to catch Gates, leading to a shattering conclusion.

episodes.name: Episode 1
episodes.summary: A brutal ambush on a police convoy leaves three officers dead and a protected witness fighting for his life. AC-12 turn their spotlight on Lindsay Denton, the officer who led the convoy but escaped unscathed.

episodes.name: Episode 2
episodes.summary: Following the tragedy at the hospital, AC12's Kate Fleming is planted undercover in Lindsay Denton's Missing Persons Unit. But Lindsay in turn gathers compromising evidence against the anti-corruption team.

episodes.name: Episode 3
episodes.summary: Lindsay is denied bail and finds herself targeted in prison. Growing increasingly desperate, she tells Kate about a relationship with an executive police officer and her theory of why she is being framed.

episodes.name: Episode 4
episodes.summary: Following the violent attack she suffered in prison, Lindsay is granted special dispensation to visit her dying mother. Meanwhile, deputy chief constable Dryden shrugs off allegations about his relationship with Lindsay and possible links to the ambush.

episodes.name: Episode 5
episodes.summary: Lindsay fights for her life as troubling details emerge of a vicious conspiracy involving corrupt police officers. With growing evidence of links between DCC Dryden and the ambush, Hastings is under pressure to arrest his senior officer.

episodes.name: Episode 6
episodes.summary: AC12's investigation finally exposes a vicious criminal gang run from within the police. But while Steve now appears convinced of Lindsay's innocence, Kate remains determined to prove she had a role in the ambush.

episodes.name: Episode 1
episodes.summary: A hardened criminal is shot dead by an armed-response unit led by Sgt Danny Waldron, who claims they were acting in self-defence. But when AC-12 gather evidence suggesting it was a deliberate killing, DC Kate Fleming is sent undercover into Danny's team to find out more. She is quick to identify tensions within the team - only for her own conduct to come under scrutiny.

episodes.name: Episode 2
episodes.summary: The shooting at the drugs house intensifies the scrutiny on Danny's team, who once again close ranks. But with DC Kate Fleming on the inside, AC-12 feed in new information that helps her expose cracks in the team's story. DS Steve Arnott looks deeper into Danny Waldron's background and makes a shocking discovery. However, Arnott's life is complicated by an investigation into his own past conduct, but - determined to vindicate himself - Steve prioritises his leads into the Danny Waldron case. The increasing pressure on Danny's team pushes Danny's colleague Rod to the edge.

episodes.name: Episode 3
episodes.summary: Undeterred by recent events, DS Steve Arnott continues to find crucial evidence in the Danny Waldron case, and when his theory is confirmed he vows to get justice. DC Kate Fleming discovers that PC Hari Bains is making secret calls to an unregistered phone number while having clandestine meetings with his colleague PC Jackie Brickford. With AC-12's suspicions raised, Steve acts fast - but it is DI Dot Cottan's actions that garner praise.

episodes.name: Episode 4
episodes.summary: Fresh testimony launches AC-12 back on the trail of the Caddy, a corrupt officer with links to organized crime. But new disturbing evidence suggests the Caddy may reside within AC-12.

episodes.name: Episode 5
episodes.summary: Following new evidence obtained by DC Kate Fleming, the former Head of Vice Patrick Fairbank is questioned by AC-12, but despite Kate's best she is left frustrated. Worried by Arnott's contact with Lindsay Denton, DI Dot Cottan takes matters into his own hands, with shattering consequences. Under pressure from AC-12 legal counsel Gill Biggeloe, Ted Hastings has no choice but to make a dramatic and heartbreaking decision.

episodes.name: Episode 6
episodes.summary: DS Steve Arnott is arrested on suspicion of murder but continues to protest his innocence. Does DC Kate Fleming's undercover operation hold the key to Steve's guilt and the identity of the Caddy? AC-12 legal counsel Gill Biggeloe pressurises Superintendent Ted Hastings but some new evidence leaves the enquiry turning on its head.

episodes.name: Episode 1
episodes.summary:
After months of hunting a serial killer, DCI Roz Huntley faces intense pressure to apprehend a suspect. Michael Farmer is caught and charged with the crimes, but doubts about the young man's guilt lead the chief forensic investigator to AC-12.

When DCI Roz Huntley captures a serial killer, Forensic Coordinator Tim Ifield alerts AC-12 to a possible miscarriage of justice.

episodes.name: Episode 2
episodes.summary: A dismembered body is discovered, and worries grow when Roz fails to report for duty. After further questioning of Michael Farmer unearths crucial new information, AC-12 challenge the case against him. Meanwhile Arnott and Fleming continue to clash.

episodes.name: Episode 3
episodes.summary: As shocking new evidence is unearthed, AC-12 step up their investigation in to the case against Michael Farmer. Could the real killer still be at large? Meanwhile, Detective Constable Jamie Desford joins the AC-12 team.

episodes.name: Episode 4
episodes.summary: Roz's husband Nick is brought in for questioning by AC-12. But while Nick denies any involvement in Steve's attack, his suspicions about Roz mount. Meanwhile, AC-12 discover new anomalies in the forensic evidence and issue DCI Roz Huntley with a second Reg 15 notice. AC-12's case appears watertight until Roz starts dismantling their evidence with inside information of her own.

episodes.name: Episode 5
episodes.summary: AC-12's future hangs in the balance, after Hilton bars them from investigating Roz Huntley. But Roz's problems are building closer to home.

episodes.name: Episode 6
episodes.summary: The explosive series finale pits AC-12 against Roz in a climactic duel to find Tim's murderer and unmask Balaclava Man.

episodes.name: Episode 1
episodes.summary: Following the deadly hijack of a police convoy, AC-12 target a ruthless organised crime group known to have links with corrupt officers.

episodes.name: Episode 2
episodes.summary: A fresh police leak enables another audacious raid, Arnott's attempts to gather information put him in a dangerous situation, and the team tries to contact the undercover officer.

episodes.name: Episode 3
episodes.summary: Corbett's most daring plan yet requires McQueen to exploit links with corrupt police officers. AC-12 make a shocking discovery.

episodes.name: Episode 4
episodes.summary: Tensions rise in the OCG following the events at Eastfield. With troubling questions hanging over the identity of 'H', suspicions mount at AC-12.

episodes.name: Episode 5
episodes.summary: As the hunt for 'H' intensifies, Steve and Kate wonder if Hastings is guarding a dark secret.

episodes.name: Episode 6
episodes.summary:
In a nail-biting finale, closely guarded secrets are revealed.

Carmichael's dogged interrogation of Hastings presents mounting evidence of suspicious behavior. Caught in the crossfire, Kate and Steve are torn between loyalty to Hastings and their duty to uncover the truth, however painful. Will the identity of "H" be revealed at last?

name: Curb Your Enthusiasm
summary: Curb Your Enthusiasm stars Seinfeld co-creator Larry David as himself in an unsparing but tongue-in-cheek depiction of his life. Shot in a verite style and featuring celebrities playing themselves, the episodes are improvised by the actors from an outline created by David.

episodes.name: The Pants Tent
episodes.summary: Larry's baggy new pants create awkward misunderstandings among Larry, Cheryl, and her friend. A movie-theater argument with a female 'stranger' leads to tensions between Larry and his best friend. Larry jokingly refers to Cheryl as "Hitler" during a car speakerphone conversation with Jeff and his attempts to hide it from her—and to appease Jeff's Holocaust-sensitive parents—backfired disastrously.

episodes.name: Ted and Mary
episodes.summary: Larry and Cheryl enjoy their bowling double-date with Ted Danson and Mary Steenburgen, but it ends badly when Larry accuses the bowling alley of misplacing his sneakers. Later, Ted gets the wrong idea about Larry when he goes shopping with Mary at a downtown department store.

episodes.name: Porno Gil
episodes.summary: By not picking up a golf ball that drops out of a bucket carried by a man in a tacky western hat, Larry sets off a bizarre chain of events in which he's forced to attend a party at the home of a porno businessman named Gil, getting lost with Cheryl along the way. The party ends up being a disaster, as Larry refuses to take off his shoes, breaks a lamp, loses his watch, is forced to do a dreaded "double goodbye." Meanwhile, Jeff is hospitalized for emergency bypass surgery and asks Larry to remove the secret porno stash at his home so his wife doesn't find it. While carrying out the favor, Larry discovers a familiar face on one of the video boxes.

episodes.name: The Bracelet
episodes.summary: Larry wants to buy a bracelet for Cheryl, but he is not buzzed into the store because he is wearing his workout clothes and looks like a slob. Richard then decides to buy it for his girlfriend instead, upsetting Cheryl. Larry and Richard Lewis help a blind man move into his apartment but he becomes belligerent and ungrateful. Larry returns to a restaurant where he left behind his credit card, but his car is blocked in by the waiter captain because Larry did not tip him the previous day.
