episodes.summary: Goku races to Mr. Satan's house, where he proves unable to wake Majin Buu from his hibernation. Meanwhile, all of Universe 7's remaining warriors except Master Roshi and No. 17 gather at the Capsule Corporation. After Krillin brings up the 10 million Zeni prize that Goku had bribed him, 18, and Tien with, Piccolo and Gohan reveal that the prize of 10 million Zeni was a lie and that the universe will be destroyed if they lose. When Goku returns, Krillin berates him and threatens to withdraw from the team along with No. 18. After Goku fails to convince them otherwise, Beerus swiftly threatens Krillin into staying, while Bulma agrees to pay out the promised reward. In Universe 6, Cabba takes Caulifla to a deserted wasteland to teach her how to become a Super Saiyan. As Caulifla's protégée, Kale(ケールKēru), observes them, Cabba ineffectually attempts to provoke Caulifla in order to make her transform. When that fails, he teaches her to focus her energy on an area in her back. Caulifla successfully transforms into a Super Saiyan. Caulifla tests her newfound power and agrees to join Universe 6's team for the Tournament of Power. Caulifla beckons Kale over to attempt the transformation herself. In Universe 11, Kahseral arrives at the Pride Trooper headquarters, where he and Toppo agree to leave the universe in their trainees' hands so they can participate in the tournament. In Universe 3, two cyborg warriors named Nigrisshi(ニグリシNigrisshi)and Narirama(ナリラマNarirama)display their upgrades for the tournament to Universe 3's deities Mosco(モスコMosuko), Ea(エア), and Campari(カンパーリKanpāri). Back in Universe 7, Goku and his friends are unable to figure out who can replace Buu. When Beerus claims they have no suitable fighters because Goku destroyed the Frieza Force, Goku is inspired to recruit Frieza, which shocks everyone.

name: Boku no Hero Academia
summary: People are not born equal, a realization that 4-year-old Midoriya Izuku faced when bullied by his classmates who had unique special powers. Izuku was one of the rare cases where he was born with absolutely no unique powers. This did not stop Izuku from pursuing his dream, a dream of becoming a great hero like the legendary All-Might. To become the great hero he hopelessly wants to become, he now will join the ranks of one of the highest rated "Hero Academies" in the country: Yueiko. With the help of his idol All-Might, will he be able to claim the ranks and become a true hero?

episodes.name: Izuku Midoriya: Origin
episodes.summary: Izuku Midoriya desperately wants to be a hero, but he is one of the few in his generation born without a Quirk. Will meeting the number one hero, All Might, change his fate?

episodes.name: What It Takes to Be a Hero
episodes.summary: Izuku accidentally learns of All Might's secret, but there's trouble in town again before Izuku has time to process it. Will All Might be able to save the day again?

episodes.name: Roaring Muscles
episodes.summary: All Might reveals Izuku's quirk can transfer strength from person to person, then he designs a training course to prepare for the transfer.

episodes.name: Start Line
episodes.summary: After obtaining All Might's Quirk, the time has come for Izuku to attend the exams for the prestigious U.A's entrance exam.

episodes.name: What I Can Do for Now
episodes.summary: It is the first day at the U.A. High School and Izuku faces possible expulsion as his teacher decides to hold a physical test to see how students use their quirks.

episodes.name: Rage, You Damn Nerd
episodes.summary: The Quirk students form teams of good and bad to test their quirks and Izuku faces a challenge.

episodes.name: Deku vs. Kacchan
episodes.summary: Izuku and Bakugo continue their mock battle with Izuku trying to figure out how to deal with giving his body time to adjust to the strength of the Quirk.

episodes.name: Bakugo's Start Line
episodes.summary: After loosing to Izuku, Bakugo watches the rest of his classmates and broods about what he should have done during the training battle.

episodes.name: Yeah, Just Do Your Best, Lida!
episodes.summary: Izuku gives away his position as class president to Iida after Iida preforms a selfless act, the students go to a new training ground.

episodes.name: Encounter with the Unknown
episodes.summary: Izuku Midoriya gets the superpower 'quirk' after he rescues his childhood bully from a villain.

episodes.name: Game Over
episodes.summary: The students combat the villains and Lida manages to escape with the help of his friend.

episodes.name: All Might
episodes.summary: All Might has finally shown up, but will he be able to defeat Nomu and save the day?!

episodes.name: In Each of Our Hearts
episodes.summary: The battle as USJ begins to wind down, raising questions about repercussions.

episodes.name: That's the Idea, Ochako
episodes.summary: After their face-off, Deku and the rest of his classmates are informed about the much awaited sports tournament.

episodes.name: Roaring Sports Festival
episodes.summary: Deku is under pressure because of expectations on him during the sports festival.

episodes.name: In Their Own Quirky Ways
episodes.summary: The sports festival takes off with the first event. Deku is in the lead in spite of not using his quirk.

episodes.name: Strategy, Strategy, Strategy
episodes.summary: Deku. Ochaco, Mei and Fumikage team up together as the second event of the sports festival is about to start.

episodes.name: Cavalry Battle Finale
episodes.summary: Thanks to his great observations skills, Deku's team manages to sail through the challenge.

episodes.name: The Boy Born with Everything
episodes.summary: Shoto has a talk with Deku regarding his own situation after he suspects that Deku and All Might may have a connection.

episodes.name: Victory or Defeat
episodes.summary: The face off between Deku and Shinso starts. Deku manages to tame Shinso and begins to walk toward the periphery.

episodes.name: Battle On, Challengers!
episodes.summary: The tournament goes on. Shoto's hatred for his father helps him beat his rival and he moves on to the next round.

episodes.name: Bakugo vs. Uraraka
episodes.summary: The battle between Bakugo and Ochaco begins, but Ochaco is not able to use her quirk on Bakugo.

episodes.name: Shoto Todoroki: Origin
episodes.summary: The Deku and Shoto fight begins. Deku throws safety to the winds by using his quirk on Shoto who in turn uses his ice quirk.

episodes.name: Fight On, Iida
episodes.summary: Shoto is struggling with the decision of whether or not to use the quirk from his fathers side.

episodes.name: Todoroki vs. Bakugo
episodes.summary: The final between Shoto and Bakugo begins. Shoto has had a dilemma ever since the end of his fight with Deku.

episodes.name: Time to Pick Some Names
episodes.summary: With the sports event finished, the students are asked to pick their Hero names once they attend their class.

episodes.name: Bizarre! Gran Torino Appears
episodes.summary: While everyone adjusts to their new tasks, Izuku starts training with Gran Torino, the same man who taught All Might.

episodes.name: Midoriya and Shigaraki
episodes.summary: The U.A. students are finally starting to get the hang of their internships, but Izuku has much more to learn about One For All.

episodes.name: Hero Killer: Stain vs U.A. Students
episodes.summary: Stain strikes again, and this time some U.A. students are around when it happens. Will they be able to hold him off until the pros come?

episodes.name: Climax
episodes.summary: It all comes to a head as Izuku, Iida, and Todoroki face off against Stain while the pro heroes in Hosu City fight against the Nomus.

episodes.name: The Aftermath of Hero Killer: Stain
episodes.summary: Stain is finally captured, but now the hero community must deal with the consequences of their actions.

episodes.name: Everyone's Internships
episodes.summary: As Izuku, Iida, and Todoroki recover from their fight with Stain, the other members of Class 1-A work hard at their own internships.

episodes.name: Listen Up!! A Tale from the Past
episodes.summary: The students return to their daily lives while All Might has a special history lesson for Izuku. It's time to learn about One For All!

episodes.name: Gear Up for Final Exams
episodes.summary: Finals are coming up, and Class 1-A is going to need more than a cram session. This year, the teachers are changing the practical exams.

episodes.name: Yaoyorozu: Rising
episodes.summary: The exams are turning out to be much more challenging than the students expected. Can any of the teams hold their own against a teacher?

episodes.name: Stripping the Varnish
episodes.summary: As the students of Class 1-A fight in their practical exams, their resolve to become heroes is put to the test.

episodes.name: Katsuki Bakugo: Origin
episodes.summary: Midoriya and Bakugo begin their match with All Might but the two of them have different plans.

episodes.name: Encounter
episodes.summary: The league of villains has two people wanting to join them. UA students go to the mall. When they're at the mall everyone goes off on their own leaving Midoriya by himself where he encounters Tomura Shigaraki.

episodes.name: Game Start
episodes.summary: A recap episode highlighting the first 2 seasons as Class-1A and Class-1B prepare to start summer camp.

episodes.name: Wild, Wild Pussycats
episodes.summary: The kids arrive at camp, where they will be subjected to hard work like they've never experienced before.

episodes.name: Kota
episodes.summary: Midoriya finds out more about Kota and why he feels so strongly about heroes as a small but competent group of villains threaten to endanger the lives of everyone in the camp.

episodes.name: My Hero
episodes.summary: The villains launch their attack, and only Izuku knows where Kota is. Can he get to him in time?

episodes.name: Drive It Home, Iron Fist!!!
episodes.summary: As the students and teachers retaliate against the villains, two students take it into their own hands to handle the unknown gas swirling across the forest.

episodes.name: Roaring Upheaval
episodes.summary: The students and teachers of U.A. are still fighting in the woods, but has the Vanguard Action Squad accomplished its mission already?.

episodes.name: What a Twist!
episodes.summary: The battle at the training camp concludes, and now the students and teachers of U.A. have to deal with the aftermath.

episodes.name: From Iida to Midoriya
episodes.summary: Todoroki, Kirishima, and Midoriya want to go after Bakugo, but the class rep is standing in their way. Meanwhile, Shigaraki makes Bakugo an offer

episodes.name: All for One
episodes.summary: The heroes and U.A. students close in on the League of Villains' hideouts, but the League still has an ace up its sleeve.

episodes.name: Symbol of Peace
episodes.summary: As the fight against the League of Villains escalates, can the U.A. students get Bakugo out in time for All Might to make a big comeback?

episodes.name: One for All
episodes.summary: All Might's time is running out as he faces his ultimate nemesis head on. Will he finally be able to defeat All For One once and for all?

episodes.name: End of the Beginning, Beginning of the End
episodes.summary: All Might has finally retired,and is counting on someone to take his place, but this is only the beginning.

episodes.name: Moving Into Dorms
episodes.summary: The students of Class 1-A move into the dorms and have a competition to determine who has the best room as they settle in.

episodes.name: Create Those Ultimate Moves
episodes.summary: Class 1-A works on developing their Quirks and creating ultimate moves in order to get ready for the provisional hero licensing exam.

episodes.name: The Test
episodes.summary: Izuku and his classmates make some final adjustments to their ultimate moves and then head off to the provisional licensing exam.

episodes.name: Shiketsu High Lurking
episodes.summary: The provisional licensing exam has begun, and everyone's after Class 1-A. Can they last long enough to pass this first test?

episodes.name: Class 1-A
episodes.summary: Todoroki's on his own against Seijin High, and Yaoyorozu's group is pitted against Seiai Academy as they and the rest of Class 1-A fight to pass the first test.

episodes.name: RUSH!
episodes.summary: It's down to the final minutes of the first test of the provisional licensing exam and almost half of Class A is still left.

episodes.name: Rescue Exercises
episodes.summary: The second test of the provisional licensing exam has begun, and the hero candidates are suddenly thrust into a rescue operation.

episodes.name: Save the World with Love!
episodes.summary: We take a break from the provisional licensing exam to visit a class held before the summer training camp.

episodes.name: What's the Big Idea?
episodes.summary: The exam nears its end, but Izuku and the other hero candidates must fend off Gang Orca to finish the rescue mission.

episodes.name: A Talk About Your Quirk
episodes.summary: While the U.A. students finish up the provisional licensing exam and get their results, All Might has a talk with All For One.

episodes.name: Deku vs. Kacchan, Part 2
episodes.summary: Following the provisional licensing exam, Izuku tries out his Shoot Style on Bakugo as they have a heart-to-heart through their fight.

episodes.name: A Season for Encounters
episodes.summary: The world has changed for villains and heroes alike in the weeks after All Might's fight with All For One, and the U.A. students start their second semester.

episodes.name: Unrivaled
episodes.summary: The students of Class 1-A learn about work studies from the Big Three. Meanwhile, the villains also prepare their next steps.

episodes.name: The Scoop on U.A. Class 1-A
episodes.summary: After All Might announces his retirement, freelance reporter Taneo Tokuda goes to the dorms to investigate U.A. Class 1-A.

episodes.name: Overhaul
episodes.summary: The villain known as Overhaul meets with Shigaraki in order to propose an alliance that ends badly for the two sides. Meanwhile, Izuku continues to think about where he wants to intern and gets a tip from Togata.

episodes.name: Boy Meets...
episodes.summary: Izuku battles Sir Nighteye to get his stamp and approval to join his agency. However, midway through battle, Nighteye reveals a secret about All Might that shakes Izuku's confidence greatly.

episodes.name: Fighting Fate
episodes.summary: Izuku's first day on patrol takes a shocking turn where he meets Chisaki and a mysterious girl. Later, he decides to confront All Might about the truth surrounding One for All's successor.

episodes.name: Let's Go, Gutsy Red Riot
episodes.summary: Kirishima begins his work study with Fat Gum and Amajiki and runs into a criminal situation. Meanwhile, Shigaraki and Chisaki meet up in order to discuss an alliance.

episodes.name: An Unpleasant Talk
episodes.summary: Pro heroes from all across the country meet up to discuss the situation with the Shie Hassaikai, including the U.A students. The discussion takes a shocking turn when a horrible truth is revealed about the girl named Eri.

episodes.name: GO!!
episodes.summary: To save Eri and to stop the machinations of the Hassaikai Group, the pro heroes prepare to mount an all out attack on the bad guys' stronghold. Deku and Togata steel themselves for the battle ahead.

episodes.name: Suneater of the Big Three
episodes.summary: The Shie Hassaikai is going all out to stop the heroes, and Suneater volunteers to take out the first batch of Eight Bullets members in their way.

episodes.name: Red Riot
episodes.summary: As the fight with the Shie Hassaikai continues, Kirishima has to face his past when he and Fat Gum get separated from the others.

episodes.name: Temp Squad
episodes.summary: Still fused with the walls and floors, Irinaka continues to separate the heroes and police attacking the Hassaikai. Toga and Twice continue to assist the yakuza as part of a deal with Shigaraki

episodes.name: Lemillion
episodes.summary: Twice and Toga betray the Shie Hassasaki meanwhile Mirio finally catches up to Overhaul and Chrono.

episodes.name: Unforeseen Hope
episodes.summary: Izuku, Eraser Head, and Sir Nighteye finally reach the area where Chisaki and the others are and find Togata past his limit.

episodes.name: Infinite 100%
episodes.summary: Despite their efforts, Overhaul has only grown stronger. Nighteye and Mirio are too injured to continue fighting. Aizawa has been incapacitated by Chrono. The raid team is in shambles, with few left standing. But Eri is crying, and this time, Deku will not let go.

episodes.name: Bright Future
episodes.summary: As the heroes deal with the aftermath of the fight with the Shie Hassaikai, the vehicle transporting Chisaki has an encounter with the League of Villains.

episodes.name: Smoldering Flames
episodes.summary: Our fight with the Shie Hassaikai has ended and we were able to change the future. But it wasn't completely over yet. As we overcome, with grief at the loss of Sir Nighteye, the league of Villains started to move towards a new stage.

episodes.name: Win Those Kids' Hearts
episodes.summary: Camie joins the provisional license training course and is added to the team working with the kids from Masegaki. Meanwhile, Endeavor has a serious talk with All Might.

episodes.name: Relief for License Trainees
episodes.summary: The trainees bond with the precocious Masegaki kids and life at U.A. goes back to normal as autumn approaches, but Aoyama has been acting strangely.

episodes.name: School Festival
episodes.summary: As the students of U.A prepare for their school festival, Deku and Togata visit Eri in the hospital. Meanwhile, a new villain named Gentle Criminal begins his reign of crime.

episodes.name: Prepping for the School Festival Is the Funnest Part
episodes.summary: As the date of the school festival draws nearer, Deku and the rest of Class 1-A decide who is going to do what in order to put on the greatest school festival ever.

episodes.name: Golden Tips Imperial
episodes.summary: The day of the festival is at hand and Class 1-A is ready. As they relax on the night before, Gentle Criminal hatches his plan to infiltrate the festival, starting with a very special tea.

episodes.name: Deku vs. Gentle Criminal
episodes.summary: While getting something for the festival, Deku runs into Gentle Criminal. Learning that he plans to infiltrate the festival, Deku begins to fight the mysterious villain and his partner La Brava.

episodes.name: School Festival Start!!
episodes.summary: Deku scrambles to stop Gentle Criminal from infiltrating U.A's school festival using his Shoot Style technique. As La Brava uses her Quirk to power up Gentle, his resolve hardens as he fights against Deku.

episodes.name: Let It Flow! School Festival!
episodes.summary: Izuku rushes back to the school festival after his encounter with Gentleman and La Brava, but will he make it in time for his performance?

episodes.name: Japanese Hero Billboard Chart
episodes.summary: It's time for the next Japanese Hero Billboard Chart rankings to be announced, and this time, all the top ten heroes make an appearance.

name: South Park
summary: South Park is an adult comedy animation show centred around 4 children in the small town of south park. Its humour is often dark involving satirical elements and mocking current real-life events.

episodes.name: Cartman Gets an Anal Probe
episodes.summary: Aliens wreak havoc in the Rockies, first by subjecting Cartman to an anal probe, and then by abducting Kyle's baby brother.

episodes.name: Weight Gain 4000
episodes.summary: Cartman tries to slim down when he learns a TV talk-show host is coming to town to give him an award, but he bulks up instead. Meanwhile, Mr. Garrison hatches a plan to murder the visiting celeb.

episodes.name: Volcano
episodes.summary: A volcanic eruption interrupts the boys' camping trip.

episodes.name: Big Gay Al's Big Gay Boat Ride
episodes.summary: When his pup explores his sexuality, Stan gets so upset that he inadvertently threatens to blow the school's homecoming-game victory.

episodes.name: An Elephant Makes Love to a Pig
episodes.summary: After a botched genetic experiment, Stan's clone is let loose in the town. Voices include Trey Parker and Matt Stone.

episodes.name: Death
episodes.summary: The boys summon the Grim Reaper.

episodes.name: Pinkeye
episodes.summary: A pinkeye epidemic interrupts the boys' plans to win a Halloween-costume contest; and Kenny has a run-in with a Russian space station when it falls to Earth.

episodes.name: Starvin' Marvin
episodes.summary: After the boys contact an agency that helps starving children, Government authorities send Cartman to Ethiopia. Meanwhile, the town holds a drive for canned goods; and turkeys revolt against a genetic engineer.

episodes.name: Mr. Hankey, the Christmas Poo
episodes.summary: Because he's Jewish, Kyle is denied involvement in the Nativity play and excluded from trips to see Santa. Meanwhile, South Park residents try to plan a politically correct celebration; and Mr. Hankey visits Kyle.

episodes.name: Damien
episodes.summary: As Cartman celebrates his birthday, Jesus Christ and Satan duke it out on a pay-per-view TV special. Meanwhile, Satan's son Damien tries to fit in with the crowd after making a violent first impression.

episodes.name: Tom's Rhinoplasty
episodes.summary: Mr. Garrison takes a leave of absence to have a nose job and is replaced by Miss Ellen, a substitute who threatens Stan and Wendy's relationship.

episodes.name: Mecha-Streisand
episodes.summary: The future of the world is at stake after the boys unearth a prehistoric relic that spawns a monster.

episodes.name: Cartman's Mom is a Dirty Slut
episodes.summary: When Cartman begins to exhibit odd behavior, a counselor suggests that finding his father may solve his problems.

episodes.name: Terrance & Phillip in "Not Without My Anus"
episodes.summary: An episode featuring Terrance and Phillip, who must save Canada from Saddam Hussein.

episodes.name: Cartman's Mom is Still a Dirty Slut
episodes.summary: Chef and the boys rush to the hospital to check on Mephesto, who's gunned down just as he's set to reveal the identity of Cartman's father. Meanwhile, the townspeople search for the gunman and battle a snowstorm.

episodes.name: Chickenlover
episodes.summary: The boys try to circumvent a delicate surgical procedure set to be performed on Kyle's brother as part of a tradition begun by their Jewish ancestors. Meanwhile, Mr. Mackey is cut from his job after he botches a lecture on drugs.

episodes.name: Ike's Wee Wee
episodes.summary: Chaos ensues on the streets of South Park as the town is overcome by a crime wave that leaves scores of chickens assaulted. And Officer Barbrady's no help...because he's resigned.

episodes.name: Conjoined Fetus Lady
episodes.summary: Kyle's terrified after an injury sustained during a dodgeball game sends him to the nurse---a conjoined twin with an unusual medical condition. Meanwhile, Pip leads the dodgeball team to the world championships in China.

episodes.name: The Mexican Staring Frog of Southern Sri Lanka
episodes.summary: Jimbo and Ned launch a TV hunting show, which goes head-to-head with "Jesus and Pals," the popular cable-access series.

episodes.name: City on the Edge of Forever (a.k.a. Flashbacks)
episodes.summary: The boys put twists on events such as the attempted assassination of a talk-show host and a fight with Death as their bus hangs off a cliff. Meanwhile, Ms. Crabtree finds fame when she goes to look for help.

episodes.name: Summer Sucks
episodes.summary: The mayor devises a plan to make the town's Fourth of July celebration memorable, despite a ban on fireworks; and Mr. Hat vanishes, causing Mr. Garrison to visit a therapist.

episodes.name: Chef's Chocolate Salty Balls
episodes.summary: Hollywood pooh-bahs in town for a film festival try to sign Mr. Hankey to a movie deal after their upscale cuisine disrupts the sewage system and nearly destroys him. Meanwhile, locals are up in arms over the movie-industry event.

episodes.name: Chickenpox
episodes.summary: The town faces an outbreak of chicken pox.

episodes.name: Roger Ebert Should Lay Off the Fatty Foods
episodes.summary: Stan, Kyle and Kenny gravitate toward a new planetarium; and Cartman auditions to be the star of "Les Miserables."

episodes.name: Clubhouses
episodes.summary: The boys each build a clubhouse---and Stan is eager to have Wendy over for a game of "truth or dare." However, his parents' separation interferes with his plans.

episodes.name: Cow Days
episodes.summary: During South Park's annual rodeo, the boys compete in a bull-riding contest. Meanwhile, the cows find religion.

episodes.name: Chef Aid
episodes.summary: Chef invites some of his well-known musician friends to participate in a benefit concert after he loses all of his money in a lawsuit. Meanwhile, the boys join the workforce to help him get out of debt.

episodes.name: Spooky Fish
episodes.summary: Stan fears his pet fish may be involved with a rash of unsolved murders that occur on Halloween. Meanwhile, Cartman starts killing people---with kindness, even going so far as to appreciate Wendy's liberal views.

episodes.name: Merry Christmas Charlie Manson!
episodes.summary: The boys go to Cartman's grandmother's house for a holiday feast that's also attended by Cartman's uncle (an escaped con) and the police.

episodes.name: Gnomes (a.k.a. Underpants Gnomes)
episodes.summary: The boys work on a project with a high-strung kid whose parents' coffee shop faces strong competition from a conglomerate that hopes to set up in South Park.

episodes.name: Prehistoric Ice Man
episodes.summary: The boys unearth a prehistoric man frozen in ice, but the discovery jeopardizes Stan and Kyle's friendship when they argue over what to name him.

episodes.name: Rainforest Schmainforest
episodes.summary: The boys accompany a teacher and her singing-and-dancing group to Central America to raise awareness of the rain forest. Also: Kenny falls for a choir member; and Kyle has trouble mastering the choreography.

episodes.name: Spontaneous Combustion
episodes.summary: Residents start to spontaneously combust, prompting Stan's geologist father to investigate.

episodes.name: The Succubus (a.k.a. Chef's Mama)
episodes.summary: Chef gets a visit from his mother when the boys feel his bride-to-be has taken their place in his heart.

episodes.name: Jakovasaurs
episodes.summary: The boys discover two nearly extinct animals while camping on the banks of Stark's Pond.

episodes.name: Tweek vs. Craig
episodes.summary: The boys take a shop class taught by an eccentric, and urge a schoolyard fight between classmates Tweek and Craig.

episodes.name: Sexual Harassment Panda
episodes.summary: Cartman sues Stan for sexual harassment.

episodes.name: Cat Orgy
episodes.summary: Shelly baby-sits Cartman.

episodes.name: Two Guys Naked in a Hot Tub
episodes.summary: A meteor shower hits town, and Stan's sister Shelly babysits Cartman while Mrs. Cartman goes to a "meteor party."

episodes.name: Jewbilee
episodes.summary: Kyle and Ike go on a camping trip while South Park residents wait for a meteor shower to begin.

episodes.name: Korn's Groovy Pirate Ghost Mystery
episodes.summary: On Halloween, the boys are plagued by fifth graders and the town is overrun by pirate ghosts. Music group Korn assists, and sings "Falling Away from Me."

episodes.name: Chinpokomon
episodes.summary: Adults try to counter when the town's children become obsessed with a fad from Japan, whose government reveals their master plan behind the craze.

episodes.name: Hooked on Monkey Fonics
episodes.summary: Kyle tries to teach his new rival about love; the boys compete against home-schooled kids in the annual spelling bee; and Cartman's mom agrees to teach him at home.

episodes.name: Starvin' Marvin in Space!
episodes.summary: Starvin Marvin returns in a stolen U.S. spaceship, and enlists the boys to help feed his Ethiopian village. The CIA is among their pursuers.

episodes.name: The Red Badge of Gayness (a.k.a. War)
episodes.summary: The town holds its annual reenactment of a Civil War battle, and Cartman suits up for the Confederacy with visions of glory.

episodes.name: Mr. Hankey's Christmas Classics
episodes.summary: Mr. Hankey and South Park citizens celebrate the holidays with musical numbers from his Christmas Classics Album.

episodes.name: Are You There God, It's Me Jesus
episodes.summary: "Are You There, God? It's Me, Jesus" purports to "answer age-old questions about who we are and what we're all about."

episodes.name: Worldwide Recorder Concert (a.k.a. The Brown Noise)
episodes.summary: The boys and their class travel to the first "Worldwide Recorder Concert" in Arkansas, where Mr. Garrison confronts the demons of his childhood while visiting his parents.

episodes.name: The Tooth Fairy's TATS 2000
episodes.summary: Cartman impersonates the Tooth Fairy when he learns there's money to be made from harvesting the teeth of underprivileged kids. However, the leader of a dentists' organization sets out to stop him.

episodes.name: Cartman's Silly Hate Crime 2000
episodes.summary: Cartman is sentenced to juvenile hall and his friends plan to get him out. Meanwhile, he begins to adjust to life on the inside.

episodes.name: Timmy! 2000
episodes.summary: Mr. Mackey excuses Timmy from homework when he mistakenly thinks the boy is suffering from Attention Deficit Disorder; then Cartman and his friends try to develop the same affliction.

episodes.name: Quintuplets 2000
episodes.summary: The South Park media showers attention on a family with quintuplets that moves into the area, and Cartman befriends one of the new residents. Meanwhile, Kenny's mom tries to cash in on the excitement by planning a multiple birth of her own.

episodes.name: Cartman Joins NAMBLA
episodes.summary: Cartman seeks online companionship from older users after deciding that Stan, Kenny and Kyle aren't mature enough.

episodes.name: Cherokee Hair Tampons
episodes.summary: Kyle suffers from a rare kidney disease and Cartman may be the only one who can save him, but at a high price.

episodes.name: Chef Goes Nanners
episodes.summary: Chef protests against the South Park flag and ignites a town debate that even divides the kids. Meanwhile, Wendy becomes attracted to Cartman.

episodes.name: Something You Can Do with Your Finger (a.k.a. Fingerbang)
episodes.summary: Stan, Kyle, Kenny and Cartman form their own band and hold tryouts for a fifth member.

episodes.name: Do the Handicapped Go to Hell? (1)
episodes.summary: The boys, scared by Priest Maxi's threats of eternal damnation, scramble to take part in Holy Communion and their first Confession in order to "save" themselves.

episodes.name: Probably (2)
episodes.summary: Satan can't decide between his new boyfriend and his former beau, Saddam Hussein. Meanwhile, Cartman has discovered his evangelical side and tries to ensure the gang a passage to heaven.

episodes.name: Fourth Grade
episodes.summary: The fearful boys speculate on the identity of their teacher as they begin the fourth grade, leading them to build a time machine to take them back to the safety of third grade.

episodes.name: Trapper Keeper
episodes.summary: Mr. Garrison orders a recount when the race for kindergarten president is too close to call. Meanwhile, a life form from the future appears in the school yard at South Park Elementary.

episodes.name: Helen Keller! The Musical
episodes.summary: The boys work on a Thanksgiving pageant about Helen Keller and decide to use a turkey instead of a dog.

episodes.name: Pip (a.k.a. Great Expectations)
episodes.summary: The boys' British classmate, Pip, stars in this spoof of Dickens' classic "Great Expectations," set in London.

episodes.name: Fat Camp
episodes.summary: Cartman is sent to a camp for obese youngsters by concerned family and friends. Meanwhile, Kenny has his own hit TV show, "Krazy Kenny." Also, Chef talks to the boys about prostitution.

episodes.name: The Wacky Molestation Adventure
episodes.summary: Cartman becomes South Park's mayor when the kids take over the town.

episodes.name: A Very Crappy Christmas
episodes.summary: The boys make a video Christmas card when Mr. Hankey's visit is delayed.

episodes.name: It Hits the Fan
episodes.summary: The boys realize they may have made history of some sort when Cartman utters an expletive.

episodes.name: Cripple Fight
episodes.summary: The boys join the Mountain Scouts with Timmy, who winds up in a fight with Jimmy in a supermarket parking lot.

episodes.name: Super Best Friends
episodes.summary: A magician persuades Kenny, Cartman and Kyle to join his cult, and their journey lands them in Washington, D.C.

episodes.name: Scott Tenorman Must Die
episodes.summary: Radiohead plays a role in Cartman's plan for revenge against an eighth-grader who wronged him.

episodes.name: Terrance and Phillip: Behind the Blow
episodes.summary: The boys are devastated to learn that their heroes Terrence and Phillip have broken up.

episodes.name: Cartmanland
episodes.summary: Cartman uses his $1 million inheritance to open his own amusement park.

episodes.name: Proper Condom Use
episodes.summary: The impulsive implementation of sex-education classes at school leads to an all-out battle between the boys and the girls.

episodes.name: Towelie
episodes.summary: The gang tries to protect a new resident in South Park from the government.

episodes.name: Osama Bin Laden Has Farty Pants
episodes.summary: The boys decide to get into the patriotic spirit by heeding the President's advice to send money to the children of Afghanistan. But their spirits sour when they receive a package back and their mail becomes the focus of Government investigators.

episodes.name: How to Eat with Your Butt
episodes.summary: As a prank, Cartman somehow gets Kenny's picture pasted on milk cartons as a missing child, which soon backfires on him.

episodes.name: The Entity (a.k.a. The Ginger Device)
episodes.summary: Kyle is embarrassed by his cousin, Kyle, and tries to think of ways to avoid him in front of his friends.

episodes.name: Here Comes the Neighborhood
episodes.summary: Kyle, Stan, Kenny and Cartman have a run-in with Token, the town's only rich kid. In retaliation, Token encourages other wealthy people to move into the neighborhood.

episodes.name: Kenny Dies
episodes.summary: Cartman discovers the benefits of stem-cell research.

episodes.name: Butters' Very Own Episode
episodes.summary: Butters looks forward to his parents' anniversary dinner despite his mother's reaction to his father's secret extracurricular activities.

episodes.name: Jared Has Aides
episodes.summary: The gang seizes upon an opportunity to make money with a weight-loss program that's sweeping the country.

episodes.name: Asspen
episodes.summary: The boys head to Aspen, where the slopes are superb and Stan gets into a showdown with the lodge's expert skier.

episodes.name: Freak Strike
episodes.summary: The gang decides to put Butters up as a guest on a talk show thinking that they will get special favors.

episodes.name: Fun with Veal
episodes.summary: After learning how veal is made, the boys try to save some calves from the slaughterhouse.

episodes.name: The New Terrance and Phillip Movie Trailer
episodes.summary: The boys look forward to the newest Terrance and Phillip movie.

episodes.name: Professor Chaos
episodes.summary: When Butters is rejected by the kids, his alter ego Professor Chaos is unleashed.

episodes.name: The Simpsons Already Did It
episodes.summary: Cartman and the gang fear that they may have accidentally caused a death.

episodes.name: Red Hot Catholic Love
episodes.summary: A priest visits South Park to find out why church attendance is down; the boys protest the tinkering of their favorite movies.

episodes.name: Free Hat
episodes.summary: The boys try to prevent filmmakers from remaking their movies, but their efforts are mistaken for a campaign for the release of an infamous criminal.

episodes.name: Bebe's Boobs Destroy Society
episodes.summary: When Bebe starts to mature physically, the boys behave so boorishly that their friendships are almost ruined.

episodes.name: Child Abduction is Not Funny
episodes.summary: Media stories about kidnappings drive South Park parents to extreme measures, such as building a wall around the town to keep out predators.

episodes.name: A Ladder to Heaven
episodes.summary: Trying to find Kenny in Heaven, the boys discover that Saddam Hussein may have hidden weapons there.

episodes.name: The Return of the Fellowship of the Ring to the Two Towers
episodes.summary: While returning "The Lord of the Rings" to the video store, the boys accidentally get a hold of a steamy porno tape.

episodes.name: Death Camp of Tolerance
episodes.summary: The boys are sent to a camp where cultural sensitivity is taught.

episodes.name: The Biggest Douche in the Universe
episodes.summary: Cartman takes desperate measures to try to rid himself of Kenny's spirit, including traveling to Scotland.

episodes.name: My Future Self 'n' Me
episodes.summary: Stan is forced to look at his life 30 years in the future; Cartman tries to launch a new business.

episodes.name: Red Sleigh Down
episodes.summary: Cartman tries to score some points with Santa Claus by asking him to deliver presents to the needy children in Iraq.

episodes.name: Cancelled
episodes.summary: The boys are abducted by aliens, who inform them that Earth is actually a reality show that is about to be canceled by intergalactic media moguls.

episodes.name: Krazy Kripples
episodes.summary: The kids become embroiled in the life of a disabled celebrity who breezes through town and gets all the attention.

episodes.name: Toilet Paper
episodes.summary: The boys are under investigation for covering their teacher's house with toilet paper.

episodes.name: I'm a Little Bit Country
episodes.summary: The foul-mouthed youngsters return for a seventh season.

episodes.name: Fat Butt and Pancake Head
episodes.summary: Jennifer Lopez and Ben Affleck come to town.

episodes.name: Lil' Crime Stoppers
episodes.summary: The guys start their own detective agency.

episodes.name: Red Man's Greed
episodes.summary: The boys try to save the town from developers.

episodes.name: South Park is Gay!
episodes.summary: The whole town suddenly discovers it's all the rage to be gay.

episodes.name: Christian Rock Hard
episodes.summary: Cartman puts together a band; Stan, Kyle and Kenny get into trouble for downloading music from the Internet.

episodes.name: Grey Dawn
episodes.summary: The boys try to have South Park's senior citizens stripped of their driver's licenses after they go on a dangerous rampage.

episodes.name: Casa Bonita
episodes.summary: Cartman seeks revenge for not being invited to Kyle's birthday outing.

episodes.name: All About the Mormons?
episodes.summary: Mormon neighbors move into town, causing the citizens of South Park to become Mormons themselves.

episodes.name: Butt Out
episodes.summary: The guys rebel after an anti-smoking campaign begins at their school.

episodes.name: Raisins
episodes.summary: When Stan's girlfriend breaks up with him, his friends try to cheer him up by bringing him to a local restaurant where lovely ladies hang out.

episodes.name: It's Christmas in Canada
episodes.summary: Ike's Canadian birth parents come back to claim him, prompting the residents of South Park to collect money to get him back.

episodes.name: Good Times with Weapons
episodes.summary: After buying some martial arts objects at a market, the boys turn into Japanese warriors to take on their enemy, Prof. Chaos.

episodes.name: Up the Down Steroid
episodes.summary: Steroids become an issue as Timmy, Jimmy and Cartman train for a sporting event.

episodes.name: The Passion of the Jew
episodes.summary: "The Passion of the Christ" has an unusual effect on Stan, Cartman, Kyle and Kenny.

episodes.name: You Got F**ked in the Ass
episodes.summary: Stan tries to put together a group of competitive dancers to challenge some rivals from Orange County.

episodes.name: AWESOM-O
episodes.summary: Cartman disguises himself as a robot so he can learn secrets about Butters to use against him.

episodes.name: The Jeffersons
episodes.summary: A mysterious gentleman and his son create controversy in South Park.

episodes.name: Goobacks
episodes.summary: South Park becomes flooded with time travelers from the future.

episodes.name: Douche and Turd
episodes.summary: The kids have to choose a new mascot after an animal-rights group protests.

episodes.name: Something Wall-Mart This Way Comes
episodes.summary: South Park is invaded by a giant shopping center that threatens the quiet little town.

episodes.name: Pre-School
episodes.summary: Cartman, Butters, Kenny, Stan and Kyle fear that a secret may get out when an old adversary turns up in town.

episodes.name: Quest for Ratings
episodes.summary: Cartman becomes a network honcho when he and the boys launch a morning news show on the school's closed-circuit TV station.

episodes.name: Stupid Spoiled Whore Video Playset
episodes.summary: South Park is abuzz over a visit from a famous socialite.

episodes.name: Cartman's Incredible Gift
episodes.summary: Cartman is imbued with the power to see into the future after he's hit on the head.

episodes.name: Woodland Critter Christmas
episodes.summary: Woodland creatures ask Stan to help them build a manger.

episodes.name: Mr. Garrison's Fancy New Vagina
episodes.summary: In the season 9 premiere, Mr. Garrison looks to become a woman, and Kyle works in improving his basketball skills.

episodes.name: Die Hippie, Die
episodes.summary: Hippies, the bane of Cartman's existence, threaten to overrun South Park when they plan a weeklong music festival in town.

episodes.name: Wing
episodes.summary: Cartman, Kenny, Stan and Kyle become talent agents with one client.

episodes.name: Best Friends Forever
episodes.summary: Kenny is able to purchase a gaming device that's been sold out, straining his friendship with Cartman.

episodes.name: The Losing Edge
episodes.summary: The boys become bored with baseball after a long winning streak.

episodes.name: The Death of Eric Cartman
episodes.summary: Butters believes he can talk to the dead.

episodes.name: Erection Day
episodes.summary: Jimmy has trouble controlling his hormones right before the big talent show.

episodes.name: Two Days Before the Day After Tomorrow
episodes.summary: The town of Beaverton is flooded when a mammoth beaver dam breaks. Is global warming to blame? Only Stan and Cartman know for sure.

episodes.name: Marjorine
episodes.summary: The boys decide to fake Butters' death and resurrect him as a girl.

episodes.name: Follow That Egg
episodes.summary: Townsfolk rally against gay marriage, especially Mr. Garrison, whose ex Mr. Slave plans to wed Big Gay Al.

episodes.name: Ginger Kids
episodes.summary: Ostracized for his appearance because of a case of "gingervitus," Cartman goes on a campaign against discrimination.

episodes.name: Trapped in the Closet
episodes.summary: Religious leaders think Stan is the "Golden Child," prompting believers to camp in front of his house.

episodes.name: Free Willzyx
episodes.summary: Kyle bonds with a marine-park whale and gets the boys to help try to return the creature to its family.

episodes.name: Bloody Mary
episodes.summary: After his drunken-driving arrest, Stan's dad believes a visit to a bleeding statue of the Virgin Mary will cure his drinking problem.

episodes.name: The Return of Chef
episodes.summary: Chef Jerome McElroy returns, though the kids notice he's not quite the same.

episodes.name: Smug Alert!
episodes.summary: Stan leads a campaign to purchase hybrid cars, but it stalls when an environmental disaster threatens the town.

episodes.name: Cartoon Wars (1)
episodes.summary: Kyle and Cartman race to Hollywood, with the fate of Kyle's favorite cartoon, "Family Guy," at stake.

episodes.name: Cartoon Wars (2)
episodes.summary: Kyle is injured and Cartman must forge on alone, determined to stop the makers of "Family Guy."

episodes.name: A Million Little Fibers
episodes.summary: Oprah picks Towelie's memoir for her book club, but his account is found to be less than truthful. Soon, the public derision lures Towelie off the wagon.

episodes.name: ManBearPig
episodes.summary: Cartman finds treasure when the boys get stuck in a cave.

episodes.name: Tsst
episodes.summary: Cartman's mom employs the Dog Whisperer to help curb her son's behavioral problems.

episodes.name: Make Love, Not Warcraft
episodes.summary: The gang attempts to save the online game World of Warcraft after it is taken over by a renegade gamer.

episodes.name: Mystery of the Urinal Deuce
episodes.summary: The gang discovers who's responsible for the 9/11 attacks and realizes South Park may be in danger.

episodes.name: Miss Teacher Bangs a Boy
episodes.summary: Cartman is tapped to be the new hallway monitor and takes offense when Kyle discovers a teacher is having an affair with a student in his jurisdiction.

episodes.name: Hell on Earth 2006
episodes.summary: Satan tries to plan a Halloween party while dealing with a religious group, an ex-lover and mischievous serial killers.

episodes.name: Go God Go (1)
episodes.summary: South Park residents clash over the teaching of evolution. Meanwhile, Cartman attempts time travel so he can play a soon-to-be-released video-game system.

episodes.name: Go God Go XII (2)
episodes.summary: Cartman tries to escape a dystopian future plagued by militant otters and a lack of video games.

episodes.name: Stanley's Cup
episodes.summary: Stan Marsh has hit rock bottom. He's got no job, no bicycle and his only way out of a bad situation is to coach the local pee wee hockey team. Once a hotshot pee wee hockey player himself, Marsh has tried to put those days behind him. But he's still living with the memory of how he let his team down when he missed the winning shot in the big game. Now, he's about to find out that being a coach means facing your past. He's determined to show his kids what it's like to be winners!

episodes.name: With Apologies to Jesse Jackson
episodes.summary: Randy Marsh is publicly chastised for using the N-word on national television. Meanwhile, Cartman clashes with a little person.

episodes.name: Cartman Sucks
episodes.summary: Butters is sent to a religious camp that promotes a heterosexual lifestyle.

episodes.name: Lice Capades
episodes.summary: th Park Elementary deals with a head-lice scare, and Cartman looks to expose the kids with infected scalps.

episodes.name: The Snuke
episodes.summary: lary Clinton makes a campaign stop in South Park. Meanwhile, Cartman believes he's uncovered a terrorist plot.

episodes.name: Fantastic Easter Special
episodes.summary: Stan searches for the origins of egg decorating, and falls in with a strange society guarding an infamous secret.

episodes.name: D-Yikes
episodes.summary: Ms. Garrison gets dumped again, so the boys decide to hire someone to remedy the situation.

episodes.name: Night of the Living Homeless
episodes.summary: The homeless population is on the rise in South Park. Both the adults and children go to work looking for solutions to the problem.

episodes.name: Le Petit Tourette
episodes.summary: Cartman pretends to have Tourette's syndrome in order to say whatever he wants.

episodes.name: More Crap
episodes.summary: Randy Marsh becomes a local hero after passing a sizable bowel movement. Later, he contacts a record-keeping society to find out if he has surpassed the world record.

episodes.name: Imaginationland (1)
episodes.summary: The boys enter a dimension containing the world's imagination. Before long, the government taps them for intelligence.

episodes.name: Imaginationland (2)
episodes.summary: Pentagon officials pressure Kyle and Stan to reveal how they gained access to Imaginationland. Meanwhile, Cartman searches for Kyle in order to make him fulfill his side of the leprechaun bet.

episodes.name: Imaginationland (3)
episodes.summary: Stan and Butters attempt to escape Imaginationland before the government detonates a nuclear device in the alternate dimension. Meanwhile, Cartman takes his bet with Kyle to the Supreme Court.

episodes.name: Guitar Queer-o
episodes.summary: Stan and Kyle become a successful Guitar Hero duo. After they part ways, Stan succumbs to the pitfalls of rock stardom.

episodes.name: The List
episodes.summary: The boys discover a secret list compiled by their female classmates that rates them according to looks.

episodes.name: Tonsil Trouble
episodes.summary: In the 12th-season premiere, Cartman faces an uncertain future after a routine tonsillectomy reveals a more serious condition.

episodes.name: Britney's New Look
episodes.summary: The boys meet Britney Spears while she's on a search for seclusion in the Colorado mountains, and Stan and Kyle eventually take on the responsibility of getting her to the North Pole.

episodes.name: Major Boobage
episodes.summary: Suspicions by friends and family of Kenny's drug use play out in an homage to the 1981 animated fantasy "Heavy Metal."

episodes.name: Canada on Strike
episodes.summary: When Canada goes on strike, the boys find themselves in the thick of negotiations for a settlement, and the void in U.S. jobs is filled by replacements from Denmark. Meanwhile, Terrance and Phillip are on the fence about joining the strike, but are shocked by its fiscal consequences.

episodes.name: Eek, a Penis!
episodes.summary: Cartman takes over Ms. Garrison's class when the teacher's personal crisis causes her to be removed from the classroom.

episodes.name: Over Logging
episodes.summary: When a lack of Internet access in South Park sparks panic in the community, Randy takes his family to California in search of a signal.

episodes.name: Super Fun Time
episodes.summary: A class trip to a living museum that recreates 1800s Colorado leads to a hostage situation for some of the boys.

episodes.name: The China Probrem
episodes.summary: Butters stands with Cartman as he confronts the Chinese after a tragic event.

episodes.name: Breast Cancer Show Ever
episodes.summary: Wendy courts trouble when she vows to beat up Cartman after school.

episodes.name: Pandemic (1)
episodes.summary: Cartman enlists the help of rival Craig when the boys spot an easy opportunity for financial gain from a global crisis.

episodes.name: Pandemic (2): The Startling
episodes.summary: The boys discover the reason for the global attacks by oversize guinea pigs, but first they have to find their way out of the Andes.

episodes.name: About Last Night...
episodes.summary: South Park residents join the rest of the country in celebrating the election of a U.S. president, who moves a new administration into the White House ahead of schedule.

episodes.name: Elementary School Musical
episodes.summary: The boys are startled to learn that their popularity at school is waning when they fail to submit to the latest fad, which actually makes Butters cooler than they are.

episodes.name: The Ungroundable
episodes.summary: In the 12th-season finale, vampire sightings at school anger the Goth kids, who are upset when they become indistinguishable from the bloodsucking interlopers in the eyes of their peers.

episodes.name: The Ring
episodes.summary: In the 13th-season premiere, Kenny gets less than he bargained for when he takes his new girlfriend to a Jonas Brothers concert.

episodes.name: The Coon
episodes.summary: Rival vigilantes battle for supremacy as crime-fighting icons of the town.

episodes.name: Margaritaville
episodes.summary: Randy's solution to fix the economy finds enthusiastic support in the community and revolutionizes the way people live their lives.

episodes.name: Eat, Pray, Queef
episodes.summary: An April Fools' joke goes bad, inspiring fear and fury among the boys.

episodes.name: Fishsticks
episodes.summary: Cartman helps Jimmy with a comedy routine that becomes the sensation of the year until it's time to take credit for the joke.

episodes.name: Pinewood Derby
episodes.summary: Randy pulls out all the stops to make sure that Stan wins first place in the annual Pinewood Derby

episodes.name: Fatbeard
episodes.summary: Buoyed by news of pirates in Somalia, Cartman hatches a plan to run away to live the life of a buccaneer.

episodes.name: Dead Celebrities
episodes.summary: Kyle seeks help from paranormal experts when his little brother is haunted by ghosts.

episodes.name: Butters' Bottom Bitch
episodes.summary: Butters hopes his first kiss will put an end to his friends' ridicule.

episodes.name: W.T.F.
episodes.summary: The boys aspire to be professional wrestlers after seeing their first match live.

episodes.name: Whale Whores
episodes.summary: Stan vows to save the dolphins after a family visit to an aquarium in Denver on his birthday is marred by a mass slaughter of aquatic mammals.

episodes.name: The F Word
episodes.summary: The boys take action when a motorcycle festival takes over the town.

episodes.name: Dances with Smurfs
episodes.summary: Cartman is selected to read the morning announcements at school, but he turns the forum into a bully pulpit to unleash criticism of the student-body president.

episodes.name: Pee
episodes.summary: In the 13th-season finale, the boys' trip to a local water park comes with apocalyptic overtones.

episodes.name: Sexual Healing
episodes.summary: In the 14th-season premiere, scientific testing reveals that some of the fourth-grade boys are sex addicts.

episodes.name: The Tale of Scrotie McBoogerballs
episodes.summary: After being assigned to read a book that was once banned, the boys are inspired to collaborate on one of their own.

episodes.name: Medicinal Fried Chicken
episodes.summary: When a store selling medical marijuana opens on the site of Cartman's favorite fried-chicken joint, Randy is first in line to buy some weed. But he can't because he's completely healthy. Meanwhile, Cartman will stop at nothing to get the restaurant back.

episodes.name: You Have 0 Friends
episodes.summary: Kyle turns to Stan for help with a Facebook crisis.
South Park is the target of a class-action lawsuit on behalf of all the vengeful celebrities who have been mocked by the town.
The identity of Cartman's dad is on everyone's mind despite threats from the ginger kids about Muhammad and enraged celebrities who have harnessed the power of Mecha Streisand.

episodes.name: Crippled Summer
episodes.summary: Jimmy and Timmy go to summer camp with a winner-take-all attitude in a variety of contests, including Jimmy's participation in a surfing competition. Towelie faces an intervention for his addictions.

episodes.name: Poor and Stupid
episodes.summary: Cartman's dream to become a NASCAR driver comes true, with Butters as his pit boss.

episodes.name: It's a Jersey Thing
episodes.summary: Randy spearheads the town's defense when "Jersey Shore"-inspired Garden State residents are threatening to take over the entire country.

episodes.name: Insheeption
episodes.summary: Stan talks to Mr. Mackey about his hoarding disorder, but learns the guidance counselor has problems with the same compulsion.

episodes.name: Coon 2: Hindsight
episodes.summary: The Coon leads a group of crimefighters who spring into action to help victims of another drilling catastrophe in the Gulf.

episodes.name: Mysterion Rises
episodes.summary: The identity of Mysterion is revealed when the Coon, abandoned by his crime-fighting cohorts, seeks revenge in the Gulf.

episodes.name: Coon vs. Coon & Friends
episodes.summary: Cthulhu does Cartman's bidding, leaving Coon & Friends at his mercy; Kenny's curse presents a dilemma.

episodes.name: Crème Fraiche
episodes.summary: In the 14th-season finale, Randy's addiction to the Food Network has a detrimental effect on his family.

episodes.name: HUMANCENTiPAD
episodes.summary: The 15th season begins with the launch of a revolutionary tablet computer, though Cartman is feeling left out of the technology craze.

episodes.name: Funnybot
episodes.summary: Jimmy hosts the Special Ed department's inaugural Comedy Awards, but a comment about the Germans' sense of humor gets the school in hot water.

episodes.name: Royal Pudding
episodes.summary: Canadian-born Ike shares his country's obsession with a royal wedding and offers his services when the princess-to-be is abducted.

episodes.name: T.M.I.
episodes.summary: Cartman is sent to anger-management therapy when he's upset after personal information about the boys is posted on the school bulletin board.

episodes.name: Crack Baby Athletic Association
episodes.summary: Cartman hatches a plan to help babies who are born addicted to drugs

episodes.name: City Sushi
episodes.summary: Butters gets diagnosed with multiple personality disorder, and he's prescribed medication.

episodes.name: You're Getting Old
episodes.summary: Stan's outlook on life begins to change after his 10th birthday, but it also affects his friendships with the other kids, who find they have little in common with him anymore.

episodes.name: Ass Burgers
episodes.summary: Stan's stuck in an abnormal rut; Cartman suspects he has Asperger's syndrome.

episodes.name: The Last of the Meheecans
episodes.summary: Cartman fancies himself an agent of the U.S. Border Patrol when the boys play Texans vs. Mexicans.

episodes.name: Bass to Mouth
episodes.summary: A hacker wreaks havoc with gossipy Web posts on a site called "The South Park Elementary Eavesdropper."

episodes.name: Broadway Bro Down
episodes.summary: Randy turns into a huge fan of Broadway shows after he takes Sharon to see a hit musical in Denver.
Cartman's lack of physical fitness makes him a target for the other kids' scorn.

episodes.name: A History Channel Thanksgiving
episodes.summary: The boys learn what really happened at the first Thanksgiving—including an extraterrestrial presence—from a TV documentary.

episodes.name: The Poor Kid
episodes.summary: In the 15th-season finale, the arrest of Kenny's parents sends him and his two siblings into the foster-care system, but the situation creates a dilemma for Cartman, who is left without a target to mock for being the poorest kid in school.

episodes.name: Reverse Cowgirl
episodes.summary: Tragedy strikes when one of the boys repeatedly ignores reminders about leaving the toilet seat up in the Season 16 premiere.

episodes.name: Cash for Gold
episodes.summary: Cartman targets a specific—and vulnerable—clientele when he starts his own shopping channel for gems, while Stan researches the value of a piece of jewelry that was a gift from his grandfather.

episodes.name: Faith Hilling
episodes.summary: An evolutionary development poses a grave threat to humanity.

episodes.name: Jewpacabra
episodes.summary: The town's Easter-egg hunt may be canceled due to rumors of a vicious beast that Cartman claims to have caught on film.

episodes.name: Butterballs
episodes.summary: Stan organizes an antibullying video when Butters is tormented by an unlikely predator.

episodes.name: I Should Have Never Gone Ziplining
episodes.summary: The boys try zip-lining in the Colorado mountains on the last day of spring break, but their adventure takes a dangerous, life-threatening turn.

episodes.name: Cartman Finds Love
episodes.summary: A romance for Cartman may finally become a reality when there's a new girl at school.

episodes.name: Sarcastaball
episodes.summary: Randy's campaign to prevent head injuries in football radically changes the way the game is played, but the new rules become a national sensation and even make a South Park student a star athlete.

episodes.name: Raising the Bar
episodes.summary: Cartman finally comes to the realization that he's overweight, but declares that the solution is to ride around on a mobility scooter. Also: Cartman learns he has a rival in a young reality-TV star.

episodes.name: Insecurity
episodes.summary: Kyle suspects that his mother is having an affair with a deliveryman; Cartman installs a home-security system.

episodes.name: Going Native
episodes.summary: When Butters starts acting out at school, his parents realize it's time to tell him why he's not like all of the other kids. He must travel to a foreign place to learn the ways of his people. It will be a difficult trip for a young boy to make alone, so Butters chooses Kenny to travel with him to the distant and secluded island of Hawaii.

episodes.name: A Nightmare on Face Time
episodes.summary: The boys' plans to go trick-or-treating as their comic-book heroes, the Avengers, hit a snag when Stan's dad needs his son's help with a new business venture.

episodes.name: A Scause for Applause
episodes.summary: An icon is implicated in a doping scandal, so supporters start cutting off their symbolic wristbands.

episodes.name: Obama Wins!
episodes.summary: In the series 16 finale, Cartman believes he can affect the outcome of the 2012 presidential election.

episodes.name: Let Go, Let Gov
episodes.summary: In the Season 17 premiere, Cartman infiltrates the National Security Agency and is upset by what he finds in his personal file. Meanwhile, Butters finds a new audience for his prayers.

episodes.name: Informative Murder Porn
episodes.summary: The boys try to keep their parents from hurting one another by using a distraction in the form of the game "Minecraft."

episodes.name: World War Zimmerman
episodes.summary: Token is deemed a threat to all humanity by Cartman.

episodes.name: Goth Kids 3: Dawn of the Posers
episodes.summary: A goth kid is sent to a camp for troubled youth, but upon her return her friends find her changed in disturbing ways, so they turn to an unlikely group for help.

episodes.name: Taming Strange
episodes.summary: Ike just isn't himself lately and he and Kyle are growing apart. Kyle goes to the guidance counselor for advice, but Mr. Mackey is too busy dealing with the bugs in the school's new integrated technology system to help. Kyle decides to take Ike to a live performance of his favorite show, "Yo Gabba Gabba!" He hopes it'll make his little brother like him again.

episodes.name: Ginger Cow
episodes.summary: Cartman facilitates world peace with his latest prank, which brings religious leaders to South Park to witness the fulfillment of a Biblical prophecy.

episodes.name: The Black Friday Trilogy
episodes.summary: It's the biggest Black Friday sale in history. The boys are divided over which gaming device to buy and a bloody battle will determine whether Xbox or Sony will be the winner.

episodes.name: A Song of Ass and Fire
episodes.summary: Console wars escalate as throngs of shoppers push toward the mall in anticipation of Black Friday. Meanwhile, Cartman seeks revenge against Princess Kenny.

episodes.name: Titties and Dragons
episodes.summary: The war over gaming devices begins as the malls open for the holiday-shopping craze.

episodes.name: The Hobbit
episodes.summary: Wendy plays matchmaker by trying to pair one of her gal pals with Butters, only to end up in the counselor's office.

episodes.name: Go Fund Yourself
episodes.summary: The group attempt to make a kickstarter company to raise money instead of going to school. The episode focuses on kickstarter and how people can make money before producing a product.

episodes.name: Gluten Free Ebola
episodes.summary: After the group attempted a kickstarter company in a previous episode they are hated by everyone else at school so attempt to throw a party whilst the town is thrown into chaos over the threat of gluten.

episodes.name: The Cissy
episodes.summary: Stan is searching for answers about how a person who he's always known to be one thing could suddenly identify with another. In the meantime, the pressure of holding on to a giant secret is starting to get to Randy.

episodes.name: Handicar
episodes.summary: Handicapped driven vehicles compete with taxi's and other vehicles. The company entitled "Handicar" with the lead driver being Timmy.

episodes.name: The Magic Bush
episodes.summary: A scandalous invasion of privacy makes the South Park denizens edgy as Cartman and Butters get in possession of a drone.

episodes.name: Freemium Isn't Free
episodes.summary: Stan's addicted to a new app marketed by Terrance and Phillip, but the duo find that all the money they're making can't buy happiness.

episodes.name: Grounded Vindaloop
episodes.summary: Butters is convinced that he's living in a virtual reality. When he suddenly goes rogue and wreaks havoc at home and all over South Park, everyone struggles to figure out what's real.

episodes.name: Cock Magic
episodes.summary: Kenny excels at playing the game, Magic: The Gathering. He has the boys' full attention until a new, hard-core activity gets in the way. When Wendy tries to get Stan to pay attention to what she's doing, she realizes that what he does with his guy friends always comes first.

episodes.name: #rehash
episodes.summary: Randy's forced to perform again after Stan spends all the Marsh's money on freemium games; Kyle gets upset when Ike doesn't want to play with him anymore.

episodes.name: #HappyHolograms
episodes.summary: Kyle plans a holiday special for TV in hopes of bringing families together again with help from some of the biggest names in entertainment. Meanwhile, Cartmaaan Bra is still trending as holograms continue to run rampant in South Park.

episodes.name: Stunning and Brave
episodes.summary: There is a new principal at the helm of South Park Elementary. He forces the boys to confront the damage they've done through their history of racism and unconscious bias.

episodes.name: Where My Country Gone?
episodes.summary: Tired of illegal immigrants continuously crossing over the border into the United States without any repercussions, Mr. Garrison wants a wall to be built to keep them out of the country.

episodes.name: The City Part of Town
episodes.summary: Kenny tries to land a job when the town of South Park begins gentrifying.

episodes.name: You're Not Yelping
episodes.summary: Cartman considers himself the top on-line restaurant reviewer in South Park.

episodes.name: Safe Space
episodes.summary: Cartman is the latest victim of Body Shaming.

episodes.name: Tweek x Craig
episodes.summary: The news of a romantic relationship between Tweek and Craig hits South Park Elementary.

episodes.name: Naughty Ninjas
episodes.summary: A game of Ninja Warriors is led by Kenny and attracts attention from foreign terrorists. Meanwhile, the citizens of South Park decide they don't need a police department anymore.

episodes.name: Sponsored Content
episodes.summary: Jimmy challenges PC Principal when the budding newsman is flagged for inappropriate language in the school paper.

episodes.name: Truth and Advertising
episodes.summary: PC Principal disappears along with 2 fourth grade students. The latest news in the school paper sets the boys on a search to find their two missing classmates. Being the crack reporter that he is, Jimmy sets out to learn everything he can about what makes Leslie tick. Meanwhile, Principal Victoria and Mr. Garrison return to a South Park that has become unrecognizable

episodes.name: PC Principal Final Justice
episodes.summary: Kyle has chosen a dangerous alliance over his friendship with Stan.

episodes.name: Member Berries
episodes.summary: An American icon gives the National Anthem a reboot.

episodes.name: Skank Hunt
episodes.summary: An online troll threatens to have global implications as Cartman professes his innocence.

episodes.name: The Damned
episodes.summary: Gerald basks in the thrill of media attention as he continues to troll everyone.

episodes.name: Wieners Out
episodes.summary: Kyle feels guilty for the tension between the boys and the girls, but Butters brings his gender together to stand up for their rights. Meanwhile, Gerald is worried that his cover may be blown.

episodes.name: Douche and a Danish
episodes.summary: Garrison finally goes too far at a rally and reconsiders his future in politics. Meanwhile, the kids begin searching for an infamous Internet troll; and Gerald joins the opposition to a Danish campaign tracking nefarious characters on the Web.

episodes.name: Fort Collins
episodes.summary: An entire city in Colorado gets hacked. Gerald and Cartman may lose everything when their complete history of internet activity becomes public.

episodes.name: Oh Jeez
episodes.summary: PC Principal plays peacemaker between the girls and the boys one more time. Meanwhile, the election results are in, and Gerald is confronted by the Troll Hunter.

episodes.name: Members Only
episodes.summary: The new President-elect visits his hometown.

episodes.name: Not Funny
episodes.summary: Cartman becomes convinced that Butters wants to steal his girlfriend.

episodes.name: The End of Serialization as We Know It
episodes.summary: Cartman finally understands why Heidi wants him to get to Mars.

episodes.name: White People Renovating Houses
episodes.summary: Protestors armed with tiki torches and confederate flags take to the streets of South Park; Randy comes to grips with what it means to be white in today's society.

episodes.name: Put It Down
episodes.summary: North Korea takes aim at South Park. While Craig and Tweek have problems trying to find a place to hide.

episodes.name: Holiday Special
episodes.summary: Everyone is going crazy as Columbus Day gets canceled and the kids try to bring it back as they would have a free day.

episodes.name: Franchise Prequel
episodes.summary: Facebook is the ultimate weapon for Professor Chaos.

episodes.name: Hummels & Heroin
episodes.summary: Beloved entertainers are being cut down in their prime due to massive overdoses of opiates. Stan is about to be exposed as the source of the illegal drugs.

episodes.name: Sons a Witches
episodes.summary: This year at the traditional Halloween get together, a witch casts a spell that terrorizes the town and ruins Halloween for the boys. Cartman sees a way to use the witch's power to his advantage.

episodes.name: Doubling Down
episodes.summary: Kyle is playing with fire when he gets in the middle of Cartman and Heidi's relationship.

episodes.name: Moss Piglets
episodes.summary: Timmy and Jimmy's science project has caught the attention of some very important people who think it can save the world.

episodes.name: Super Hard PCness
episodes.summary:
It's never been more challenging to be a PC Principal.

Witness the return of Terrance and Philip via the power of Netflix! Kyle isn't impressed. Meanwhile, PC Principal falls in love with the new Vice-Principal...

episodes.name: Splatty Tomato
episodes.summary: The children of South Park claim to have seen Mr. Garrison lurking around town, and the townspeople are angry that the president is scaring their kids.

episodes.name: Dead Kids
episodes.summary: With several shooting occurring at South Park Elementary School, Randy attempts to get Sharon to get her emotions in check. Meanwhile, Cartman is mad after realizing he flunked his math quiz, despite copying his answers off Token's quiz.

episodes.name: A Boy and a Priest
episodes.summary: A very special relationship has developed between Butters and the Parish Priest. When the town finds the church doors locked and no sign of the pair, they call in the Catholic Church.

episodes.name: The Problem with a Poo
episodes.summary: Mr. Hankey's offensive behavior puts him in jeopardy of being fired as the Director of the Annual Christmas Pageant.

episodes.name: Tegridy Farms
episodes.summary: The Vaping epidemic hits South Park Elementary

episodes.name: The Scoots
episodes.summary: The kids plan to use the latest revolution in mobility to get more candy on Halloween than they have ever gotten before.

episodes.name: Time to Get Cereal
episodes.summary: The boys realize they need Al Gore's help when dead citizens start popping up all over town.

episodes.name: Nobody Got Cereal?
episodes.summary: The boys break out of jail and are on the run from the police and ManBearPig.

episodes.name: Buddha Box
episodes.summary: In "Buddha Box," Cartman discovered a foolproof way to tune out the rest of the world and enjoy some quality time on his phone.

episodes.name: Unfulfilled
episodes.summary: The citizens of South Park are enjoying all the perks of being a company town when the Amazon Fulfillment Center moves in. Everything is just swell until the contradictions inherent in capitalism threaten to bring the entire system down.

episodes.name: Bike Parade
episodes.summary: The Bike Parade is still on, but the boys' chance of winning is in jeopardy when Kenny resists commercialism in solidarity with the Amazon Fulfillment Center's striking workers.

episodes.name: Mexican Joker
episodes.summary: Randy fights against home-grown. Meanwhile, Kyle goes to camp.

episodes.name: Band in China
episodes.summary: Randy sees an opportunity for Tegridy in China.

episodes.name: Shots!!!
episodes.summary: Randy celebrates the success of Tegridy Farms; Cartman refuses to get a shot.

episodes.name: Let Them Eat Goo
episodes.summary: The citizens of South Park are moving toward a completely plant-based diet. Cartman is pretty sure the new food in the cafeteria gave him a heart attack.

episodes.name: Tegridy Farms Halloween Special
episodes.summary: It's Halloween and Randy is dealing with his daughter's marijuana problem. Butters gets an unexpected surprise when he visits the Egyptian Artifact exhibit at the Denver Museum.

episodes.name: Season Finale
episodes.summary: The Mayor has evidence that Randy blew up his neighbor's yards in protest over homegrown weed and then blamed it on a Mexican Joker. Now the citizens of South Park have had enough of Randy and Tegridy Farms and they just want to lock him up.

episodes.name: Board Girls
episodes.summary: The annual Strong Woman competition pushes everyone to their limits.

episodes.name: Turd Burglars
episodes.summary: Kyle's mom has a fecal transplant and the boys are on a quest for the best microbiome.

episodes.name: Basic Cable
episodes.summary: Scott Malkinson's future with the new girl in his class depends on him getting the latest and greatest streaming platform. Scott's dad works for the local cable company and refuses to move beyond basic cable.

episodes.name: Christmas Snow
episodes.summary: It's a bleak Christmas Season in South Park this year and it's all Santa's fault. He is single handedly stealing the joy from the holiday. The town just wants their Christmas Spirit back but that will take a Christmas miracle.

name: Family Guy
summary: Family Guy follows Peter Griffin the endearingly ignorant dad, and his hilariously offbeat family of middle-class New Englanders in Quahog, RI. Lois is Peter's wife, a stay-at-home mom with no patience for her family's antics. Then there are their kids: 18-year-old Meg is an outcast at school and the Griffin family punching bag; 13-year-old Chris is a socially awkward teen who doesn't have a clue about the opposite sex; and one-year-old Stewie is a diabolically clever baby whose burgeoning sexuality is very much a work in progress. Rounding out the Griffin household is Brian the family dog and a ladies' man who is one step away from AA.

episodes.name: Death Has a Shadow
episodes.summary: Peter ignores his wife's warning about a bachelor party. Voices include Seth MacFarlane, Alex Borstein, Seth Green and Phil LaMarr.

episodes.name: I Never Met the Dead Man
episodes.summary: Peter (voice of Seth MacFarlane) learns to live without TV when he crashes his car into a satellite dish. Meanwhile, Stewie devises a climate-control machine.

episodes.name: Chitty Chitty Death Bang
episodes.summary: The Griffins prepare for Stewie's first birthday party, but the precocious lad hatches a plan of his own.

episodes.name: Mind Over Murder
episodes.summary: Under house arrest, Peter builds a bar in the basement to have his friends over. And the joint is jumpin', much to Lois' dismay.

episodes.name: A Hero Sits Next Door
episodes.summary: When Peter's neighbor---an award-winning ballplayer and cop---makes him feel inadequate, Peter tries to become a hero.

episodes.name: The Son Also Draws
episodes.summary: On their way to New York, the Griffins take a wrong turn and end up at a Native American gambling casino, where luck proves to be no lady for Lois (voice of Alex Borstein). Comic Bobby Slayton provides the voice of a pit boss named Lenny.

episodes.name: Brian: Portrait of a Dog
episodes.summary: Brian leaves home after his refusal to perform during a dog show prompts a rift with Peter, who later sees Brian whisked away to the pound, where he's marked for death.

episodes.name: Peter, Peter, Caviar Eater
episodes.summary: The Griffins are movin' on up (to a Newport mansion, specifically), when Lois inherits a "weekend house" from a rich aunt. Robin Leach provides his own voice in a "Lifestyles of the Rich and Famous" spoof.

episodes.name: Holy Crap
episodes.summary: Peter's dour and devout 80-year-old father (voice of Colm Meaney) moves in with the Griffins after he retires from the mill where he has worked for 50 years. He's a hellfire-and-damnation man, and he thinks family is heading south.

episodes.name: DaBoom
episodes.summary: The Griffins usher in the Millennium with a bang----a nuclear one. Victoria Principal and Patrick Duffy have cameos (as their "Dallas" characters Pam and Bobby Ewing) in a live-action coda to the program, in which every Y2K bug that can bite Quahog (and the rest of the world) does. But the Griffins survive and head off, "Mad Max"-like, on a sardonic odyssey through post-apocalyptic New England, where Griffin's Law prevails---until Peter shoots himself in the foot.

episodes.name: Brian in Love
episodes.summary: Brian is having "accidents" (on rugs and other places) and seeks out a therapist (voice of Sam Waterston) to find out why. The therapist's conclusion: Brian's in love. The object of his yearning: Lois.

episodes.name: Love Thy Trophy
episodes.summary: Peter and his neighbors enter a float in Quahog's annual Harvest Festival Parade. They win, but then the trophy turns up missing and the winners all suspect each other of stealing it. Meanwhile, Meg (voice of Lacey Chabert) needs $1100 for a purse, so she takes a waitress job, and takes Stewie with her---pretending that she's an unwed mother and Stewie is her crack baby.

episodes.name: Death is a Bitch
episodes.summary: Peter survives a health scare but gets a killer bill. So he writes "deceased" next to his name on a form---and is visited by the Grim Reaper himself. How, Peter wonders, did Death get the form? "It was e-mailed to me by your HMO." But Death must take a forced holiday when he sprains his ankle chasing Peter, who has no desire to go gently into that good night.

episodes.name: The King is Dead
episodes.summary: Lois is named artistic director of the Quahog Players and makes Peter the producer of the troupe's upcoming show, "The King and I." She had to find something for him to do---Peter was complaining about a lack of outlets for his "creativity" (and he certainly can't act).

episodes.name: I Am Peter, Hear Me Roar
episodes.summary: Peter's sense of humor is no laughing matter to the woman who sues him for sexual harassment. He can escape the lawsuit, though---by attending a training session on workplace sensitivity. It's a chance for him to get in touch with his feminine side. Candice Bergen provides the voice of feminist lawyer Gloria Ironbachs.

episodes.name: If I'm Dyin' I'm Lyin'
