Things get even worse when, during the dinner, Bania insists that soup doesn't count as a meal. Meanwhile, Elaine has a British friend stay with her for a week.

episodes.name: The Mom & Pop Store
episodes.summary: George buys a convertible he thinks was once owned by Jon Voight. Kramer tries to save a small shoe-repair business. Elaine answers a radio quiz, enabling Mr. Pitt to participate in the Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade. Meanwhile, Jerry tries to solve the mystery of whether or not he's invited to Tim Whatley's annual Pre-Thanksgiving party.

episodes.name: The Secretary
episodes.summary: George gets a secretary, saying he will go for efficiency and smarts rather than beauty. He hires a librarian-esque woman, only to find himself falling in love with her.

episodes.name: The Race
episodes.summary: Jerry dates a girl named Lois, though her boss is Duncan Meyer, an old high school rival of Jerry's, who Jerry once defeated in a track meet, though Duncan has protested the race ever since, and now wants a rematch. Elaine finds out her boyfriend is a communist, George contacts a personal ad from "The Daily Worker", and Kramer gets a job as a shopping center Santa.

episodes.name: The Switch
episodes.summary: Elaine loans Mr. Pitt's expensive tennis racket to an executive from Doubleday who hints there may be a job opening for Elaine soon. Jerry's girlfriend never smiles or laughs at his jokes but her roommate laughs at everything he says so he contemplates the switch. George's girlfriend, a model, eats a lot but never puts on weight.

episodes.name: The Label Maker
episodes.summary: Tim Whatley gives Jerry a label maker as a thank you for his Super Bowl tickets. George is uncomfortable with his girlfriend's male roommate. Kramer and Newman play a game of Risk.

episodes.name: The Scofflaw
episodes.summary: When George learns that their friend Gary never had cancer as he claimed, he promises to keep it a secret from Jerry. Elaine gets all tied up in knots when she learns that someone said hi to her ex-boyfriend on her behalf. Kramer has a run-in with the local beat cop who tells him there's someone in the neighborhood who has amassed parking tickets for years.

episodes.name: Highlights of a Hundred (1)
episodes.summary: For the series' 100th episode, Jerry Seinfeld hosts a one hour retrospective with clips from previous episodes: the idea for a show about nothing; the smelly car; the puffy shirt; the astronaut pen; Jerry's hair; George's lack of hair; Mulva; Jerry's virgin girlfriend; the Hernandez incident; the outing; the masters of their domain; the bubble boy - are only a few of the episodes included.

episodes.name: Highlights of a Hundred (2)
episodes.summary: For the series' 100th episode, Jerry Seinfeld hosts a one hour retrospective with clips from previous episodes: the idea for a show about nothing; the smelly car; the puffy shirt; the astronaut pen; Jerry's hair; George's lack of hair; Mulva; Jerry's virgin girlfriend; the Hernandez incident; the outing; the masters of their domain; the bubble boy - are only a few of the episodes included.

episodes.name: The Beard
episodes.summary: Elaine attempts to convert a gay man to heterosexuality. Kramer sets George up with a woman and, not having a photograph, describes her to a police sketch artist. Jerry hooks up with a female officer who then has Jerry take a polygraph test on whether or not he's seen the show "Melrose Place."

episodes.name: The Kiss Hello
episodes.summary: Kramer tries to create a Utopian society when he puts up pictures of all the residents of his and Jerry's building. Jerry doesn't mind until the women of the building want to be greeted with a kiss. After Jerry objects to kissing hello, he's vilified and nearly kicked out of the building. Meanwhile, Elaine's friend who is a chiropractor skips out on George's appointment and goes skiing instead, and they have a hard time telling her about her dated hairdo.

episodes.name: The Doorman
episodes.summary: Elaine house-sits for Mr. Pitt. Jerry goes to meet up with her to go to the movies and winds up offending the Doorman. So to make up for it, Jerry watches the door. But when Jerry leaves his post and the couch in the lobby is stolen, Jerry and Elaine formulate a plan to cover their tracks. Meanwhile, Kramer invents a bra for men and George tries to find a way to get his father out of his apartment.

episodes.name: The Jimmy
episodes.summary: The gang has various encounters with a man named Jimmy, who talks about himself in the 3rd person. Jerry suspects Tim Whatley and his assistant are using patients for sexual pleasures. George cuts a deal with Jimmy to sell Jimmy's shoes, but Jimmy gets injured thanks to Kramer's drooling.

episodes.name: The Doodle
episodes.summary: George dates a girl from Elaine's art class and wonders whether or not her humorous caricature of him is a sign that she likes him or not. Thanks to Newman's fleas, Jerry's visiting parents are forced to stay in Elaine's luxury hotel room. Elaine gets a potential job offer but accidentally leaves the manuscript in Jerry's flea-infested apartment.

episodes.name: The Fusilli Jerry
episodes.summary: Kramer gets new license plates, but a DMV screw-up gives him a new vanity license plate. George's mom gets plastic surgery. Jerry tells Puddy about his "move", which he proceeds to use on Elaine.

episodes.name: The Diplomat's Club
episodes.summary: Jerry's new agent thinks he's a celebrity who needs his hand held on every little decision. After she tells him that the pilot who flew the plane to Ithaca is in the audience, Jerry freaks out. Kramer goes to the Diplomat's Club to meet up with Jerry and winds up gambling with a Texas business man on which plane is going to arrive first. Meanwhile, Mr. Pitt puts Elaine in his will, and Mr. Pitt's lawyer has reason to suspect that Elaine is up to something.

episodes.name: The Face Painter
episodes.summary: Jerry scores premium tickets to a New Jersey Devils playoff game. But Jerry gets weirded out when Puddy shows up at the game and paints his face to match the team colors. Kramer enjoys the game so much that he tries to convince Jerry to get more tickets from the guy Jerry got them from. Meanwhile, George decides to tell his girlfriend that he loves her, only to have the plans backfire on him while Kramer battles a chimpanzee at the zoo.

episodes.name: The Understudy
episodes.summary: Jerry begins to date a girl who is an understudy for Bette Midler in her new Broadway musical, Rochelle, Rochelle. Jerry, George and Kramer all play on the Improv softball team and happen to be playing against the cast and crew of Rochelle, Rochelle. Kramer fawns over Bette and Jerry's girlfriend cries about her frankfurter falling on the ground but not about her grandmother dying.

episodes.name: The Engagement
episodes.summary: Elaine has a problem sleeping in her new apartment because of a dog that keeps barking. Meanwhile, George gets back together with Susan Ross, proposes to her, then begins to have seconds thoughts about it. Jerry breaks up with Melanie because of her peculiar eating habits and Kramer's solution to help Elaine includes Newman, a van and a case of dog-napping.

episodes.name: The Postponement
episodes.summary: Feeling overwhelmed, George wants to postpone marrying Susan.

episodes.name: The Maestro
episodes.summary: Elaine dates the conductor of an orchestra who insists everyone calls him "Maestro."

episodes.name: The Wink
episodes.summary: Jerry squirts grapefruit into George's eye at breakfast, and for the rest of the day George is misinterpreted because everyone thinks he is winking at them.

episodes.name: The Hot Tub
episodes.summary: George picks up a bad habit from some visiting baseball officials. During the time of the New York City Marathon, Elaine has an out of country runner as her house guest. The runner had overslept and missed the big race at the last Olympics and Jerry obsesses with ensuring that it doesn't happen again. Kramer gets a hot tub from his friend Lomez, and Elaine has writer's block.

episodes.name: The Soup Nazi
episodes.summary: A soup stand owner obsesses about his customers' ordering procedure, but his soup is so good that people line up down the block for it anyway.

episodes.name: The Secret Code
episodes.summary: George refuses to give anyone his secret code (BOSCO). Kramer buys a police scanner. Jerry does a series of ads for Leapin' Larry's Appliance Store. Elaine has dinner with J. Peterman but after she and Jerry bail on the dinner, George is stuck to dine with Peterman. George spills his secret code to Peterman's dying mother and gets in trouble for it.

episodes.name: The Pool Guy
episodes.summary: Jerry has a hard time telling the pool guy at his new health club that there isn't room for a 5th member of the group. George's worlds collide when Elaine starts hanging out with Susan. Kramer discovers that his phone number is one digit off from that of a popular movie-finding service and offers help to those that mistakenly call his number.

episodes.name: The Sponge
episodes.summary: After learning that her prophylactic of choice is being discontinued, Elaine buys a case of Today sponges and scrutinizes her dates for their sponge-worthiness.

episodes.name: The Gum
episodes.summary: Lloyd Braun comes back from the insane asylum. Kramer takes him under his wing and convinces Jerry to buy gum from him and wear glasses that don't belong to him to prove that Lloyd isn't crazy. George tries to prove to his old neighbor Deena that he isn't crazy after a cashier short changes him.

episodes.name: The Rye
episodes.summary: After George's parents take back the bread they gifted to Susan's parents, George makes Jerry find another loaf and tries to appease Susan's parents by taking them on Kramer's Manhattan horse tours, to disastrous consequences.

episodes.name: The Caddy
episodes.summary: Elaine's former acquaintance Sue Ellen Mischkie returns and angers Elaine by not wearing a bra, in response Elaine buys her a bra for her birthday.  George locks his keys in his car and leaves it in the Yankee parking lot leading Steinbrenner to believe George is putting in late hours.

episodes.name: The Seven
episodes.summary: George meets Susan's cousins. The wife is expecting a baby and they are having a hard time agreeing on the name. George reveals that he wants to name his kid Seven after Mickey Mantle. The cousins like the idea of naming their kid Seven, but nobody else does. Elaine buys an antique bicycle and hurts her neck in the process. Kramer fixes her neck and wants the bicycle in exchange for payment. Jerry's new girlfriend wears the same dress every single day.

episodes.name: The Cadillac (1)
episodes.summary: In this hour-long episode, Jerry decides to buy his father a Cadillac. Unfortunately, doing so puts Morty in the hot seat with the condo board of directors. Meanwhile, thanks to Elaine, George can score a date with "My Cousin Vinny" star Marisa Tomei but Elaine objects because of George's engagement with Susan. Kramer turns the tables on the cable company when they want to disconnect his service.

episodes.name: The Cadillac (2)
episodes.summary: In this hour-long episode, Jerry decides to buy his father a Cadillac. Unfortunately, doing so puts Morty in the hot seat with the condo board of directors. Meanwhile, thanks to Elaine, George can score a date with "My Cousin Vinny" star Marisa Tomei but Elaine objects because of George's engagement with Susan. Kramer turns the tables on the cable company when they want to disconnect his service.

episodes.name: The Shower Head
episodes.summary: Peterman wants Elaine to go to Africa, but when Elaine tests positive for Opium in her physical, that means no dice. George tries to convince his parents to move to Florida so that he finally gets his "buffer zone", but they have problems with Jerry's parents. Kramer and Newman scheme to buy black market shower heads when the building switches to low-flow ones.

episodes.name: The Doll
episodes.summary: George freaks out when he discovers that Susan has a doll that looks exactly like his mother. Jerry decides to use that as a bit on the Charles Grodin show when his prop gets destroyed in his carry-on luggage, but fellow comedian Sally Weaver screws up his bit by bringing him the wrong doll.

episodes.name: The Friars Club
episodes.summary: Jerry has a hard time getting membership in the Friar's Club when the Flying Santos Brothers take his jacket during a show. Meanwhile, Elaine suspects that a new co-worker (Rob Schnieder) is faking a hearing disorder to get out of doing work.

episodes.name: The Wig Master
episodes.summary: Susan's friends are in town for the Broadway production of Joseph And The Amazing Technicolor Dreamcoat. Kramer gets to wear the coat and is mistaken for a pimp in public when he accuses a local parking lot of running a prostitution ring out of his car. Jerry buys a jacket and later returns it for spite. Elaine tries to buy a dress from the same guy Jerry gets the jacket from, but is stunned to learn that he's holding it until Elaine sleeps with him.

episodes.name: The Calzone
episodes.summary: George gets Steinbrenner hooked on eggplant calzones from a local Italian restaurant. But George gets banned from the restaurant when he's accused of stealing from the tip jar. He then asks Kramer to pick up the calzones, but Kramer gets kicked out when he tries to pay with pennies. George's last resort in getting the calzones is Newman who wants a cut of every delivery. Meanwhile, Kramer will only wear clothing if it's straight from the dryer.

episodes.name: The Bottle Deposit (1)
episodes.summary: A garage mechanic steals Jerry's car. Elaine tries to win J. Peterman JFK's presidential golf clubs at an auction. George is asked to work on a mysterious assignment. Kramer and Newman run a recycling scam.

episodes.name: The Bottle Deposit (2)
episodes.summary: A garage mechanic steals Jerry's car. Elaine tries to win J. Peterman JFK's presidential golf clubs at an auction. George is asked to work on a mysterious assignment. Kramer and Newman run a recycling scam.

episodes.name: The Wait Out
episodes.summary: A comment from George ends up causing a married couple to get divorced and Jerry and Elaine to date the soon-to-be exes. Kramer tries wearing jeans.

episodes.name: The Invitations
episodes.summary: It's finally time for George and Susan's wedding. George doesn't think he can go through with the wedding. But when Susan puts George in charge of the wedding invitations, George gets the cheapest ones in the lot, knowing that the glue for the envelopes is cheap. Unfortunately for Susan, the glue is also toxic and licking the envelopes has fatal consequences. Meanwhile, Jerry courts a woman just like him named Janeanne Steinberg and holds up his end of George's "pact".

episodes.name: The Foundation
episodes.summary: George enjoys the single life. Elaine takes over the catalog when J. Peterman suddenly goes missing. Kramer is taking karate lessons.

episodes.name: The Soul Mate
episodes.summary: George thinks the Board of Directors are talking behind his back. Kramer has a crush on Jerry's new girlfriend. Elaine doesn't see the big deal in having a baby.

episodes.name: The Bizarro Jerry
episodes.summary: George uses Susan's death to pick up women. Elaine's new friend is Jerry's exact opposite. Jerry's new girlfriend has manly hands. Kramer pretends to work for an upscale firm.

episodes.name: The Little Kicks
episodes.summary: Jerry is forced to bootleg a movie for Kramer's friend. George tries the "bad boy" image. No one has the heart to tell Elaine that she's a terrible dancer.

episodes.name: The Package
episodes.summary: A mysterious package arrives for Jerry. Elaine is curious about what the doctors are writing in her records. George tries to hit on the cute girl at the "One Hour Photo" place.

episodes.name: The Fatigues
episodes.summary: Jerry's new girlfriend's mentor is dating Bania. Kramer volunteers to host a Jewish singles mixer. George tries to study up on risk management. Elaine promotes a man she is afraid to fire.

episodes.name: The Checks
episodes.summary: Jerry gets hundreds of royalty checks, worth 12 cents each, for appearing on a Japanese TV program and gets writer's cramp. George and Jerry pitch their pilot to Japanese TV executives.

episodes.name: The Chicken Roaster
episodes.summary: Kenny Rogers' Roasters sets up shop across the street from Jerry and Kramer's apartment. Elaine gets comfortable in her position as president of the catalog but is quickly accused of abusing her company credit card benefits. George purposefully leaves a hat at his girlfriend's apartment in hopes that it will score another date.

episodes.name: The Abstinence
episodes.summary: Abstinence allows George to become a genius, but it turns Elaine into an idiot. Jerry gets bumped from career day at his old Jr. High School. Kramer turns his apartment into a smoking lounge and all the smoke disfigures his face.

episodes.name: The Andrea Doria
episodes.summary: A survivor of a shipwreck beats George out of an apartment, so George decides to tell the landlords the tragedies of his life in hopes of getting it back based on pity.

episodes.name: The Little Jerry
episodes.summary: Jerry bounces a check. Kramer buys a live chicken. George dates a female convict. Elaine dates a man who shaves his head.

episodes.name: The Money
episodes.summary: Jerry's parents believe he is financially unstable. Kramer has trouble sleeping with his girlfriend. Elaine enjoys her position as President of the J. Peterman catalog. George hopes to get his parents' money when they die.

episodes.name: The Comeback
episodes.summary: George tries to come up with a good comeback after someone insults him. Elaine falls in love with a mysterious employee at the video store. Kramer wants to die a certain way. Jerry takes advice from a tennis player who stinks.

episodes.name: The Van Buren Boys
episodes.summary: Kramer gets mixed up with a gang when he is mugged by them and mistakenly shows their secret sign.

episodes.name: The Susie
episodes.summary: Kramer sets his watch an hour ahead. George tries to avoid a breakup with his girlfriend. A colleague keeps calling Elaine, Susie. Jerry gambles on a basketball game, but the bookie can't pay him.

episodes.name: The Pothole
episodes.summary: Jerry accidentally drops his girlfriends toothbrush in the toilet. George loses his car keys in a newly paved pothole. Elaine orders food from a restaurant that refuses to deliver to her area. Kramer adopts a highway.

episodes.name: The English Patient
episodes.summary: Elaine is dragged to see the movie "The English Patient" on multiple occasions, even though she absolutely hates the film.

episodes.name: The Nap
episodes.summary: George takes a nap under his desk. Kramer swims in the East River. Jerry has some maintenance done on his kitchen. Elaine's new boyfriend buys her a new mattress.

episodes.name: The Yada Yada
episodes.summary: George's new girlfriend keeps including "Yada Yada" in her stories. Jerry is offended by Tim Whatley's Jewish jokes. Elaine tries to help her friends adopt a baby. Kramer and Mickey fight over two women.

episodes.name: The Millennium
episodes.summary: Kramer and Newman compete during the early planning of each of their millennium parties.

episodes.name: The Muffin Tops
episodes.summary: Elaine opens a new bakery that sells only the tops of the muffins.

episodes.name: The Summer of George
episodes.summary: Unemployed again, George decides to have a "memorable" summer. Jerry's new girlfriend has another dude. Kramer wins a Tony Award. A new girl at work is hostile towards Elaine.

episodes.name: The Butter Shave
episodes.summary: Kramer discovers the amazing yet unknown uses of butter, but accidentally fries himself after using it as sunscreen.

episodes.name: The Voice
episodes.summary: George's colleagues try to force him to leave. Jerry makes fun of his girlfriend's bellybutton. Kramer hires an intern. Elaine gets back together with David Puddy.

episodes.name: The Serenity Now
episodes.summary: Jerry opens up his feelings. Elaine is getting hit on by the Jews. Kramer gets a screen door. George helps his father sell computers.

episodes.name: The Blood
episodes.summary: Jerry's parents hire their friend Izzy Mandelbaum to become Jerry's personal trainer while George decides to associate food and television with his love life.

episodes.name: The Junk Mail
episodes.summary: Kramer is annoyed with the catalogs he keeps getting in the mail. Elaine falls in love with a guy because of his smile. George's parents are avoiding him. Jerry can't find it in his heart to reject a gift from an old school friend.

episodes.name: The Merv Griffin Show
episodes.summary: George runs over a flock of pigeons. Jerry's new girlfriend has a toy collection. A new co-worker is freaking Elaine out. Kramer rebuilds the set of the Merv Griffin Show in his apartment.

episodes.name: The Slicer
episodes.summary: Elaine borrows Kramer's meat slicer to feed her neighbor's cat while George tries to hide his not-so-great past from his new boss.

episodes.name: The Betrayal
episodes.summary: The gang goes to a wedding in India in this special episode told in reverse. Meanwhile, Kramer uses his superstition to try to make sure he won't drop dead.

episodes.name: The Apology
episodes.summary: Jerry dates a nudist, and George seeks an apology from an old friend.

episodes.name: The Strike
episodes.summary: Jerry goes out with a woman who is beautiful one day and ugly the next. Kramer goes back to work at H&H Bagels. George makes up a charity. Elaine gives a fake number to a man.

episodes.name: The Dealership
episodes.summary: Jerry looks to buy a new car from Elaine's boyfriend. George tries to find a snack. Kramer test drives a car.

episodes.name: The Reverse Peephole
episodes.summary: Elaine is embarrassed by Puddy's fur coat. Kramer tries to keep Newman from getting evicted. George carries everything in his wallet. Jerry is through with wallets.

episodes.name: The Cartoon
episodes.summary: Sally Weaver makes fun of Jerry. George's new girlfriend looks just like Jerry. Kramer takes a vow of silence. Elaine gets a job drawing cartoons for the New Yorker.

episodes.name: The Strongbox
episodes.summary: George's new girlfriend refuses to break up with him. Jerry doesn't help out a neighbor. Elaine's new boyfriend is poor. Kramer tries to find a good place to hide his key for his strongbox.

episodes.name: The Wizard
episodes.summary: Jerry goes down to Florida for his father's birthday. George tries to avoid Susan's parents. Elaine can't figure out her new boyfriend's nationality. Kramer decides to retire.

episodes.name: The Burning
episodes.summary: Elaine finds out that Puddy is religious. Kramer pretends to have gonorrhea. Jerry's new girlfriend has a tractor story to tell him. George wants everyone at work to like him.

episodes.name: The Bookstore
episodes.summary: George is forced to buy a book he brought into the bathroom. Jerry finds out that his Uncle Leo is a shop lifter. Elaine doesn't want to be known as the office skank. Kramer and Newman start a Hong Kong rickshaw business.

episodes.name: The Frogger
episodes.summary: George tries to acquire an old Frogger machine on which he's held the top score since high school.

episodes.name: The Maid
episodes.summary: Jerry winds up dating the maid he hired, and she starts to slack off on her duties.

episodes.name: The Puerto Rican Day
episodes.summary: Jerry, George, Kramer and Elaine get stuck in standstill traffic due to the massive Puerto Rican Day Parade.

episodes.name: The Clip Show (1) (a.k.a. The Chronicle (1))
episodes.summary: Just as the four are about to go to the movies, Jerry looks back on the past nine years with the audience.

episodes.name: The Clip Show (2) (a.k.a. The Chronicle (2))
episodes.summary: Just as the four are about to go to the movies, Jerry looks back on the past nine years with the audience.

episodes.name: The Finale (1)
episodes.summary: After George and Jerry land a production deal with NBC, the four head out for Paris on NBC's private plane and are waylaid in a small Massachusetts town.

episodes.name: The Finale (2)
episodes.summary: After George and Jerry land a production deal with NBC, the four head out for Paris on NBC's private plane and are waylaid in a small Massachusetts town.

name: The Walking Dead
summary:
The Walking Dead tells the story of the months and years that follow after a zombie apocalypse. It follows a group of survivors, led by former police officer Rick Grimes, who travel in search of a safe and secure home. As the world overrun by the dead takes its toll on the survivors, their interpersonal conflicts present a greater danger to their continuing survival than the walkers that roam the country. Over time, the characters are changed by the constant exposure to death and some grow willing to do anything to survive.

Based on the comic book series of the same name by Robert Kirkman, Tony Moore, and Charlie Adlard.

episodes.name: Days Gone Bye
episodes.summary: Rick searches for his family after emerging from a coma into a world terrorized by the walking dead. Morgan and Duane, whom he meets along the way, help teach Rick the new rules for survival.

episodes.name: Guts
episodes.summary: Rick unknowingly causes a group of survivors to be trapped by walkers. The group dynamic devolves from accusations to violence, as Rick must confront an enemy far more dangerous than the undead.

episodes.name: Tell It to the Frogs
episodes.summary: Rick makes a decision to go back to Atlanta to retrieve the bag of guns and save a man's life. Lori and Shane must deal with the surprising return of someone they thought was dead.

episodes.name: Vatos
episodes.summary: Rick's mission to Atlanta is jeopardized when things go awry. Jim becomes unhinged in camp.

episodes.name: Wildfire
episodes.summary: Rick leads the group to the CDC after the attack. Jim must make a terrible life and death decision

episodes.name: TS-19
episodes.summary: Rick and the group are allowed into the CDC by a strange doctor. But all is not what it seems in their newfound haven.

episodes.name: What Lies Ahead
episodes.summary: After the CDC explosion, the survivors are still on the move when they encounter a herd of walkers that separates one of their own, leading them to a possible safe haven.

episodes.name: Bloodletting
episodes.summary: Coming to the aid of another, Rick discovers a possible safe haven. Shane must go on a dangerous mission to get badly needed medical supplies.

episodes.name: Save the Last One
episodes.summary: The group desperately awaits Shane's return. Shane finds himself trapped in a school, surrounded by the undead. Daryl and Andrea search for someone in the woods.

episodes.name: Cherokee Rose
episodes.summary: Shane makes a deadly sacrifice which leads to unusual behavior and self-distancing. The rest of the group tries to hang on somewhere between living to die and dying to live.

episodes.name: Chupacabra
episodes.summary: Glenn, the only one breaking barriers between both groups, knows far too much for his comfort level. Daryl finds a sign of life and, in his delirium, tries to make it back to the farm alive.

episodes.name: Secrets
episodes.summary: Secrets are told and secrets are revealed. Hershel refuses to acknowledge the world’s new reality. Andrea comes out of her shell. Everyone is becoming more and more aware that “everything is food for something.”

episodes.name: Pretty Much Dead Already
episodes.summary: Hershel sets a deadline. All secrets are out in the open. Glenn stands up for himself and Shane takes charge.

episodes.name: Nebraska
episodes.summary: Rick and the others try to restore order in the aftermath of a terrible discovery. Hershel takes up an old habit and disappears, Rick and Glenn must follow him into town.

episodes.name: Triggerfinger
episodes.summary: Trapped, Rick, Hershel and Glenn fight to survive against new foes, both dead and alive. Shane finds Lori in danger on the road and makes it his mission to bring her back to the farm.

episodes.name: 18 Miles Out
episodes.summary: Rick and Shane come into conflict over the fate of an outsider. Andrea helps Hershel's youngest daughter face a crucial decision.

episodes.name: Judge, Jury, Executioner
episodes.summary: Rick sides with Shane on an important decision, causing Dale to worry that the group is losing its humanity. Carl's actions have unintended consequences on the group.

episodes.name: Better Angels
episodes.summary: The group learns that someone dangerous may be on the loose near the farm. As night falls, Rick, Shane, Daryl and Glenn comb the woods to handle the situation and keep the group safe.

episodes.name: Beside the Dying Fire
episodes.summary: Rick and Carl return from the woods to find the farm in jeopardy. The group is split up in the ensuing chaos. With things looking grim, Rick’s leadership is questioned.

episodes.name: Seed
episodes.summary: With the world growing increasingly more dangerous and Lori’s pregnancy advancing, Rick discovers a potentially safe haven. But first he must secure the premises, pushing his group to its limit.

episodes.name: Sick
episodes.summary: After a traumatic event, a life hangs in the balance. Complicating matters, the group must also deal with a potential threat to their new surroundings.

episodes.name: Walk with Me
episodes.summary: After witnessing an accident, Andrea and Michonne are introduced to a new community of survivors. As conflicts arise with their new acquaintances, a decision must be made.

episodes.name: Killer Within
episodes.summary: The group is severed and lives are put in jeopardy. In Woodbury, Merle has a request for the Governor.

episodes.name: Say the Word
episodes.summary: After another loss, Rick struggles. Michonne remains suspicious of the Governor as he throws a party with a unique twist for the people of Woodbury.

episodes.name: Hounded
episodes.summary: As Andrea grows closer to the Governor, Michonne makes a decision about Woodbury. Glenn and Maggie go on a run. Rick struggles.

episodes.name: When the Dead Come Knocking
episodes.summary: The Governor presses for information. A new guest arrives at the prison, forcing Rick's hand.

episodes.name: Made to Suffer
episodes.summary: Andrea steps up as the people of Woodbury are thrown into uncharted territory. At the prison, a new threat arises.

episodes.name: The Suicide King
episodes.summary: Rick tries to rescue a member of his group. Woodbury is in disarray after a recent attack. New guests raise concerns at the prison.

episodes.name: Home
episodes.summary: As the group debates their next course of action, Rick wanders after a lost friend. Daryl and Merle question their choices. The Governor restores order in Woodbury and makes plans to punish those responsible.

episodes.name: I Ain't a Judas
episodes.summary: Their security threatened, Rick and the group must make a choice. With Woodbury in a police state, Andrea grows uneasy.

episodes.name: Clear
episodes.summary: Realizing they are heavily outgunned against the Governor's forces, Rick leads an expedition to get more weapons.

episodes.name: Arrow on the Doorpost
episodes.summary: In an effort to prevent any more deaths, Rick and the Governor meet to come up with a peace treaty.

episodes.name: Prey
episodes.summary: The Governor chases a dissenter who fled Woodbury. While the Governor is gone, a traitor tries to sabotage his upcoming plans.

episodes.name: This Sorrowful Life
episodes.summary: Rick and the group are faced with a serious problem. If they want a truce with the Governor, they will have to make a huge sacrifice.

episodes.name: Welcome to the Tombs
episodes.summary: Rick and the group have to seriously consider if the prison is worth defending as the Governor's impending attack looms over their heads.

episodes.name: 30 Days Without an Accident
episodes.summary: Rick and the group are as close to an ideal life as possible at the prison. Will they be able to hold on to humanity in the face of a new evil?

episodes.name: Infected
episodes.summary: As the group faces a brand new enemy, Rick and the others must fight to protect the livelihood they worked so hard to create at the prison.

episodes.name: Isolation
episodes.summary: As one group leaves the prison in search for supplies at a local college, those who stay must deal with recent losses while preserving what remains.

episodes.name: Indifference
episodes.summary: While on a supplies mission to a local college, members of the group run into multiple hurdles. Things at the prison are getting worse.

episodes.name: Internment
episodes.summary: Multiple enemies put pressure on Rick and the group. Could this finally be the breaking point for the survivors and the prison?

episodes.name: Live Bait
episodes.summary: A familiar face returns as each member of the group struggles to find his or her humanity in a world of constant threats.

episodes.name: Dead Weight
episodes.summary: A new and scary chapter is unfolding at a camp outside the prison. Will peace be attainable with the addition of new members?

episodes.name: Too Far Gone
episodes.summary: Just when everything started to calm down at the prison, Rick and his group now face imminent danger and destruction. This time, they might not win.

episodes.name: After
episodes.summary: As Rick deals with old wounds, members of the prison have to come to terms with their new environment and ask themselves if survival alone is enough.

episodes.name: Inmates
episodes.summary: The group encounters many obstacles in their quest to find stability and safety, but sometimes all they have to guide them is hope.

episodes.name: Claimed
episodes.summary: The group encounters many obstacles in their quest to find stability and safety, but sometimes all they have to guide them is hope.

episodes.name: Still
episodes.summary: Faced with the day-to-day survival of life outside shelter, a simple request by someone in the group leads to a bizarre but enlightening mission.

episodes.name: Alone
episodes.summary: As one group finds what may be an ideal shelter, another group comes to realize that the best protection comes from those around them.

episodes.name: The Grove
episodes.summary: After finding an idyllic place to establish a new shelter, the group starts to question whether it is possible to go back to the way things were.

episodes.name: Us
episodes.summary: However brutal some survivors believe they must be to stay alive, we get to see that faith can sometimes be the strongest survival tool.

episodes.name: A
episodes.summary: As multiple paths collide, Rick comes face to face with sheer brutality. Will he and the group have what it takes to survive?

episodes.name: No Sanctuary
episodes.summary: The true motives of the Terminans come to light when Rick and the others end up in a vulnerable situation.

episodes.name: Strangers
episodes.summary: With supplies running low and not knowing whether to trust the people around them, Rick leads a mission where the risk might not be worth the reward.

episodes.name: Four Walls and a Roof
episodes.summary: Rick and the group find themselves pitted against some very nasty people, but they might just have a plan to gain the upper hand.

episodes.name: Slabtown
episodes.summary: In this episode, we get to meet a whole group of other survivors, but what looks safe and nice on the outside has a bit of a dark side.

episodes.name: Self Help
episodes.summary: A new set of issues confront our group while on a mission. Will they be able to push through and survive these challenges? Or better yet, each other?

episodes.name: Consumed
episodes.summary: Cautiously, members of our group must venture into a familiar location on a heroic rescue mission. It's a huge stage, but so are the stakes.

episodes.name: Crossed
episodes.summary: Between holding down the church and going on a rescue mission, our group is spread pretty thin. Is this going to be the breaking point?

episodes.name: Coda
episodes.summary: Rick seeks a peaceful agreement when rules and morals are tossed aside by new enemies.

episodes.name: What Happened and What's Going On
episodes.summary: After the recent trials the group has faced, a slight detour could be the solution they've been searching for.

episodes.name: Them
episodes.summary: Life on the road has left the group beaten and beleaguered. Will they be able to trudge along? Are they even the same people they once were?

episodes.name: The Distance
episodes.summary: After a spectacular storm, Rick and the group meet a seemingly friendly person.

episodes.name: Remember
episodes.summary: Molding into a new lifestyle is proving difficult for the group. Has life on the road proven too treacherous to go back to who they once were?

episodes.name: Forget
episodes.summary: Rick and the group continue to acclimate to their new surroundings. Will they be able to go back to normalcy? Better yet, what is normal now?

episodes.name: Spend
episodes.summary: While trying to secure their new home, Rick and his group face many challenges, some life threatening. Is this really the utopia it seems to be?

episodes.name: Try
episodes.summary: The group realizes that sheltered life might not be possible as life within the walls starts to mimic life outside. Will these setbacks break Rick?

episodes.name: Conquer
episodes.summary: Daryl experiences trouble on a run while Rick and his group continue to feel like outsiders in Alexandria, where trouble is creeping into the gates.

episodes.name: First Time Again
episodes.summary: Rick and the others have a difficult time assimilating into Alexandria; a new threat arises that could bring the group closer together.

episodes.name: JSS
episodes.summary: When it appears that things are starting to normalize in the settlement, a new problem arises for the Alexandrians.

episodes.name: Thank You
episodes.summary: Rick and his group get caught up in a dangerous little town on the road back to Alexandria. Meanwhile, Daryl, Sasha and Abraham continue to lead away the remaining walkers away from the safe-zone.

episodes.name: Here's Not Here
episodes.summary: A new face appears; trust issues form.

episodes.name: Now
episodes.summary: Following a number of setbacks, the mood in Alexandria grows grim for the sheltered citizens.

episodes.name: Always Accountable
episodes.summary: Daryl, Abraham and Sasha encounter many obstacles and a new threat while trying to return to Alexandria.

episodes.name: Heads Up
episodes.summary: Alexandria is finally able to begin pulling itself back together; peace is embraced between the two groups.

episodes.name: Start to Finish
episodes.summary: After having a few moments of peace, trouble finds its way to Alexandria yet again. Only this time, the threat might be too big to defeat.

episodes.name: No Way Out
episodes.summary: With walkers inside the gates of Alexandria, Rick and the group are scared, outnumbered and things are only getting worse.

episodes.name: The Next World
episodes.summary: A simple scavenging run proves to be more tricky, when the survivors are not the only ones after a goldmine of supplies.

episodes.name: Knots Untie
episodes.summary: After Rick comes to the realization that Alexandria might not be as safe as he thought, decisions must be made about where to go from here.

episodes.name: Not Tomorrow Yet
episodes.summary: Rick and the group realize the only way to maintain the peace of Alexandria is to fight a new enemy. This time, though, our group might be outmatched.

episodes.name: The Same Boat
episodes.summary: With no hope of safety in Alexandria, Rick and his band of survivors soon discover a larger world with new dangers and new opportunities.

episodes.name: Twice as Far
episodes.summary: Two separate groups leave Alexandria for supplies, and while both worry over the future of the community, they will face immediate danger.

episodes.name: East
episodes.summary: When someone goes missing in Alexandria, the community goes on alert, and search parties venture out.

episodes.name: Last Day on Earth
episodes.summary: In the aftermath of a tragic blow, Eugene falls captured by Dwight, a member of the Saviors, whom are hell bent on getting even with Alexandria, Negan teaches Rick and co a brutal lesson, which shows that Rick and co finally have something to fear.

episodes.name: The Day Will Come When You Won't Be
episodes.summary: Last season ended with Rick and our group kneeling helplessly before Negan and his group; what Negan does will haunt those who survive forever.

episodes.name: The Well
episodes.summary: For a number of familiar faces, a new, well-established community seems too good to be true.

episodes.name: The Cell
episodes.summary: A new group of survivors seem to have it all in their impressive community; however, there is a price.

episodes.name: Service
episodes.summary: The remaining members of the group try to keep it together in Alexandria; they receive a sobering visit.

episodes.name: Go Getters
episodes.summary: Saddled with grief and surrounded by enemies, members of the group try to find safety at the Hilltop before it's too late.

episodes.name: Swear
episodes.summary: Someone stumbles upon a brand new society, and this society is unlike anything seen before.

episodes.name: Sing Me a Song
episodes.summary: A deeper look at the Sanctuary and the world of the Saviors; members of Alexandria look for supplies.

episodes.name: Hearts Still Beating
episodes.summary: Negan's unwelcome visit to Alexandria continues as other members scavenge for supplies; things quickly spin out of control.

episodes.name: Rock in the Road
episodes.summary: Rick is introduced to a new community.

episodes.name: New Best Friends
episodes.summary: While searching for a missing Alexandrian, Rick and his group encounter a mysterious collective, its inhabitants unlike any they have come across.

episodes.name: Hostiles and Calamities
episodes.summary: An Alexandrian discovers they must navigate the mysterious, confusing and terrifying world within the Saviors' compound.

episodes.name: Say Yes
episodes.summary: The group scavenges for supplies; back in Alexandria, someone must make a morally challenging decision.

episodes.name: Bury Me Here
episodes.summary: Things do not go as planned when a group of Kingdommers delivers goods to the Saviors during a routine supply drop-off.

episodes.name: The Other Side
episodes.summary: The Saviors visit the Hilltop unexpectedly, surprising everyone, with plans of taking more than supplies.

episodes.name: Something They Need
episodes.summary: A group of Alexandrians embarks on a journey; one member of the group must make a heartbreaking decision.

episodes.name: The First Day of the Rest of Your Life
episodes.summary: The stakes continue to grow higher as paths cross; the group enacts an intricate plan.

episodes.name: Mercy
episodes.summary: Rick and his group, along with the Kingdom and Hilltop, have banded together to bring the fight to Negan and the Saviors.

episodes.name: The Damned
episodes.summary: The plan involving Alexandrians, Kingdommers and Hilltoppers unfolds; as Rick continues to fight, he encounters a familiar face.

episodes.name: Monsters
episodes.summary: Conflict with the Saviors leads to unintended consequences for the Hilltop, the Kingdom, and Alexandria; morality proves tricky in wartime.

episodes.name: Some Guy
episodes.summary: A new weapon in the Savior arsenal proves to be a giant hurdle as fighting continues between Rick's forces and those of the Saviors.

episodes.name: The Big Scary U
episodes.summary: A close look at Negan and the lives of the Saviors during the conflict through a familiar set of eyes.

episodes.name: The King, the Widow, and Rick
episodes.summary: With things looking up for Rick and the group, an argument breaks out at the Hilltop; the consequences of the decision are life versus death.

episodes.name: Time for After
episodes.summary: Negan has to enlist the help of his lieutenants in solving a huge issue facing the Sanctuary; Rick and the group continue to enact the plan.

episodes.name: How It's Gotta Be
episodes.summary: Every story and battle from the first half of the season comes crashing together in this action-packed, emotional mid-season finale.

episodes.name: Honor
episodes.summary: Rick faces new difficulties after a battle. Meanwhile, the fight continues in other communities as core members face hard decisions.

episodes.name: The Lost and the Plunderers
episodes.summary: Groups unite their forces and converge on the Hilltop; Aaron and Enid search for allies.

episodes.name: Dead or Alive Or
episodes.summary: Daryl finds himself in bad company as his group heads to the Hilltop; Gabriel's faith gets tested.

episodes.name: The Key
episodes.summary: Hilltop's leadership faces a difficult dilemma after the arrival of unexpected visitors; Rick comes face to face with an adversary.

episodes.name: Do Not Send Us Astray
episodes.summary: Trouble arises when unexpected visitors arrive at the Hilltop and the community is thrust into action; heartbreaking discoveries are made.

episodes.name: Still Gotta Mean Something
episodes.summary: A Heaps prisoner makes a discovery; Carol searches for someone in the nearby forest; Rick and Morgan find themselves in the company of strangers.

episodes.name: Worth
episodes.summary: With the threat of the Saviors still looming, Aaron continues searching for allies; Daryl and Rosita take action and confront an old friend.

episodes.name: Wrath
episodes.summary: The communities join forces in the last stand against the Saviors as all-out war unfolds.

episodes.name: A New Beginning
episodes.summary: Rick and his group make a risky run into Washington, D.C. to search for artifacts they will need to build the civilization he and Carl envisioned.

episodes.name: The Bridge
episodes.summary: The communities join forces to restore a bridge that will facilitate communication and trade; someone is gravely injured at the construction site.

episodes.name: Warning Signs
episodes.summary: Rick's vision for the future is threatened by a mysterious disappearance that divides the work camp where the communities are building a bridge.

episodes.name: The Obliged
episodes.summary: Rick's vision of a civilized future is threatened by a sudden reckoning with past sins that remain unavenged and unforgiven.

episodes.name: What Comes After
episodes.summary: Rick is forced to face the past as he struggles to maintain the safety of the communities and protect the future he and Carl envisioned.

episodes.name: Who Are You Now?
episodes.summary: The Survivors encounter unfamiliar faces outside the safety of their community's walls and must decide whether or not this new group can be trusted.

episodes.name: Stradivarius
episodes.summary: Carol seeks out an old friend living alone in a wilderness teeming with walkers; survivors make the perilous trek to a new home.

episodes.name: Evolution
episodes.summary: A small rescue mission braves a dangerous herd in their hunt for a missing comrade, only to discover a surprising threat that could doom them all.

episodes.name: Adaptation
episodes.summary: The communities thought they could build a better future separately, but the recent loss of one of their own drives them to band together; new leaders rise when a disturbing and dangerous threat is unmasked; an escaped captive revisits his past.

episodes.name: Omega
episodes.summary: Daryl learns more about the masked tribe's leader; a search begins for two missing friends.

episodes.name: Bounty
episodes.summary: The savage group led by Alpha confronts the Hilltop in a harrowing attempt to retrieve her daughter. A supply run for the Kingdom turns into a dangerous quest.

episodes.name: Guardians
episodes.summary: While one community struggles to ease tensions that threaten to divide from within, the true nature of another group comes into focus; a mission to rescue a friend has deadly consequences.

episodes.name: Chokepoint
episodes.summary: Daryl's daring rescue mission forces Alpha to unleash a group of her own to retrieve what belongs to her, even if the price is paid in blood; the Kingdom's plans to reunite the communities are put in jeopardy.

episodes.name: Scars
episodes.summary: An outsider's arrival forces Alexandria to rehash devastating old wounds; eye-opening secrets from the past are revealed.

episodes.name: The Calm Before
episodes.summary: The fair at the Kingdom is underway, with all four communities coming together in celebration for the first time in years; while some pacts are renewed, other deals will come at a much steeper price.

episodes.name: The Storm
episodes.summary: In the aftermath of an overwhelming loss, the communities must brave a ferocious blizzard; as one group deals with an enemy from within, another is forced to make a life or death decision.

episodes.name: Lines We Cross
episodes.summary: The Oceanside group continues to train in case the Whisperers return. Tensions are high as our heroes struggle to hold onto their concept of civilization.

episodes.name: We Are the End of the World
episodes.summary: The origins of Alpha and Beta are revealed in a flashback; Alpha tries to help Lydia prepare for their journey with the dead; the Whisperers create herds.

episodes.name: Ghosts
episodes.summary: Alexandria is overcome with paranoia as the threat of the Whisperers looms; Carol struggles over her desperate urge for revenge.

episodes.name: Silence the Whisperers
episodes.summary: Negan feels the brunt of the Alexandrians' fears as their paranoia of the Whisperers grows; a safety issue catches the group off guard at Hilltop.

episodes.name: What It Always Is
episodes.summary: Supplies go missing from Hilltop; Negan is idolized by an Alexandrian; Ezekiel holds a secret.

episodes.name: Bonds
episodes.summary: Carol teams up with Daryl as they embark on a mission together; Siddiq finds it harder than expected to unravel a mystery.

episodes.name: Open Your Eyes
episodes.summary: Daryl becomes uncomfortable when Carol starts going past his boundaries; Alpha and Beta share reservations about a certain individual.

episodes.name: The World Before
episodes.summary: A fight causes tensions in Oceanside while the Alexandrians set out on a high-stakes mission.

episodes.name: Squeeze
episodes.summary: The group must figure out how to get out of a precarious situation.

episodes.name: Stalker
episodes.summary: The group must defend Alexandria from a threatening outside force.

episodes.name: Morning Star
episodes.summary: The Whisperers are coming for Hilltop. After Daryl and Lydia's encounter with Alpha, the communities must decide whether to run or fight. Meanwhile, Eugene's communication with Stephanie gets complicated.

episodes.name: Walk with Us
episodes.summary: Negan helps the Whisperers and Alpha launch an attack against the Hilltop.

episodes.name: What We Become
episodes.summary: Michonne takes Virgil back to his island to find his family; in exchange, Virgil offers weapons.

episodes.name: Look at the Flowers
episodes.summary: Everyone reckons with the aftermath of the Hilltop fire; Eugene leads a trip to meet Stephanie.

episodes.name: The Tower
episodes.summary: The communities prepare to participate in the Whisperer War's last battle; Eugene's group comes face-to-face with Princess.

episodes.name: A Certain Doom
episodes.summary: Beta engages the final battle of the Whisperer War.

name: House of Cards
summary: Based on the BBC miniseries of the same name, House of Cards follows Francis Underwood, the politician's politician – masterful, beguiling, charismatic and ruthless. He and his equally ambitious wife Claire will stop at nothing to ensure their ascendancy. This wicked political drama slithers beneath the curtain and through the back halls of greed, sex, love and corruption in modern Washington D.C.

episodes.name: Chapter 1
episodes.summary: Allegiances are abandoned after a promise is broken in the opener of this drama, which follows a ruthless congressman and his equally ambitious wife as they navigate the corridors of power in Washington, D.C.

episodes.name: Chapter 2
episodes.summary: Francis attacks the White House through the media; Claire makes a cruel decision.

episodes.name: Chapter 3
episodes.summary: Francis deals with a crisis in his home district; Zoe experiences the politics of journalism.

episodes.name: Chapter 4
episodes.summary: Francis takes on leaders in Congress; Peter Russo is forced to choose between politics and family.

episodes.name: Chapter 5
episodes.summary: Francis' fight over an education bill creates unfortunate side effects.

episodes.name: Chapter 6
episodes.summary: Francis battles striking teachers; Claire receives a surprise confession.

episodes.name: Chapter 7
episodes.summary: Francis wins a major victory; Peter faces his past; and Stamper attempts to bury a secret.

episodes.name: Chapter 8
episodes.summary: Francis receives an honor; Peter returns to Philadelphia.

episodes.name: Chapter 9
episodes.summary: Francis and Stamper seek support in Congress.

episodes.name: Chapter 10
episodes.summary: Claire defies Francis; Peter presents an ultimatum.

episodes.name: Chapter 11
episodes.summary: Peter battles personal demons; Francis enters dangerous territory.

episodes.name: Chapter 12
episodes.summary: Francis takes an unexpected detour.

episodes.name: Chapter 13
episodes.summary: Francis desperately tries to keep his plan on track in the Season 1 finale. Later, Claire suffers the consequences of her decisions.

episodes.name: Chapter 14
episodes.summary: The Underwoods face two threats in the Season 2 premiere. Later, Francis grooms his replacement; and Claire goes on the offensive.

episodes.name: Chapter 15
episodes.summary: Francis targets China. Meanwhile, Claire confronts a painful trauma from her past; and Lucas Goodwin presses for the truth.

episodes.name: Chapter 16
episodes.summary: Tensions rise between Francis and Raymond Tusk. Later, a battle in the Senate pits Francis against the Republicans.

episodes.name: Chapter 17
episodes.summary: A terror scare at the Capitol traps Francis with a resentful Donald Blythe. Meanwhile, Claire gives an attention-grabbing live interview.

episodes.name: Chapter 18
episodes.summary: Lucas goes to extreme measures to expose Francis.

episodes.name: Chapter 19
episodes.summary: Francis and Tusk end their alliance. Meanwhile, Lucas must make a difficult choice; and Stamper grows closer to Rachel.

episodes.name: Chapter 20
episodes.summary: The Walkers deepen their friendship with the Underwoods.

episodes.name: Chapter 21
episodes.summary: Claire influences Tricia Walker politically and domestically. Later, Francis has a showdown with Linda Vasquez.

episodes.name: Chapter 22
episodes.summary: Tusk blindsides the Underwoods.

episodes.name: Chapter 23
episodes.summary: Francis tries to finish off Tusk for good. Later, Claire and Jackie Sharp collide.

episodes.name: Chapter 24
episodes.summary: Francis is interrogated. Meanwhile, Stamper wrestles with personal demons.

episodes.name: Chapter 25
episodes.summary: Francis finds himself shut out. Later, Claire makes a difficult sacrifice; and Stamper tries to regain control.

episodes.name: Chapter 26
episodes.summary: Francis faces annihilation in the Season 2 finale. Meanwhile, Stamper ties up loose ends; and Claire feels the repercussions of ruthlessness.

episodes.name: Chapter 27
episodes.summary: A rocky start for the Underwood Presidency. Frank wants to introduce an ambitious jobs program, while Claire sets her sights on the United Nations.

episodes.name: Chapter 28
episodes.summary: Claire's U.N. bid runs into trouble. Frank fights off mutiny with a bold address to the country.

episodes.name: Chapter 29
episodes.summary: The Russian President's state visit becomes a Cold War of wills and some punks heat things up.

episodes.name: Chapter 30
episodes.summary: Claire bypasses Russia at the U.N. Frank tries to outmaneuver a potential challenger and ends up face to face with a higher power.

episodes.name: Chapter 31
episodes.summary: Frank declares war on Congress to jump-start his jobs program. Claire spars with the Russian ambassador.

episodes.name: Chapter 32
episodes.summary: Frank and Claire travel to Moscow to negotiate the return of an imprisoned U.S. citizen. Claire takes a stand that jeopardizes their plans.

episodes.name: Chapter 33
episodes.summary: The damage is done, and the Underwoods must repair it. But deep wounds don't heal fast and sometimes not at all.

episodes.name: Chapter 34
episodes.summary: A hurricane endangers more than just the entire East Coast, and Frank must make a difficult choice.

episodes.name: Chapter 35
episodes.summary: The Jordan Valley erupts in chaos just as Frank's campaign is picking up steam. Claire gets disturbing intel and counsels him.

episodes.name: Chapter 36
episodes.summary: Frank needs to deal with Petrov one on one, while Claire tries to preserve the peacekeeping mission. Sacrifices must be made.

episodes.name: Chapter 37
episodes.summary: Things turn ugly when Frank, Jackie, and Heather square off during their first debate. Tom joins Claire on the campaign trail.

episodes.name: Chapter 38
episodes.summary: The Jordan Valley erupts in chaos just as Frank's campaign is picking up steam. Claire gets disturbing intel and counsels him.

episodes.name: Chapter 39
episodes.summary: In the midst of the Iowa caucuses, Frank and Claire must confront hard truths about each other.

episodes.name: Chapter 40
episodes.summary: Claire's absence causes problems for Frank on the campaign trail amid rumors of a marital rift. Claire tries to strike out on her own.

episodes.name: Chapter 41
episodes.summary: As Claire begins exploring a campaign of her own, she and Frank engage in backdoor political maneuvering. But this time they're not on the same side.

episodes.name: Chapter 42
episodes.summary: Claire joins Frank as he stumps in South Carolina, but he doesn't trust her. A disastrous scandal blindsides Frank's campaign on primary day.

episodes.name: Chapter 43
episodes.summary: Claire threatens Frank. Frank makes a politically bold move that may provoke Russia. An event at a campaign stop changes everything.

episodes.name: Chapter 44
episodes.summary: Claire advises Donald Blythe on dealing with Petrov. Further investigations of Lucas Goodwin dredges up his accusations against Frank.

episodes.name: Chapter 45
episodes.summary: Claire clashes with the Secretary of State over her involvement in negotiations with Russia. Dunbar must choose between her campaign and her ethics.

episodes.name: Chapter 46
episodes.summary: Frank and Claire adjust to their new reality. The search for Frank's running mate begins. Frank starts a campaign to weaken Conway's strong support.

episodes.name: Chapter 47
episodes.summary: Formidable as ever, both Underwoods have their eyes on the big picture as they manipulate a potential running mate and push the gun bill.

episodes.name: Chapter 48
episodes.summary: At the convention, Frank and his team publicly push for Catherine Durant to be chosen as his running mate, but privately pursue a different agenda.

episodes.name: Chapter 49
episodes.summary: As Frank deals with a new threat to his candidacy, Claire has doubts about their plan. Claire faces a difficult decision concerning her mother.

episodes.name: Chapter 50
episodes.summary: Frank ups the ante on the war on terror to counter Conway's public show of strength. Tom joins Claire on the campaign trail.

episodes.name: Chapter 51
episodes.summary: Frank asks Will to help deal with extremists threatening to murder hostages. Hammerschmidt digs deeper into the allegations against Frank.

episodes.name: Chapter 52
episodes.summary: As the hostage situation continues, Claire secretly negotiates with Yusuf al Ahmadi. Frank confronts Hammerschmidt.

episodes.name: Chapter 53
episodes.summary: As Congress debates investigating Frank, he and Claire attempt to stoke fear of terrorism. Tom Yates continues his stay in the White House.

episodes.name: Chapter 54
episodes.summary: Frank and his team work to leverage support in key states by any means necessary. Claire learns some upsetting news about one of Frank's friends.

episodes.name: Chapter 55
episodes.summary: The day before the election, Conway holds a 24-hour Skype session with voters, while Frank and Claire stump in key states and try to discredit him.

episodes.name: Chapter 56
episodes.summary: With a tight race and low voter turnout on Election Day, things look grim for Frank. But he's still got one more trick up his sleeve.

episodes.name: Chapter 57
episodes.summary: Nine weeks after Election Day, the Underwoods work to consolidate their power. Leann tries to track down a missing Aidan Macallan.

episodes.name: Chapter 58
episodes.summary: In the midst of uncertainty, suspected Russian forces take over an American station in Antarctica. Meanwhile, a damaging news leak could hurt Frank.

episodes.name: Chapter 59
episodes.summary: When a crisis forces White House personnel to take shelter in a bunker, Commerce Department official Jane Davis negotiates through back channels.

episodes.name: Chapter 60
episodes.summary: While Frank attends an elite men's weekend gathering to firm up support, Claire deals with a stranded Russian ship and threats from Petrov.

episodes.name: Chapter 61
episodes.summary: Petrov tries to influence affairs in the U.S. Jane discusses her agenda with Claire. With her job at stake, Leann reaches out to a reporter for help.

episodes.name: Chapter 62
episodes.summary: The Underwoods and their team angle to undermine the revived committee investigating Frank. Hammerschmidt's investigation heats up.

episodes.name: Chapter 63
episodes.summary: As the team tries to control fallout from damaging testimony and leaks, everyone is under suspicion and tensions flare between Frank and Claire.

episodes.name: Chapter 64
episodes.summary: Frank attempts to stop Cathy from testifying. With Hammerschmidt sniffing out the truth, the Underwoods throw someone close to them under the bus.

episodes.name: Chapter 65
episodes.summary: In the wake of a surprising announcement, everything at the White House is shaken up. A decision must be made about whether to go to war.

episodes.name: Chapter 66
episodes.summary: As the first woman president, Claire faces increased scrutiny and threats. Sibling power couple Annette and Bill Shepherd attempt to influence policy.

episodes.name: Chapter 67
episodes.summary: Claire clashes with the Shepherds and Mark Usher, who pressure her to sign the Future Act. Doug makes an unexpected move.

episodes.name: Chapter 68
episodes.summary: The Shepherds push Claire on a Supreme Court nomination. Doug works to find a new path for himself. Claire consults with Jane on Syria.

episodes.name: Chapter 69
episodes.summary: As a crisis mounts in Syria, Russian President Viktor Petrov wants to make a deal with Claire. Questions arise about Tom Yates's whereabouts.

episodes.name: Chapter 70
episodes.summary: Claire allows her enemies to think she's incapacitated as they plot to remove her from office. Doug's investigation leads him to uncover a secret.

episodes.name: Chapter 71
episodes.summary: Claire makes staff changes. The Shepherds try to recruit Doug to their side. With Mark facing intense scrutiny, Jane offers advice.

episodes.name: Chapter 72
episodes.summary: While the Shepherd family attempts to diminish Claire's power, Doug goes off the grid but continues angling to advance his agenda.

episodes.name: Chapter 73
episodes.summary: Claire tries to tarnish Frank's legacy. Doug provokes Claire by releasing excerpts from Frank's diary. A rift develops between the Shepherds.

name: Westworld
summary: Westworld is a dark odyssey about the dawn of artificial consciousness and the evolution of sin. Set at the intersection of the near future and the reimagined past, it explores a world in which every human appetite, no matter how noble or depraved, can be indulged.

episodes.name: The Original
episodes.summary: A woman named Dolores is a free spirit in the Old West... and unaware that she's actually an android, programmed to entertain rich guests seeking to act out their fantasies in an idealized vision of the 1880s. However, the people in charge soon realize that their androids are acting in ways that they didn't anticipate.

episodes.name: Chestnut
episodes.summary: Bernard suspects that someone is sabotaging the hosts. Meanwhile, the Man continues his search for the deeper game, and Maeve finds herself in a world of hurt... literally.

episodes.name: The Stray
episodes.summary: Bernard continues to investigate Dolores' supposed malfunction, and realizes that he has something unexpected on his hands. Meanwhile, Robert talks about the early days of the park, and Teddy receives a new role and narrative.

episodes.name: Dissonance Theory
episodes.summary: While Dolores joins William and Logan on their adventure, the Man in Black continues his search for the entrance to the Maze and meets Armistice. Meanwhile, Robert reveals some of his true power to Theresa and advises her to stay out of his way.

episodes.name: Contrapasso
episodes.summary: Dolores takes the first step on her path of discovery by deciding to write a new story for herself... where she isn't the damsel. Meanwhile, Elise discovers the Woodcutter's secret, and Robert pays the Man a visit.

episodes.name: The Adversary
episodes.summary: While Maeve convinces Felix to show her "upstairs," Teddy and the Man close in on the maze. Meanwhile, Bernard and Elsie close in on the identity of the person who is stealing secrets from the park, while Lee meets with a Delos executive director.

episodes.name: Trompe L'Oeil
episodes.summary: While William and Dolores travel to the unclaimed territories, Charlotte and Theresa make plans to force Robert out of the park using Clementine. Meanwhile, Maeve continues her plans to escape Westworld.

episodes.name: Trace Decay
episodes.summary: Bernard tries to cope with what he did under Robert's orders. Meanwhile, William and Dolores find a town, and Maeve remembers more of her past. Meanwhile, the Man reveals his past to Teddy.

episodes.name: The Well-Tempered Clavier
episodes.summary: Bernard forces Robert to take him back into his own memories, while the Man meets with Charlotte. Meanwhile, Dolores escapes the Confederado camp and William gives Logan new orders.

episodes.name: The Bicameral Mind
episodes.summary: Delores finds out the truth about William's fate. Meanwhile, Maeve organizes an escape plan, only to discover that someone else is pulling the strings. And Robert plays the final piece in his grand narrative.

episodes.name: Journey Into Night
episodes.summary: In the aftermath of the host rebellion, the rescue team finds Bernard and the new Head of Operations asks for his help. Meanwhile, Delores promises to show Teddy the truth, and Maeve convinces Lee and Hector to help her find her daughter.

episodes.name: Reunion
episodes.summary: Dolores looks for allies sympathetic to her cause and shows Teddy the truth of his existence. In the past, Dolores gets her first taste of the outside world and William shows her a weapon of mass destruction.

episodes.name: Virtù e Fortuna
episodes.summary: While Delores makes a deal with the Confederados, Maeve and her group find Felix and Sylvester. Meanwhile, a new Guest comes to Westworld, and Bernard has a meeting of minds with Peter.

episodes.name: The Riddle of the Sphinx
episodes.summary: William pays his recuperating father-in-law several visits. Meanwhile, the Man continues to play Robert's game, and Bernard remembers some of his missing time.

episodes.name: Akane No Mai
episodes.summary: While Maeve and her people explore Shogun World, Delores realizes that the Teddy she knows can't be a part of the new world coming.

episodes.name: Phase Space
episodes.summary: Maeve finds her daughter, Delores finds the "real" Teddy, Grace finds her father, and Charlotte and Stubbs find Peter.

episodes.name: Les Écorchés
episodes.summary: Charlotte and Bernard review Bernard's memories to discover what happened to the missing control unit. Meanwhile, Robert has a chat with Bernard, and Maeve confronts her former tormentor.

episodes.name: Kiksuya
episodes.summary: Another of Westworld's Host revolutionaries is revealed. Meanwhile, Emily finds the Man and convinces the Ghost Nation to hand him over to her to ensure his suffering.

episodes.name: Vanishing Point
episodes.summary: The Man learns that his grip on reality isn't what he thought, as he considers how his wife died. Meanwhile, Dolores continues her trek across the park to the Valley Beyond, and Bernard receives another visit from Robert.

episodes.name: The Passenger
episodes.summary: The Man faces a personal reckoning, while Akecheta and the others find the door. Meanwhile, Bernard meets with Robert one last time after choosing how to deal with Dolores.

episodes.name: Parce Domine
episodes.summary: If you're stuck in a loop, try walking in a straight line.

episodes.name: The Winter Line
episodes.summary: People put up a lot of walls. Bring a sledgehammer to your life.

episodes.name: The Absence of Field
episodes.summary: If you don't like what you see in the mirror, don't blame the mirror.

episodes.name: The Mother of Exiles
episodes.summary: The truth doesn't always set you free.

episodes.name: Genre
episodes.summary: Just say no.

episodes.name: Decoherence
episodes.summary: Do a lot of people tell you that you need therapy?

episodes.name: Passed Pawn
episodes.summary: A real friend is one who walks in when the rest of the world walks out.

episodes.name: Crisis Theory
episodes.summary: Time to face the music.
